original: @4b # // thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @4b # // thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: dge sbyong gi k'a ri k'a lnga bcu pa'i tshig gi brjed byang du byas pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi k'a ri k'a lnga bcu pa'i tshig gi brjed byang du byas pa /
translated: A summary of the fifty verses of the Śramaṇa.

original: dper na sa gzhi la sa bon btab nas sa bon la brten nas myu gu /
analyzed: dper na sa gzhi la sa bon btab nas sa bon la brten nas myu gu /
translated: For example, having planted a seed in the ground, a sprout arises in dependence on the seed.

original: myu gu la brten nas 'dab ma /
analyzed: myu gu la brten nas 'dab ma /
translated: In dependence on the sprout, a leaf.

original: 'dab ma la brten nas sdong bu /
analyzed: 'dab ma la brten nas sdong bu /
translated: In dependence on the leaf, a stem.

original: sdod bu la brten nas me tog / me tog la brten nas 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sdod bu la brten nas me tog / me tog la brten nas 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: In dependence on the stem, a flower. In dependence on the flower, a fruit arises.

original: tshul khrims sa gzhi dang 'dra ba la brten nas myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims sa gzhi dang 'dra ba la brten nas myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the ground of morality, the aggregate of meditative stabilization arises, like a sprout and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po byung nas de'i 'og tu me tog lta bu'i shes rab kyi phung po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po byung nas de'i 'og tu me tog lta bu'i shes rab kyi phung po 'byung ngo //
translated: When the aggregate of meditative stabilization arises, after that the aggregate of wisdom arises, like a flower.

original: shes rab kyi phung po byung nas de'i 'og tu rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po 'bras bu lta bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po byung nas de'i 'og tu rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po 'bras bu lta bu 'byung ngo //
translated: When the aggregate of wisdom arises, after that the aggregate of liberation and the aggregate of the vision of the wisdom of liberation arise, like a fruit.

original: de bas na dge ba thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung ba la nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge ba thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims bsrung ba la nan tan bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since morality is the basis for the arising of all virtue, one should strive to maintain morality.

original: dge sbyong gi bslab tshig lnga bcu pa 'di mgo mjug tu bsdu na don rnam pa brgyad kyis 'chad de /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bslab tshig lnga bcu pa 'di mgo mjug tu bsdu na don rnam pa brgyad kyis 'chad de /
translated: This fifty-fold training of the śramaṇa is explained in eight topics, beginning and ending with the following:

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa dang / bslab pa nyams su blang ba dang / snga dro'i dus na las gang bya ba dang / zas kyi bya ba byas pa'i 'og tu las gang bya ba dang / phas pham pa'i gnas dang / bslab pa phra mo'i gnas dang /
analyzed: bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa dang / bslab pa nyams su blang ba dang / snga dro'i dus na las gang bya ba dang / zas kyi bya ba byas pa'i 'og tu las gang bya ba dang / phas pham pa'i gnas dang / bslab pa phra mo'i gnas dang /
translated: The teaching on praise and homage, the practice of training, the activity to be done in the morning, the activity to be done after the meal, the grounds for defeat, the grounds for minor infractions,

original: phyi dro phan chad ji ltar bya ba dang / brgyad pa 'bras bu ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dro phan chad ji ltar bya ba dang / brgyad pa 'bras bu ji ltar bya ba bzhin du bstan pa'o //
translated: how to proceed from the afternoon onward, and the eighth, how to proceed with the result.

original: de la mgon po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la mgon po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, beginning with the phrase “the protector,”

original: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya //
analyzed: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain just the sūtra.

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rang gi lha la bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rang gi lha la bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “I praise and pay homage to my deity” shows the praise and homage to one’s deity.

original: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The verse beginning with “The lion of the Śākyas” shows the praise and homage to the Three Jewels.

original: bdag gi lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung //
analyzed: bdag gi lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung //
translated: The verse beginning with “I will guard the training like my own body” shows the practice of the training.

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bslab pa nyams su blang ba bstan to //🔽nam gyi cha smad ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bslab pa nyams su blang ba bstan to // nam gyi cha smad ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The verse beginning with “In the latter part of the night” shows the practice of the training.

original: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod //
translated: The two verses on generosity show the practice of generosity.

original: ces bya ba yan chad kyis snga dro'i dus @5a * //🔽na las gang bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba yan chad kyis snga dro'i dus @5a * // na las gang bya ba bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “In the morning” shows the practice of the training.

original: man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya //🔽zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya //🔽zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dge ba bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya // zhes bya ba yan chad kyis dge ba bya ba bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “If there is instruction, meditate” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no instruction, meditate” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.

original: brtul zhugs gnas sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽ngag rnams shin tu bsdam par bya //
analyzed: brtul zhugs gnas sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / ngag rnams shin tu bsdam par bya //
translated: The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.🔽The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.

original: zhes pa yan chad kyis phas pham pa'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa yan chad kyis phas pham pa'i gnas bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning with “If there is no one to meditate with” shows the practice of virtue.

original: 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
analyzed: 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
translated: and the flour of barley mixed with water and yeast.

original: zhes bya ba nas bzung nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas bzung nas /
translated: From here up to

original: gus bcas zhes bcas par bya //
analyzed: gus bcas zhes bcas par bya //
translated: “one should be respectful and restrained,”

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bslab pa phra mo rnams bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bslab pa phra mo rnams bstan to //
translated: the minor precepts are taught.

original: lag pa dag par bsnyal nas ni //
analyzed: lag pa dag par bsnyal nas ni //
translated: Having washed one’s hands well,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: from here up to

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya //
translated: “one should do as instructed,”

original: zhes pa yan chad kyis phyi dro phan chad kyi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa yan chad kyis phyi dro phan chad kyi bya ba bstan to //
translated: the activities for the rest of the afternoon are taught.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad nas //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad nas //
translated: How will the afflictions be quickly exhausted

original: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: and the excellent enlightenment be attained?

original: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //🔽zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya // zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: Thus one should be diligent.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi slob ma rnams kyi lha ni dkon mchog gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi slob ma rnams kyi lha ni dkon mchog gsum ste /
translated: Here, the gods of the Buddha’s disciples are the Three Jewels,

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / mgon po thams cad mkhyen zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / mgon po thams cad mkhyen zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la bstod cing phyag 'tshal ba bstan te /
translated: the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha. “The omniscient lord” teaches praising and paying homage to the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas la bstod pa yang gzhan gyi don mdzad pa dang / rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa'i sgo nas bstod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bstod pa yang gzhan gyi don mdzad pa dang / rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa'i sgo nas bstod de /
translated: The praise of the Buddha is a praise in terms of his performance of the benefit of others and his attainment of the perfection of his own goal.

original: de la mgon po zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa ston te /
analyzed: de la mgon po zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa ston te /
translated: Among them, the word “Protector” shows the perfection of the benefit of others.

original: sems can ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams de las thar pa'i skyabs mdzad pa dang / lha dang mir skyes pa skye rga na 'chis gtses pa thams cad kyi skyabs mdzad pas na sangs rgyas la mgon po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams de las thar pa'i skyabs mdzad pa dang / lha dang mir skyes pa skye rga na 'chis gtses pa thams cad kyi skyabs mdzad pas na sangs rgyas la mgon po zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha is called “Protector” because he is the refuge of sentient beings born in the three miserable realms, who are freed from them, and because he is the refuge of all gods and humans tormented by birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the refuge and protector of all sentient beings.

original: de la sems can ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams la ni 'od zer bkye ba dang sprul pa'i sku bstan pa'i sgo nas ngan song las thar par mdzad do //
analyzed: de la sems can ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams la ni 'od zer bkye ba dang sprul pa'i sku bstan pa'i sgo nas ngan song las thar par mdzad do //
translated: Among them, he is the refuge of sentient beings born in the three miserable realms, because he frees them from the miserable realms by emitting light rays and manifesting emanation bodies.

original: lha dang mir skyes pa skye rga na 'chis gtses pa rnams la ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad cing de la bkod nas skye rga na 'chi las thar pa'i sgo nas skyabs mdzad do //
analyzed: lha dang mir skyes pa skye rga na 'chis gtses pa rnams la ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad cing de la bkod nas skye rga na 'chi las thar pa'i sgo nas skyabs mdzad do //
translated: He protects those who are tormented by birth, aging, sickness and death, by explaining the four noble truths to them and establishing them in them.

original: thams cad mkhyen zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa bstan te /🔽phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba @5b la sogs pa ji snyed du shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad ma lus par shes shing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa bstan te / phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba @5b la sogs pa ji snyed du shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad ma lus par shes shing /
translated: The phrase “omniscient one” indicates that he has attained the perfection of his own aim.🔽The Blessed Buddha is omniscient because he knows all things without exception that are to be known, such as the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, etc.

original: de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log par shes pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log par shes pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ste /
translated: And he knows them without error as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: 'di dag bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “I pay homage to the Buddha” should be applied to the following verses as well.

original: chos zhes bya bas ni chos la bstod cing phyag 'tshal bar bstan te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya bas ni chos la bstod cing phyag 'tshal bar bstan te /
translated: The word “dharma” indicates praise and homage to the Dharma.

original: de la chos la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la chos la yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three kinds of Dharma.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bshad pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so ;
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so ;
translated: The Dharma of teaching, the Dharma of practice, and the Dharma of result.

original: / de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni bshad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: / de la gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni bshad pa'i chos so //
translated: The twelve branches of excellent speech are the Dharma of teaching.

original: rang gi la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rang gi la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni sgrub pa'i chos so //
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening are the Dharma of practice.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: Nirvāṇa is the Dharma of result.

original: chos de gsum la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos de gsum la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Homage is paid to these three kinds of Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs la zhes bya bas dge 'dun la bstod pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs la zhes bya bas dge 'dun la bstod pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “to the assembly of noble ones” indicates praise of the Saṅgha.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdig pa'i chos las ring du spangs pa la ni 'phags pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdig pa'i chos las ring du spangs pa la ni 'phags pa zhes bya la /
translated: Those who have abandoned afflictions and evil qualities are called “noble ones.”

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag de lta bu mang po la ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag de lta bu mang po la ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: Many such noble individuals are called “the assembly of noble ones.”

original: de yang mdor na slob pa'i gang zag dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag 'phags pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de yang mdor na slob pa'i gang zag dang / mi slob pa'i gang zag 'phags pa gnyis yod do //
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of noble persons: those in training and those who have completed training.

original: de la slob pa'i gang zag ni bdun yod de /
analyzed: de la slob pa'i gang zag ni bdun yod de /
translated: There are seven kinds of persons in training:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang /🔽dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa dang bdun no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa dang bdun no //
translated: those who have entered the stream, those who have attained the fruit of entering the stream, those who are tied to one more rebirth, those who have attained the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, those who will no longer be subject to rebirth in the desire realm, those who have attained the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth in the desire realm, and those who are entering the state of an arhat.

original: mi slob pa'i gang zag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gang zag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: There is one kind of person who has completed training: those who have attained the fruit of an arhat.

original: de dag la yang phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: One should understand that the homage is made to all of them.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of homage:

original: lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dang / dag gis phyag 'tshal ba dang / yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dang / dag gis phyag 'tshal ba dang / yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: homage with the body, homage with speech, and homage with the mind.

original: de la lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: de la lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: Homage with the body is

original: dpral ba gtugs pa thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpral ba gtugs pa thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: They bow down with their heads, touching the ground, and they bow down with their foreheads, touching the ground, and they bow down with their joined palms, and so on.

original: ngag gis phyag 'tshal ba ni de dag gi yon tan tshig tu rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis phyag 'tshal ba ni de dag gi yon tan tshig tu rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: They bow down with their speech by uttering the good qualities of those [objects of salutation].

original: yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba ni de dag la dad pa dang dga' ba dang mos ba'i sems kyis phyag 'tshal @6a * //
analyzed: yid kyis phyag 'tshal ba ni de dag la dad pa dang dga' ba dang mos ba'i sems kyis phyag 'tshal @6a * //
translated: They bow down with their minds by bowing down with a mind of faith, joy, and devotion to those [objects of salutation].

original: ba'o ; / phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'o ; / phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having bowed down means having bowed down.

original: phyag 'tshal nas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas ci bya zhe na /
translated: What is done after bowing down?

original: dge tshul gyi ni cho ga rnams //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi ni cho ga rnams //
translated: The rituals of the novice

original: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya //
analyzed: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya //
translated: will be explained in brief.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dge tshul dge sbyong rnams kyi bslab tshig dang las su bya ba rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / dge tshul dge sbyong rnams kyi bslab tshig dang las su bya ba rnams la bya'o //
translated: This is said.🔽It refers to the precepts and duties of novice monks and nuns.

original: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya ba ni dge sbyong gi bslab tshig dang las su bya ba rnams ni k'a ri k'a sum brgya pa dang / 'dul ba 'bum gyi nang nas 'byung bas der brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo tsam nges par bshad par bya ba ni dge sbyong gi bslab tshig dang las su bya ba rnams ni k'a ri k'a sum brgya pa dang / 'dul ba 'bum gyi nang nas 'byung bas der brtag par bya'o //
translated: As for will be explained in brief, the precepts and duties of monks and nuns are found in the Three Hundred Verses on the Monastic Code and the Vinaya in One Hundred Thousand Verses, so one should examine those.

original: 'dir mdo tsam ste /
analyzed: 'dir mdo tsam ste /
translated: Here it is just a brief indication.

original: mi byar mi gnang ba'i dmigs pa nyi tshe tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi byar mi gnang ba'i dmigs pa nyi tshe tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: just a small part of the object which is not permitted to be done.

original: rang gi lha la phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rang gi lha la phyag 'tshal ba dang bstod pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the homage and praise to one's own deity is finished.

original: // / bslab pa nyams su blang ba yang tshig rnam pa bzhi zhig gis ston te /
analyzed: // / bslab pa nyams su blang ba yang tshig rnam pa bzhi zhig gis ston te /
translated: The practice of the training is also taught by four phrases.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / gang zag phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos phun sum tshogs pa dang / gang zag phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The perfection of the Dharma, the perfection of the person, the perfection of practice, and how to practice.

original: sh'akya seng ge'i bstan pa la //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge'i bstan pa la //
translated: In the teaching of the Lion of the Shakyas,

original: zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of the Dharma.

original: de la chos phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la chos phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Therein, the perfection of the Dharma is also twofold.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the teacher and the perfection of the teaching.

original: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya bas ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge zhes bya bas ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The Lion of the Shakyas shows the perfection of the teacher.

original: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The teacher is the Blessed Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gsung dbyangs rnam par dag pa dang thugs rnam par dag pas na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gsung dbyangs rnam par dag pa dang thugs rnam par dag pas na ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, is the perfect teacher because his speech is pure and his mind is pure.

original: sh'akya zhes bya bas gdung rus rnam par dag pa ston te /
analyzed: sh'akya zhes bya bas gdung rus rnam par dag pa ston te /
translated: The word Shakya indicates the purity of his family line.

original: spyir mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa la rigs rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: spyir mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa la rigs rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: In general, there are four castes among humans:

original: dmangs rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / bram rje'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs so //
analyzed: dmangs rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / bram rje'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs so //
translated: the untouchables, the farmers, the priests, and the nobles.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sh'akya rnams kyi nang du goo ta ma'i rigs kyi gdung rus dang ldan pas na sh'akya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sh'akya rnams kyi nang du goo ta ma'i rigs kyi gdung rus dang ldan pas na sh'akya zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was born into the Shakya clan of the Gautama family line, and so he is called a Shakya.

original: sh'akya zhes bya bas ni gdung rus rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: sh'akya zhes bya bas ni gdung rus rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: The word Shakya indicates the purity of his family line.

original: seng ge zhes bya bas thugs rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya bas thugs rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: The word lion indicates the purity of his mind.

original: dper na seng ge ni dpa' bo'i sems dang ldan pas ri dags rnams kyis mi skrag cing ri dags rnams seng ges zil gyis gnon pa dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i thugs @6b dang ldan pas bdud dang mu stegs
analyzed: dper na seng ge ni dpa' bo'i sems dang ldan pas ri dags rnams kyis mi skrag cing ri dags rnams seng ges zil gyis gnon pa dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i thugs @6b dang ldan pas bdud dang mu stegs
translated: Just as a lion, with its heroic mind, is not afraid of other animals and overpowers them, in the same way, the Buddha, the Blessed One, with his mind that has attained the four forms of fearlessness, is not afraid of demons and tīrthikas and overpowers them.

original: pa ri dags dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas zil gyis mi non cing skrag par byed mi nus la /
analyzed: pa ri dags dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas zil gyis mi non cing skrag par byed mi nus la /
translated: Just as a lion, with a hero's mind, is not afraid of deer and overpowers them, in the same way, the Buddha, the Bhagavan, with a mind that has attained the four forms of fearlessness, is not overpowered by the deer-like demons and tirthikas and cannot be frightened by them.

original: sangs rgyas ni bdud dang mu stegs ri dags dang 'dra ba rnams zil gyis gnon cing skrag par byed pas na sangs rgyas la seng ge zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni bdud dang mu stegs ri dags dang 'dra ba rnams zil gyis gnon cing skrag par byed pas na sangs rgyas la seng ge zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha overpowers and frightens the deer-like demons and tirthikas, so the Buddha is called a lion.

original: de bas na seng ge'i sgras thugs dag pa ston to /
analyzed: de bas na seng ge'i sgras thugs dag pa ston to /
translated: Therefore, the lion's roar teaches the purity of mind.

original: bstan pa zhes bya bas bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya bas bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //
translated: The word teaching teaches the perfection of the teaching.

original: slob ma rnams la 'di dag ni bsgrub par bya ba yin /
analyzed: slob ma rnams la 'di dag ni bsgrub par bya ba yin /
translated: These are to be accomplished for the disciples.

original: 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba yin no zhes ston pa'i chos la bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba yin no zhes ston pa'i chos la bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The Dharma that teaches these are to be abandoned is called the teaching.

original: 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / mngon pa'i chos kyi sde snod do //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / mngon pa'i chos kyi sde snod do //
translated: The Vinaya Piṭaka, the Sūtra Piṭaka, and the Abhidharma Piṭaka.

original: de las rab tu byung ba rnams kyis bslab tshig rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de las rab tu byung ba rnams kyis bslab tshig rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among those, the three types of precepts for those who have gone forth are:

original: lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / sems kyi bslab pa dang / shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / sems kyi bslab pa dang / shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: the higher training in morality, the higher training in concentration, and the higher training in wisdom.

original: de 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi nang nas ni lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi nang nas ni lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The higher training in morality comes from the Vinaya Piṭaka.

original: mdo sde'i sde snod las ni lhag pa sems kyi bslab pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde'i sde snod las ni lhag pa sems kyi bslab pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The higher training in concentration comes from the Sūtra Piṭaka.

original: mngon pa'i chos kyi sde snod nas ni lhag pa shes rab kyi bslab pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos kyi sde snod nas ni lhag pa shes rab kyi bslab pa 'byung ste /
translated: The higher training in wisdom comes from the Abhidharma Piṭaka.

original: de ltar sde snod gsum la bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sde snod gsum la bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three piṭakas are called the teaching.

original: dad pas rab tu byung nas ni //
analyzed: dad pas rab tu byung nas ni //
translated: Having gone forth with faith,

original: zhes bya bas gang zag phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gang zag phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: This shows the perfection of the person.

original: gang zag phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis phun sum tshogs so //
analyzed: gang zag phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis phun sum tshogs so //
translated: The excellence of the person is also twofold:

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Excellence of aspiration and excellence of application.

original: dad pa zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /🔽las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ni yod par yid ches pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par sems pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i sems la ni dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te / las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa ni yod par yid ches pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par sems pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i sems la ni dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith is mentioned in order to show excellence of aspiration.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the three jewels, the three jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the four noble truths, the four noble truths being the noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to karma and its results, karma being virtuous, nonvirtuous, and undefined, and its results being happiness, suffering, and neither happiness nor suffering.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the qualities of the Three Jewels, the Three Jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the path of the noble ones, the path of the noble ones being the noble path with its eight components.

original: dad pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to nirvana, nirvana being the complete cessation of the afflictions and the complete cessation of birth.

original: dad pa'i sems kyis rgyur byas nas //
analyzed: dad pa'i sems kyis rgyur byas nas //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the Three Jewels, the Three Jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to karma and its results, karma being virtuous, nonvirtuous, and undefined, and its results being happiness, suffering, and neither happiness nor suffering.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the qualities of the Three Jewels, the Three Jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the path of the noble ones, the path of the noble ones being the noble path with its eight components.

original: rab tu byung nas ni zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas ni zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to nirvana, nirvana being the complete cessation of the afflictions and the complete cessation of birth.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the Three Jewels, the Three Jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to karma and its results, karma being virtuous, nonvirtuous, and undefined, and its results being happiness, suffering, and neither happiness nor suffering.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind with regard to the qualities of the Three Jewels, the Three Jewels being the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽Faith is the clarity of mind

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song zhing bslab tshig bcu mnos pa las rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song zhing bslab tshig bcu mnos pa las rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has gone for refuge to the Three Jewels and accepted the ten rules of training is called a lay practitioner.

original: yang na / dad pas rab tu byung nas ni //
analyzed: yang na / dad pas rab tu byung nas ni //
translated: Or, by the words, “having gone forth out of faith,”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba las skra @7a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba las skra @7a * //
translated: the Blessed One taught the definition of a renunciate in the Vinaya:

original: dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ngo zhes rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dang kha spu bregs nas gos ngur smrig bgos te dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ngo zhes rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Having shaved off hair and beard, having put on the saffron robes, one goes forth out of faith from the home to the homeless life.”

original: tshig 'dis ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these words, he taught the four perfections of renunciates.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // las phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dag / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // las phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa dag / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of action, the perfection of abode, and the perfection of aspiration.

original: de la skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgos te zhes bya bas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgos te zhes bya bas tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase having shaved off his hair and beard and having put on saffron-colored robes indicates the perfection of morality.

original: de tshul de las nyon mongs pa spong ba dang mthun pa'i tshul yin pas khyim na gnas pa'i tshul las 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: de tshul de las nyon mongs pa spong ba dang mthun pa'i tshul yin pas khyim na gnas pa'i tshul las 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Since that morality is the way to eliminate the afflictions, it is superior to the way of life of householders.

original: dad pas yang dag ba kho nar zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: dad pas yang dag ba kho nar zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase with perfect faith and confidence indicates the perfection of attitude.

original: bu lon ma 'khor ba dang rgyal po la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi dad pa'i sems kyis rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bu lon ma 'khor ba dang rgyal po la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi dad pa'i sems kyis rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: He went forth not because of fear of the king or because of fear of debt, but with a mind of faith.

original: rab tu byung zhes bya bas ni las phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rab tu byung zhes bya bas ni las phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase he went forth indicates the perfection of action.

original: bya ba mchog tu gyur pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba mchog tu gyur pa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has entered the supreme activity.

original: khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes bya bas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung zhes bya bas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase from the home to homelessness indicates the perfection of abode.

original: bu smad dang nye du la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa mi bzad pa'i gnas spangs nas khyim med par shing drung dang brag phug na gnas pas na /
analyzed: bu smad dang nye du la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa mi bzad pa'i gnas spangs nas khyim med par shing drung dang brag phug na gnas pas na /
translated: Having abandoned the abode of unbearable fear of wife, children, relatives, and so on, he dwells in a place without a home, at the foot of a tree or in a cave.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the excellence of abode.

original: rab tu byung nas ni zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas ni zhes bya bas ni rab tu byung ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After going forth means after going forth.

original: brtul zhugs brtan pas rab bsgrims te //
analyzed: brtul zhugs brtan pas rab bsgrims te //
translated: He should be well restrained by firm observance.

original: zhes bya bas sgrub ba phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sgrub ba phun sum tshogs pa ston te /
translated: This shows the excellence of practice.

original: brtul zhugs zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa la bya'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs zhes bya bas ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang / bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa la bya'o //
translated: By observance is meant the training in natural and proscribed offenses.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba'i bslab tshig ni phas pham pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba'i bslab tshig ni phas pham pa bzhi'o //
translated: Among them, the training in natural offenses is the four defeats.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab tshig ni chang mi btung ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab tshig ni chang mi btung ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug go //
translated: The training in proscribed offenses is the six types such as not drinking alcohol.

original: brtan pas rab bsgrims te zhes bya bas ni lus ngag yid gsum gyis rab tu bsgrims la phas pham pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brtan pas rab bsgrims te zhes bya bas ni lus ngag yid gsum gyis rab tu bsgrims la phas pham pa mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /
translated: The line with firmness, well-controlled teaches that one should be well-controlled in body, speech, and mind, in order to prevent the occurrence of a root downfall.

original: nyes pa phran tshegs kyang mi 'byung bar bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa phran tshegs kyang mi 'byung bar bsrung ba'o //
translated: One should also guard against the occurrence of minor faults.

original: de yang shing chen po bsrung na de la bskor ba'i ra ba dang shing thags @7b rnams ci nas kyang mi gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang shing chen po bsrung na de la bskor ba'i ra ba dang shing thags @7b rnams ci nas kyang mi gzhig par bya'o //
translated: If one is guarding a great tree, one should not destroy the fence and hedge surrounding it.🔽In the same way, if one is preventing the occurrence of a root downfall, one should guard against the destruction of the minor trainings, which are like the fence and hedge.

original: de dang 'dra bar phas pham pa mi 'byung bar bya na ra ba dang shing thags lta bu'i bslab pa phran tshegs rnams ma zhig par bsrung na tshul khrims brtan par bsrung ba yin no //🔽bdag gi lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar phas pham pa mi 'byung bar bya na ra ba dang shing thags lta bu'i bslab pa phran tshegs rnams ma zhig par bsrung na tshul khrims brtan par bsrung ba yin no // bdag gi lus bzhin bslab pa bsrung //
translated: If one does this, one is guarding the moral discipline firmly.

original: zhes bya bas ji ltar bsgrub par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ji ltar bsgrub par bstan te /
translated: The line I will guard the training as I would my body teaches how to practice.

original: dper na bdag gi lus 'di la dug dang tsher ma dang ngam grog la sogs pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar bsrung ba dang / bza' ba dang bgo ba dang sman la sogs pas ci nas kyang mi brnyas par bya ba'i tshul du bsrung ba dang 'dra bar tshul khrims kyang ci nas kyang mi zhig par bsrung ba dang ;
analyzed: dper na bdag gi lus 'di la dug dang tsher ma dang ngam grog la sogs pas 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar bsrung ba dang / bza' ba dang bgo ba dang sman la sogs pas ci nas kyang mi brnyas par bya ba'i tshul du bsrung ba dang 'dra bar tshul khrims kyang ci nas kyang mi zhig par bsrung ba dang ;
translated: For example, just as one protects one's body from death by poison, thorns, ravines, and so forth, and protects it by means of food, clothing, medicine, and so forth, so that it is not despised, one should protect one's morality so that it is not destroyed,

original: rnam par dag pa'i tshul du bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i tshul du bsrung ba'o //
translated: and so that it is pure.

original: bslab pa nyams su blang ba'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bslab pa nyams su blang ba'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the practice of the precepts is complete.

original: // / snga dro'i dus na las gang bya ba bstan pa la rnam pa brgyad bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: // / snga dro'i dus na las gang bya ba bstan pa la rnam pa brgyad bya bar bstan te /
translated: The explanation of the actions to be performed in the morning is taught to be performed in eight ways:

original: kha ton bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la snyun gsol nas las su bya ba zhu ba dang / chu brtag pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: kha ton bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la snyun gsol nas las su bya ba zhu ba dang / chu brtag pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba bsgrub pa dang /
translated: recitation, paying homage to the Tathagata, inquiring about the health of the preceptor and master, requesting work to be done, examining the water, accomplishing the work of the preceptor and master,

original: zhu ba dang / zas bza' ba dang / bsod nams bsngo ba dang brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: zhu ba dang / zas bza' ba dang / bsod nams bsngo ba dang brgyad bya'o //
translated: and the dedication of merit.

original: nam gyi cha smad mal nas langs //
analyzed: nam gyi cha smad mal nas langs //
translated: In the last part of the night, rise from bed.

original: nam langs bar du kha ton bya //
analyzed: nam langs bar du kha ton bya //
translated: Until dawn, recite the scriptures.

original: zhes bya bas kha ton bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas kha ton bya ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the recitation of scriptures.

original: de nam gyi cha smad ni mtshan gcig la thun lngar bgos pa las tho rangs la bya ste /
analyzed: de nam gyi cha smad ni mtshan gcig la thun lngar bgos pa las tho rangs la bya ste /
translated: The last part of the night is the dawn in the division of the night into five periods.

original: tho rangs mal nas langs nas ni tsog tsog por 'dug la lha ma srin la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o snyam du bsams nas lha ma srin rnams la tshigs su bcad pa ster ba la bos te nam langs kyi bar du kha ton ci nus su bya'o //
analyzed: tho rangs mal nas langs nas ni tsog tsog por 'dug la lha ma srin la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o snyam du bsams nas lha ma srin rnams la tshigs su bcad pa ster ba la bos te nam langs kyi bar du kha ton ci nus su bya'o //
translated: Having risen from bed at dawn, one should sit cross-legged and, thinking that one will give the gift of the Dharma to the gods and demons, one should recite the scriptures as much as one can until dawn, addressing the gods and demons with verses of offering.

original: kha ton byas pa'i bsod nams sems can kun gyi don du bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: kha ton byas pa'i bsod nams sems can kun gyi don du bsngo ba'o //
translated: The merit of reciting the scriptures should be dedicated for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: gdong dang so yi dri bkrus nas //
analyzed: gdong dang so yi dri bkrus nas //
translated: Having cleansed the smell of mouth and teeth,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas la gus phyag bya //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas la gus phyag bya //
translated: one should respectfully prostrate to the perfect Buddha.

original: zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag bya ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the prostration to the Tathagata.

original: langs nas chu dang so shing la sogs pas so dang gdong gi dri ma bkrus nas rdzogs sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gus pas phyag bya'o //
analyzed: langs nas chu dang so shing la sogs pas so dang gdong gi dri ma bkrus nas rdzogs sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gus pas phyag bya'o //
translated: Having risen, one should wash the dirt from one’s teeth and face with water, tooth cleaners, and so on, and then respectfully pay homage to the perfect buddhas, the blessed buddhas.

original: de la chos thams cad thugs su chud cing yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ma lus par brnyes pas na rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad thugs su chud cing yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ma lus par brnyes pas na rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, one is called “perfect” because one has realized all phenomena and attained all the excellent qualities in their entirety.

original: skyes bu gnyid las sangs @8a * //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyid las sangs @8a * //
translated: Like a person who has awakened from sleep,

original: pa bzhin du ma rig pa spangs nas /
analyzed: pa bzhin du ma rig pa spangs nas /
translated: one has abandoned ignorance

original: ma rig pa'i gnyid las sangs pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyid las sangs pas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: and awakened from the sleep of ignorance. Thus, one is called “awakened” (buddha).

original: gus phyag bya zhes bya bas gus par phyag bya ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gus phyag bya zhes bya bas gus par phyag bya ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: “One should pay homage” means that one should pay homage with respect. There are three types of respectful homage:

original: lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis gus par phyag bya ba dang / yid kyis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba dang / ngag gis gus par phyag bya ba dang / yid kyis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
translated: respectful homage with the body, respectful homage with speech, and respectful homage with the mind.

original: de la lus smad lnga sa la gtugs te zhi ba'i tshul gyis phyag bya ba ni lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus smad lnga sa la gtugs te zhi ba'i tshul gyis phyag bya ba ni lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
translated: In this regard, respectful homage with the body is to pay homage with the five limbs touching the ground in a peaceful manner.

original: mi drag mi ngal ba'i dbyangs gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa ni ngag gis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi drag mi ngal ba'i dbyangs gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa ni ngag gis gus par phyag bya ba'o //
translated: The praise of the Tathagata with the sound of the noble and tireless melody is the respectful salutation with speech.

original: lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba'i sngon rol du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyes pa thams cad spangs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa thugs rje chen po can zhes sems can thams cad kyi mgon dang skyabs su gyur pa /
analyzed: lus kyis gus par phyag bya ba'i sngon rol du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni nyes pa thams cad spangs pas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa thugs rje chen po can zhes sems can thams cad kyi mgon dang skyabs su gyur pa /
translated: Before the respectful salutation with the body, the thought The Blessed Buddha, endowed with the perfection of all virtues by abandoning all faults, the great compassionate one, the protector and refuge of all sentient beings,

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi gzhi yin pas phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no snyam du sems pa ni yid kyis gus par phyag bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi gzhi yin pas phyag bya ba'i gnas yin no snyam du sems pa ni yid kyis gus par phyag bya ba ste /
translated: the basis of the merit of all migrating beings, is the object of salutation is the respectful salutation with the mind.

original: de lta bu'i sems sngar bskyed la de nas gdod lus ngag gis phyag bya bas phyag bya'o //🔽bla ma gnas pa'i sgo glegs la //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems sngar bskyed la de nas gdod lus ngag gis phyag bya bas phyag bya'o // bla ma gnas pa'i sgo glegs la //
translated: Having generated such a thought beforehand, one should then perform the salutation with body and speech.🔽Gently tap the door

original: lag pas dal gyis brdung bar bya //
analyzed: lag pas dal gyis brdung bar bya //
translated: of the guru's residence with the hand.

original: nang zhugs gus par bla ma la //
analyzed: nang zhugs gus par bla ma la //
translated: Having entered inside, respectfully ask the guru

original: khams bde mi bde la sogs dri //
analyzed: khams bde mi bde la sogs dri //
translated: about the well-being of his elements, well-being, and so on.

original: 'di ngag bya zhes dris nas ni //
analyzed: 'di ngag bya zhes dris nas ni //
translated: Having asked, What is to be done?

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam bya'i phyir //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to perform the maṇḍala and so forth,

original: zhes bya bas mkhan po dang slob dpon la snyun gsol nas las su bya ba zhu ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mkhan po dang slob dpon la snyun gsol nas las su bya ba zhu ba bstan te /
translated: having inquired about the preceptor's and master's health, it is taught that one should request the activity.

original: bla ma gnas pa'i sgo glegs la //
analyzed: bla ma gnas pa'i sgo glegs la //
translated: At the door of the guru's residence,

original: lag pas dal gyis brdung bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la de ltar sangs rgyas la phyag byas pa'i 'og tu bla ma ste mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi gnas su song la sgo 'phar la lag pas dal gyis brdung ba'am /
analyzed: lag pas dal gyis brdung bar bya // zhes bya ba la de ltar sangs rgyas la phyag byas pa'i 'og tu bla ma ste mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi gnas su song la sgo 'phar la lag pas dal gyis brdung ba'am /
translated: one should gently knock with the hand.

original: se gol gtogs te nang du shog cig ces zer na nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: se gol gtogs te nang du shog cig ces zer na nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Having thus paid homage to the Buddha, one should go to the residence of the guru, that is, the preceptor and master, and gently knock with the hand on the door panel, or snap one's fingers, and if one is told to enter, one should enter.

original: de ltar sgra ma byung na yang lan gnyis kyi bar du de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgra ma byung na yang lan gnyis kyi bar du de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If no sound is heard, one should do the same up to two times.

original: de ste sgra ma byung na yang lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de ste sgra ma byung na yang lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If no sound is heard even then, one should do the same up to three times.

original: de nas nang du shog cig na gdod nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nang du shog cig na gdod nang du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If one is then told to enter, one should enter.

original: thug thub tu mi bya bar tshul 'di ltar bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul zhi ba dang dul ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba dang / thug thub tu zhugs na bla ma rnams kyis dge ba'i bar chad du gyur @8b zhing sems 'khrug par 'gyur bas bla ma'i sems mi 'khrug par bya ba'i phyir tshul de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: thug thub tu mi bya bar tshul 'di ltar bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul zhi ba dang dul ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i tshul bstan par bya ba dang / thug thub tu zhugs na bla ma rnams kyis dge ba'i bar chad du gyur @8b zhing sems 'khrug par 'gyur bas bla ma'i sems mi 'khrug par bya ba'i phyir tshul de ltar bya'o //
translated: And if one acts too familiarly, the gurus will be an obstacle to virtue and the mind will be disturbed. Therefore, one should act in this way in order not to disturb the mind of the guru.

original: de nas bla mas nang du shog cig ces smras te nang du zhugs nas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nas bla mas nang du shog cig ces smras te nang du zhugs nas ci bya zhe na /
translated: Then, after the guru says, Come inside, and one has entered inside, what should one do?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / nang zhugs gus pas bla ma la //🔽khams bde mi bde la sogs dri //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nang zhugs gus pas bla ma la // khams bde mi bde la sogs dri //
translated: Having entered inside, with respect

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ask about the guru's well-being, health, and so forth.

original: khams kyi sgras ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: khams kyi sgras ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la bya ste /
translated: The term element refers to the four great elements of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi shas che chung du gyur pa las nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi shas che chung du gyur pa las nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: From an imbalance of the four great elements, illness arises.

original: de la sa'i khams shas chen ni kha zas mi 'ju zhing lus lci'o //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams shas chen ni kha zas mi 'ju zhing lus lci'o //
translated: The excess of the earth element is when food is not digested and the body is heavy.

original: chu'i khams shas che na ni bad kan shas che'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams shas che na ni bad kan shas che'o //
translated: The excess of the water element is when phlegm is excessive.

original: me'i khams shas che na ni mkhris pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i khams shas che na ni mkhris pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The excess of the fire element is when there is bile.

original: rlung gi khams shas che na ni rlung nad can du 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar nang du zhugs nas zhi ba dang du la ba dang srid zhu'i tshul gyis phyag bya ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams shas che na ni rlung nad can du 'gyur ro // de ltar nang du zhugs nas zhi ba dang du la ba dang srid zhu'i tshul gyis phyag bya ste /
translated: The excess of the wind element is when there is a wind disease.

original: khams bzhi ma snyoms pa las snyun du gyur pa mchis sam ma mchis snyun gsol lo //
analyzed: khams bzhi ma snyoms pa las snyun du gyur pa mchis sam ma mchis snyun gsol lo //
translated: Having entered in that way, one should make obeisance with the manner of pacification, joy, and compassion, saying, Are you well or not?

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mtshan mo bde bar mnal lam ma mnal /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mtshan mo bde bar mnal lam ma mnal /
translated: The phrase and so forth means Did you sleep well or not?

original: dgongs pa la bar chad du gyur tam ma gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa la bar chad du gyur tam ma gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: Did you have any obstacles in your thoughts or not?

original: de ltar snyun gsol nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar snyun gsol nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Having asked about their health in that way, what should one do?

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽What should be done?

original: 'di dag bya zhes dris nas ni //
analyzed: 'di dag bya zhes dris nas ni //
translated: Having asked,

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam bya'i phyir //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs rnam bya'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of the maṇḍala and so on,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said.

original: snyun gsol ba'i 'og tu mchod rten la phyag bya zhing bskor ba dang bshang gci che chung du 'gro ba ma gtogs par nang par snga dro'i bar du ci dang ci bya ba thams cad zhu'o //
analyzed: snyun gsol ba'i 'og tu mchod rten la phyag bya zhing bskor ba dang bshang gci che chung du 'gro ba ma gtogs par nang par snga dro'i bar du ci dang ci bya ba thams cad zhu'o //
translated: After the sick one has been asked about his health, he should pay homage to the caitya, circumambulate it, and go to the bathroom. Except for these activities, he should not do anything else until the morning.

original: de ltar zhus pa'i 'og tu dkyil 'khor byas la de nas gdod g-yar tshus bza'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhus pa'i 'og tu dkyil 'khor byas la de nas gdod g-yar tshus bza'o //
translated: After he has been asked about his health in this way, he should make a maṇḍala and then eat the food that was left over.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa mchod pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pa mchod pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include the offerings of flowers, incense, and so on.

original: nya phyis la sogs chu brtags te //
analyzed: nya phyis la sogs chu brtags te //
translated: “Examine the water with a conch shell and so on.

original: steng dang bar gting rim bzhin no //
analyzed: steng dang bar gting rim bzhin no //
translated: [The water is pure] if [the conch shell] is clean on the surface, in the middle, and at the bottom.

original: nya phyis la sogs med na yang //
analyzed: nya phyis la sogs med na yang //
translated: If there is no conch shell and so on,

original: khyor ba'am 'dab mas bum pa dgang //🔽chu yi skye bo che chung rnams //
analyzed: khyor ba'am 'dab mas bum pa dgang // chu yi skye bo che chung rnams //
translated: pour the water into a cup or a leaf.🔽Examine carefully the large and small creatures in the water🔽for a short time.

original: yun mi ring bar nan tan brtag / snying rje can gyis khu ba rnams //
analyzed: yun mi ring bar nan tan brtag / snying rje can gyis khu ba rnams //
translated: The compassionate one should use the water

original: rab tu brtags te spyad par bya //
analyzed: rab tu brtags te spyad par bya //
translated: only after examining it carefully.🔽If there are living beings in it, strain it well;

original: srog chags yod na legs par btsag / srog chags rnams la gnod mi bya //
analyzed: srog chags yod na legs par btsag / srog chags rnams la gnod mi bya //
translated: do not harm living beings.

original: rtsva dang lci ba shing la sogs //
analyzed: rtsva dang lci ba shing la sogs //
translated: Grass, cow dung, wood, and so on

original: dgos pa gang dang gang yang rung //
analyzed: dgos pa gang dang gang yang rung //
translated: Whatever the purpose may be,

original: de dag srog chags med par bya //
analyzed: de dag srog chags med par bya //
translated: they should be made free of living beings.

original: sdom pas srog chags gsad pa srung //
analyzed: sdom pas srog chags gsad pa srung //
translated: By the vow, the killing of living beings is protected.

original: zhes bya bas chu la sogs pa brtag par bstan te /🔽de dag @9a * //
analyzed: zhes bya bas chu la sogs pa brtag par bstan te / de dag @9a * //
translated: This teaches the examination of water, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor byas nas g-yar tshus thob pa'i 'og tu ci bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / nya phyis la sogs chu brtags te //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byas nas g-yar tshus thob pa'i 'og tu ci bya zhe na / de'i phyir / nya phyis la sogs chu brtags te //
translated: Having made the mandala, what should be done after the recitation?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “The oyster, etc. are examined in the water,” and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu chu tshags lnga 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i chu tshags gang yang rung ba cig gis chu btsag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chu tshags lnga 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i chu tshags gang yang rung ba cig gis chu btsag go //
translated: After that, one should examine the water with any one of the water strainers taught in the Vinaya.

original: de la chu tshags lnga ni ril ba dang / gru gsum pa dang / yu ba can dang / chos can zhes bya ba dang / grol bar byed pa'i ras so //
analyzed: de la chu tshags lnga ni ril ba dang / gru gsum pa dang / yu ba can dang / chos can zhes bya ba dang / grol bar byed pa'i ras so //
translated: There are five kinds of water strainers: the bowl, the triangular one, the one with a handle, the one called the Dharma one, and the cloth strainer.

original: de ltar chu btsags nas btsags pa tsam gyis kyang mi chog ste /
analyzed: de ltar chu btsags nas btsags pa tsam gyis kyang mi chog ste /
translated: Having examined the water in that way, just the examination alone is not sufficient.

original: nya phyis la sogs pa chus gang bar bkang la srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
analyzed: nya phyis la sogs pa chus gang bar bkang la srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
translated: The oyster, etc. should be filled with water and examined for the presence or absence of living beings.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dung phor rnams kyang bsdus so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dung phor rnams kyang bsdus so //
translated: The word “etc.” includes conches.

original: ji ltar brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar brtag ce na /
translated: How should one examine?🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / steng dang bar gting rim bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / steng dang bar gting rim bzhin no // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Above, in the middle, and below, in order.

original: brtag pa'i rim pa ni thog mar chu'i steng na srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
analyzed: brtag pa'i rim pa ni thog mar chu'i steng na srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
translated: The order of examination is as follows: First, one should examine whether there are living beings on the surface of the water.

original: de nas bar du /
analyzed: de nas bar du /
translated: Then, in the middle.

original: de nas gting ste zhabs su brtags la /
analyzed: de nas gting ste zhabs su brtags la /
translated: Then, below, at the bottom.

original: srog chags med na ni chu de spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: srog chags med na ni chu de spyad du rung ngo //
translated: If there are no living beings, that water is suitable for use.

original: srog chags yod na ni chu de spyad du mi rung bas slar snga ma'i gnas su dbo'o //
analyzed: srog chags yod na ni chu de spyad du mi rung bas slar snga ma'i gnas su dbo'o //
translated: If there are living beings, that water is not suitable for use, so one should pour it back into its original place.

original: gal te nya phyis dang dung phor ma 'byor na ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te nya phyis dang dung phor ma 'byor na ji ltar bya snyam pa la /
translated: If one does not have a live oyster or a conch, what should one do?🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / nya phyis la sogs med na yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nya phyis la sogs med na yang //
translated: If one does not have a live oyster, etc.

original: khyor ba 'am 'dab mas bum pa dgang //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyor ba 'am 'dab mas bum pa dgang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should pour the water into a cup or a leaf.

original: nya phyis dang dung phor ma 'byor na yang khyor ba bkang ste brtag go //
analyzed: nya phyis dang dung phor ma 'byor na yang khyor ba bkang ste brtag go //
translated: If one does not have a live oyster or a conch, one should fill a cup and examine it.

original: 'dir yang steng dang bar gting rim bzhin du brtag pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang steng dang bar gting rim bzhin du brtag pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here also, the examination of the upper, middle, and lower depths is the same as before.

original: 'di'i skabs su ji ltar brtag ce na /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su ji ltar brtag ce na /
translated: How is it to be examined in this case?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / chu yi skye bo che chung rnams //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chu yi skye bo che chung rnams //
translated: The great and small beings in the water

original: yun mi ring bar nan tan brtag /🔽ces bya ba smos te /🔽chu brtag pa yang mig nad kyis phog pa'am /
analyzed: yun mi ring bar nan tan brtag / ces bya ba smos te / chu brtag pa yang mig nad kyis phog pa'am /
translated: are not examined for a long time, but carefully.

original: mig ling tog gis khebs pas ni mi brtag gi mig gsal bas chu na gnas pa'i srog chags phra mo dang sbom po rnams yod dam med brtag go //
analyzed: mig ling tog gis khebs pas ni mi brtag gi mig gsal bas chu na gnas pa'i srog chags phra mo dang sbom po rnams yod dam med brtag go //
translated: The examination of the water is not done by one afflicted with eye disease or by one whose eyes are covered with cataracts. It is done by one with clear eyes, who examines whether there are any small or large living beings in the water.

original: mig gsal bas brtags na yang yun ring du mig bgrad de bltas na mig zi zi por 'gyur bas srog chags mi mthong pa'i phyir yun mi ring bar yang nas yang du mig gsal ba sa brtag ste /
analyzed: mig gsal bas brtags na yang yun ring du mig bgrad de bltas na mig zi zi por 'gyur bas srog chags mi mthong pa'i phyir yun mi ring bar yang nas yang du mig gsal ba sa brtag ste /
translated: Even when examined by one with clear eyes, if the eyes are left open for a long time, the eyes will become tired and one will not see the living beings. Therefore, the examination is done again and again for a short time, with clear eyes.

original: srog chags med par yid ches kyi bar du brtag go //
analyzed: srog chags med par yid ches kyi bar du brtag go //
translated: The examination is done until one is convinced that there are no living beings.

original: de bas na nan tan brtag ces smos te /
analyzed: de bas na nan tan brtag ces smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: carefully.

original: srog chags med par yid ches shing the tshom med @9b kyi bar du blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog chags med par yid ches shing the tshom med @9b kyi bar du blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should look until one is convinced that there are no living beings, and one should have no doubt.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar brtag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar brtag ce na /
translated: Why should one investigate in this way?

original: de'i phyir snying rje can gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje can gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “the compassionate one.”

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: The ordained have compassion, which is the removal of the suffering of living beings.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi gnod pa bsal ba'i don du srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi gnod pa bsal ba'i don du srog chags yod dam med brtag go //
translated: Therefore, in order to remove the harm of living beings, one should investigate whether or not there are living beings.🔽If there are no living beings born in the water, but the water has become inhabited by living beings due to the adventitious arrival of flies, etc., and if there are adventitious living beings in the liquid of food, etc., how should one deal with them?

original: gal te chu las skyes pa'i srog chags ni med kyi sbrang bu la sogs pa glo bur du 'ongs pas chu de srog chags dang ldan par gyur pa dang / kha zas kyi khu ba la sogs pa la glo bur gyi srog chags yod par gyur na de dag dor bar ji ltar bya snyam pa la khu ba rnams rab tu brtags te spyad par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te chu las skyes pa'i srog chags ni med kyi sbrang bu la sogs pa glo bur du 'ongs pas chu de srog chags dang ldan par gyur pa dang / kha zas kyi khu ba la sogs pa la glo bur gyi srog chags yod par gyur na de dag dor bar ji ltar bya snyam pa la khu ba rnams rab tu brtags te spyad par bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should use the liquid after carefully examining it.

original: chu btsags pa dang kha zas kyi khu ba la glo bur du 'ongs pa'i srog chags yod par gyur na yang yod dam med legs par brtags te spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: chu btsags pa dang kha zas kyi khu ba la glo bur du 'ongs pa'i srog chags yod par gyur na yang yod dam med legs par brtags te spyad par bya'o //
translated: If there are suddenly appearing living beings in the water or in the liquid food, one should use it after carefully examining whether or not they are present.

original: dor bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: dor bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: But one should not discard it.

original: thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / srog chags yod na legs par btsag / srog chags rnams la gnod mi bya //
analyzed: thabs ji ltar bya zhe na / de'i phyir / srog chags yod na legs par btsag / srog chags rnams la gnod mi bya //
translated: What is the method?🔽Therefore he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If there are living beings, carefully examine the water; do not harm the living beings.

original: btsags pa dang kha zas kyi khu ba la glo bur du 'ongs pa'i srog chags yod na legs par ma snad par btsags par rig pa ni btsag / lag pas bsal bar rig pa ni legs par bsal la so so'i gnas su ma snad ma shi bar bskyal
analyzed: btsags pa dang kha zas kyi khu ba la glo bur du 'ongs pa'i srog chags yod na legs par ma snad par btsags par rig pa ni btsag / lag pas bsal bar rig pa ni legs par bsal la so so'i gnas su ma snad ma shi bar bskyal
translated: If there are suddenly appearing living beings in the water or in the liquid food, carefully examine the water, knowing that it is not damaged; carefully examine the liquid food, knowing that it is not damaged by the hand.🔽Carry them to their own place, not damaging or killing them.

original: bar bya'o // de la chu grang mo la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams chu dron mo la bskyal na gnod par 'gyur bas chu grang mo nyid du bskyal lo //
analyzed: bar bya'o // de la chu grang mo la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams chu dron mo la bskyal na gnod par 'gyur bas chu grang mo nyid du bskyal lo //
translated: In this regard, if one carries living beings that live in cold water to hot water, they are harmed.

original: chu dron mo la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams chu grang mo la bskyal na gnod par 'gyur bas chu dron mo nyid du bskyal lo //
analyzed: chu dron mo la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams chu grang mo la bskyal na gnod par 'gyur bas chu dron mo nyid du bskyal lo //
translated: If you pour living beings that live in warm water into cold water, they will be harmed. So pour them into warm water.

original: gal te ma byas par srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu 'thungs sam /
analyzed: gal te ma byas par srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu 'thungs sam /
translated: If you drink water containing living beings without first straining it,

original: srog chags rnams rang rang gi gnas ma yin par bskyal te /
analyzed: srog chags rnams rang rang gi gnas ma yin par bskyal te /
translated: or if you pour living beings into a place that is not their natural habitat,

original: shi bar gyur na srog chags kyi grangs du yod pa'i nyes byas kyi grangs kyang de snyed cig 'thob bo //
analyzed: shi bar gyur na srog chags kyi grangs du yod pa'i nyes byas kyi grangs kyang de snyed cig 'thob bo //
translated: and they die, you will acquire as many faults as there are living beings.

original: chu btsags te brtags pa de yang de ring lta bu'i nang par brtags na /
analyzed: chu btsags te brtags pa de yang de ring lta bu'i nang par brtags na /
translated: If you strain and examine the water on a given day,

original: de'i phyi de nyid kyi nang par gyi bar du spyad par byar rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyid kyi nang par gyi bar du spyad par byar rung ngo //
translated: it is suitable to use it until the next day.

original: chu rnam pa lnga ni bdag gis ma btsags ma brtags kyang spyad du rung ba'i chu ste /
analyzed: chu rnam pa lnga ni bdag gis ma btsags ma brtags kyang spyad du rung ba'i chu ste /
translated: There are five kinds of water that are suitable to use even if you have not strained and examined it:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: kho ra khor yug 'dom gang du brtags pa'i chu dang / khron pa la sogs pa dang / dge slong yon tan can gyi chu dang / dge @10a * //
