original: 'dun gyi chu dang / yid ches pa'i chu'o //
analyzed: 'dun gyi chu dang / yid ches pa'i chu'o //
translated: Water examined within a fathom's radius, water from a well, and so on, water of a monk with good qualities, water of the Saṅgha, and water of trust.

original: de la khor khor yug 'dom gang du brtags pa'i chu ni lteng ka 'am mtshe'u la sogs pa'i dbus su bus mo nub tsam du song la srog chags yod dam med brtags te med par gyur na 'dom gang khor khor yug tu brtags pa yin par spyad du
analyzed: de la khor khor yug 'dom gang du brtags pa'i chu ni lteng ka 'am mtshe'u la sogs pa'i dbus su bus mo nub tsam du song la srog chags yod dam med brtags te med par gyur na 'dom gang khor khor yug tu brtags pa yin par spyad du
translated: Water examined within a fathom's radius: in the middle of a pond, lake, and so on, dig down until the knee and examine whether there are living beings. If there are none, it is suitable to use water examined within a fathom's radius.

original: rung ngo // khron pa la sogs pa'i chu ni khron pa dang lteng ka dang rdzing la sogs par nya phyis gang gi chu blangs te /
analyzed: rung ngo // khron pa la sogs pa'i chu ni khron pa dang lteng ka dang rdzing la sogs par nya phyis gang gi chu blangs te /
translated: Water from a well, and so on: take water from a well, a pond, a lake, and so on, in a container that is covered.

original: srog chags yod dam med brtags te med na nyin zhag gcig gi bar du spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: srog chags yod dam med brtags te med na nyin zhag gcig gi bar du spyad du rung ngo //
translated: Examine whether there are living beings. If there are none, it is suitable to use it for one day and night.

original: dge slong yon tan can gyi chu ni dge slong tshul khrims la gnas pa sdig pa la 'dzem pas chu btsags ta btsags pa la bdag gis ma brtags ma btsags par spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong yon tan can gyi chu ni dge slong tshul khrims la gnas pa sdig pa la 'dzem pas chu btsags ta btsags pa la bdag gis ma brtags ma btsags par spyad du rung ngo //
translated: The water of a monk with good qualities is the water of a monk who maintains ethical discipline and avoids evil. It is permissible to use water that has been filtered by him without examining or filtering it oneself.

original: dge 'dun gyi chu ni dge 'dun spyi'i chu lta bu brtags nas btsags te bzhag pa la ni bdag gis ma brtags ma btsags kyang spyad du rung ngo //🔽yid ches pa'i chu ni brag kha 'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chu ni dge 'dun spyi'i chu lta bu brtags nas btsags te bzhag pa la ni bdag gis ma brtags ma btsags kyang spyad du rung ngo // yid ches pa'i chu ni brag kha 'am /
translated: The water of the saṅgha is, for example, the water of the general saṅgha. It is permissible to use water that has been examined and filtered by them without examining or filtering it oneself.

original: ri kha gzar po nas 'bab pa'i chu 'am /
analyzed: ri kha gzar po nas 'bab pa'i chu 'am /
translated: Trusted water is water that flows from a cliff or a mountainside,

original: sa'i 'og nas gyen du rdol pa'i chu mig lta bu la srog chags yod mi srid pas yid ches pa'i chu zhes bya ste spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: sa'i 'og nas gyen du rdol pa'i chu mig lta bu la srog chags yod mi srid pas yid ches pa'i chu zhes bya ste spyad du rung ngo //
translated: or a spring that wells up from the ground. Since it is impossible for it to contain living beings, it is called trusted water and is permissible to use.

original: chu btsags pa'i bslab tshig ni dge slong mos pa can gyi srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus chag chag dang dkyil 'khor la sogs byas pa las bcas so ;
analyzed: chu btsags pa'i bslab tshig ni dge slong mos pa can gyi srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus chag chag dang dkyil 'khor la sogs byas pa las bcas so ;
translated: The rule of training on filtering water was formulated because a nun with faith sprinkled and made a mandala with water containing living beings.

original: / de'i phyis dge sbyong gis chu tshags lnga las gang yang rung ba cig med par gnas su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: / de'i phyis dge sbyong gis chu tshags lnga las gang yang rung ba cig med par gnas su mi rung ngo //
translated: After that, it is not suitable for a monk to stay without any one of the five water filters.

original: med par gnas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par gnas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he stays without one, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu la de ltar brtags shing btsags nas srog chags med par byas te spyad na /
analyzed: chu la de ltar brtags shing btsags nas srog chags med par byas te spyad na /
translated: If one uses water after examining it in this way and filtering it to remove living beings,

original: 'o na rtsva dang shing la sogs pa la srog chags yod na ji ltar spyad snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na rtsva dang shing la sogs pa la srog chags yod na ji ltar spyad snyam pa la /
translated: then how should one use grass, wood, and so forth that have living beings?🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / rtsa dang lci ba shing la sogs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtsa dang lci ba shing la sogs //
translated: grass, mud, wood, and so forth

original: dgos pa gang dang gang yang rung //
analyzed: dgos pa gang dang gang yang rung //
translated: should be used for whatever purpose

original: de dag srog chags med par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag srog chags med par bya // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: after making them free of living beings.

original: mal gyi 'og tu gding ba'i rtsa la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang khang pa bkru ba'i lci ba dang / ma bud pa'i shing dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni sa la sogs pa'i yang bsdus te /
analyzed: mal gyi 'og tu gding ba'i rtsa la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang khang pa bkru ba'i lci ba dang / ma bud pa'i shing dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni sa la sogs pa'i yang bsdus te /
translated: Grass and so forth that are spread out under a bed and so forth, mud for cleaning a mandala or a house, wood that has not been cut, and so forth are included by the term and so forth.

original: dge sbyong gis spyad par bya ba'i rdzas gang ci yang rung ste kun la srog chags yod dam med brtags nas srog chags yod na btsags la srog chags rnams kyang rang rang gi gnas su bde bar bskyal te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis spyad par bya ba'i rdzas gang ci yang rung ste kun la srog chags yod dam med brtags nas srog chags yod na btsags la srog chags rnams kyang rang rang gi gnas su bde bar bskyal te /
translated: Whatever articles a spiritual practitioner uses, he or she should examine them to see whether or not they contain living organisms. If they do, he or she should strain them and then pour the organisms back into their original habitat.

original: @10b srog chags med par byas nas spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: @10b srog chags med par byas nas spyad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the practitioner should use things in a way that does not harm living beings.🔽To summarize the points that have been explained in the section on water,

original: chu'i skabs su bshad pa rnams kyi don mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chu'i skabs su bshad pa rnams kyi don mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the verse states:

original: sdom pas srog chags bsad pa bsrung //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdom pas srog chags bsad pa bsrung // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By means of the vows, protect living beings from being killed.

original: dge sbyong rnams ni snying rje can la khrims dang ldan pa yin pas ci nas kyang sems can che phra kun gyi bsad pa bsrung ste /🔽sems can gang yang mi bsad do //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams ni snying rje can la khrims dang ldan pa yin pas ci nas kyang sems can che phra kun gyi bsad pa bsrung ste / sems can gang yang mi bsad do //
translated: Spiritual practitioners are compassionate and maintain ethical discipline. Therefore, they should protect all living beings, large and small, from being killed.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that they should not kill any living being.🔽Prepare a seat, water for washing, and tooth cleaners,

original: stan chu sa dang so shing dang // 'dag pa'i chal yang sta gon bya //
analyzed: stan chu sa dang so shing dang // 'dag pa'i chal yang sta gon bya //
translated: and also the cleansing stick.🔽Wash the begging bowl and so forth,

original: lhung bzed bkru la sogs pa dang // bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad bya //
analyzed: lhung bzed bkru la sogs pa dang // bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad bya //
translated: and do everything necessary for the teacher.

original: zhes bya bas mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the duties of the preceptor and the master.

original: de ltar brtags pa dang btsags pa'i 'og tu /🔽bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad bya //
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa dang btsags pa'i 'og tu / bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad bya //
translated: After the examination and the investigation,

original: zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes sbyar te /
translated: one should perform all the duties of the guru.

original: bla ma ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la bya ste /
analyzed: bla ma ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la bya ste /
translated: The guru is the preceptor and the master.🔽The duties of the guru are the duties of the preceptor and the master.

original: de'i dgos pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba rnams nyams su blang ste bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba rnams nyams su blang ste bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should practice and accomplish them.

original: nyams su blang ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su blang ba de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those practices?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that, it says:🔽Prepare the seat, water, tooth stick,

original: stan chu sa dang so shing dang // 'dag pa'i chal yang sta gon bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: stan chu sa dang so shing dang // 'dag pa'i chal yang sta gon bya // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and the cleansing stick.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba ni nang bar mkhan po dang slob dpon gang du kha gdong bkru ba'i gnas su gdan gding ba dang / bkru ba'i chu dang so shing dang / 'dag pa li chal la sogs pa sta gon bya ste /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi las su bya ba ni nang bar mkhan po dang slob dpon gang du kha gdong bkru ba'i gnas su gdan gding ba dang / bkru ba'i chu dang so shing dang / 'dag pa li chal la sogs pa sta gon bya ste /
translated: The duties of the preceptor and the master are to prepare the seat, the water for washing, the tooth stick, the cleansing stick, and so forth, in the place where the preceptor and the master wash their faces in the morning.

original: gshegs pa dang / bshang gci byed pa'i gnas su sa dang 'dab ma dag kyang sta gon byas te bzhag go //
analyzed: gshegs pa dang / bshang gci byed pa'i gnas su sa dang 'dab ma dag kyang sta gon byas te bzhag go //
translated: He should also prepare and set out earth and leaves in a place for defecating and a place for urinating.

original: de tsam zhig byas pas chog gam zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam zhig byas pas chog gam zhe na /
translated: Is it sufficient to do just that?

original: mi chog par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi chog par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that it is not sufficient, he says:

original: lhung bzed bkru la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhung bzed bkru la sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Washing the alms-bowl, etc.

original: 'dir mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi lhung bzed bkru'o //
analyzed: 'dir mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi lhung bzed bkru'o //
translated: Here, the preceptor and the master wash the alms-bowl.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos gos bkru zhing btsem pa dang gnas byi dor bya ba la sogs pa las su bya ba thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chos gos bkru zhing btsem pa dang gnas byi dor bya ba la sogs pa las su bya ba thams cad bya'o //
translated: The word etc. indicates that all the work should be done, such as washing and sewing the Dharma robes, cleaning the dwelling place, and so on.

original: de nas dus rig phyag bya ste //
analyzed: de nas dus rig phyag bya ste //
translated: Then, knowing the time, he should pay homage

original: de bzhin gus par thal sbyar nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gus par thal sbyar nas //
translated: and likewise respectfully place his palms together

original: zas bza' bya zhes bla ma la //
analyzed: zas bza' bya zhes bla ma la //
translated: and say to the guru, I will eat the food.

original: brtul zhugs can gyis de ltar zhu //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can gyis de ltar zhu //
translated: The one with spiritual practice should request in this way.

original: zhes bya bas zhus nas zas bza' ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas zhus nas zas bza' ba bstan te /
translated: Having requested in this way, he should eat the food.

original: de nas zhes bya bas ni bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad byas pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya bas ni bla ma'i dgos pa thams cad byas pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then means after doing all the duties for the guru.

original: dus rig phyag byas la dge slong rnams kyi zas bza' ba'o //
analyzed: dus rig phyag byas la dge slong rnams kyi zas bza' ba'o //
translated: Having made the time known and having made obeisance, the monk should eat the food.

original: dus ni skya rengs shar ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dus ni skya rengs shar ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The time is from sunrise

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nyi ma dros man chad de /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nyi ma dros man chad de /
translated: until the sun has set in Jambudvipa.

original: de'i bar du zas @11a * //
analyzed: de'i bar du zas @11a * //
translated: During that time,🔽it is the time for eating food.

original: bza' bar gnang ba'i dus rig nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar gnang ba'i dus rig nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Having made the time known,

original: phyag byas te /
analyzed: phyag byas te /
translated: having made obeisance,

original: de bzhin gus pas thal sbyar nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gus pas thal sbyar nas //
translated: having respectfully joined the palms,

original: zhes bya ba la mkhan po 'am slob dpon la phyag byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mkhan po 'am slob dpon la phyag byas te /
translated: having made obeisance to the preceptor or master,

original: de bzhin nang par sngar zhus pa bzhin du lus kyis ma gus pa rkang pa brkyang ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa byed pa dang / ngag gis ma gus pa rta gad byed pa la sogs pa btang la /
analyzed: de bzhin nang par sngar zhus pa bzhin du lus kyis ma gus pa rkang pa brkyang ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba la sogs pa byed pa dang / ngag gis ma gus pa rta gad byed pa la sogs pa btang la /
translated: having given up disrespect with body, such as stretching the legs, stretching the arms, and so on, and disrespect with speech, such as horse-talk,

original: lus dang ngag zhi ba dang dul bar bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag zhi ba dang dul bar bya ste /
translated: one should be peaceful and disciplined with body and speech.

original: thal mo sbyar la 'tshal ma 'tshal //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar la 'tshal ma 'tshal //
translated: Having joined the palms, one should say, “I have eaten.”

original: zhes bla ma mkhan po dang slob dpon la brtul zhugs can de dge slong gis de ltar zhu'o //
analyzed: zhes bla ma mkhan po dang slob dpon la brtul zhugs can de dge slong gis de ltar zhu'o //
translated: The one with vows, the monk, should say this to the guru, preceptor, or master.

original: lag pa bkrus nas tshul bzhin du//
analyzed: lag pa bkrus nas tshul bzhin du//
translated: Having washed his hands, he should eat properly.

original: de ni mi smra tshod rig bya //
analyzed: de ni mi smra tshod rig bya //
translated: He should not talk while eating, and he should know the proper amount.

original: zhes bya bas sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This teaches the perfection of practice.

original: lag pa bkrus nas zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang lhung bzed gnyis ka bkrus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lag pa bkrus nas zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang lhung bzed gnyis ka bkrus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Having washed his hands” means that he should wash both his hands and his begging-bowl.

original: tshul bzhin du zhes bya bas ni zas bza' ba'i tshe g-yas g-yon du mi blta'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du zhes bya bas ni zas bza' ba'i tshe g-yas g-yon du mi blta'o //
translated: “Properly” means that when he is eating, he should not look around,

original: kha zas 'brim pa la mi blta'o //
analyzed: kha zas 'brim pa la mi blta'o //
translated: he should not look at the people who are serving the food,

original: ha cang kham cher mi za'o //
analyzed: ha cang kham cher mi za'o //
translated: he should not eat with his mouth wide open,

original: de ni mi sna tshod rig bya //
analyzed: de ni mi sna tshod rig bya //
translated: “He should not talk while eating, and he should know the proper amount.”

original: zhes bya ba ni zas za ba'i tshe gad mo mi bgad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zas za ba'i tshe gad mo mi bgad do //
translated: When he is eating, he should not laugh,

original: gtam mi bya'o //🔽rkan sgra mi gtog go //
analyzed: gtam mi bya'o // rkan sgra mi gtog go //
translated: he should not converse,🔽he should not make smacking sounds,

original: cag cag mi bya'o //
analyzed: cag cag mi bya'o //
translated: and he should not make slurping sounds.

original: tshod rig ces bya ba ni ha cang mang du mi bza' la /
analyzed: tshod rig ces bya ba ni ha cang mang du mi bza' la /
translated: “The proper amount” means that he should not eat too much,

original: ha cang nyung du zos na yang dge ba byed mi nus pas ci tsam gyi dge ba byed pa de tsam gyi tshod de tsam zhig bza'o //
analyzed: ha cang nyung du zos na yang dge ba byed mi nus pas ci tsam gyi dge ba byed pa de tsam gyi tshod de tsam zhig bza'o //
translated: because if he eats too little, he will be unable to do spiritual practice. He should eat just the amount that will enable him to do spiritual practice.

original: bru ba'i nad las bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bru ba'i nad las bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to avoid the illness of hunger,

original: bza'o snyam pa'i sems kyis bza' //
analyzed: bza'o snyam pa'i sems kyis bza' //
translated: One should eat with the thought of nourishing.

original: zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas bza' bar bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsam pa phun sum tshogs pas bza' bar bya ba bstan te /
translated: This shows the proper attitude for eating.

original: 'di ltar zas za ba'i tshe stobs che ba dang gzugs mdzes par 'dod pa'i bsam pas zos na ni zas zos pa de nyid mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zas za ba'i tshe stobs che ba dang gzugs mdzes par 'dod pa'i bsam pas zos na ni zas zos pa de nyid mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats with the thought of wanting great strength and a beautiful body, then that very act of eating becomes unwholesome.

original: zas ma zos na lus nyam chung bas dge ba byed mi nus pa'i phyir dge ba byed pa'i don du zas bza'o snyam pa'i sems kyis zas zos na zas zos pa de nyid dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas ma zos na lus nyam chung bas dge ba byed mi nus pa'i phyir dge ba byed pa'i don du zas bza'o snyam pa'i sems kyis zas zos na zas zos pa de nyid dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one eats with the thought of doing wholesome actions, because one is unable to do wholesome actions if one's body is weak from not eating, then that very act of eating becomes wholesome.

original: de gnyis gang du yang ma gtogs par kha zas bza'o snyam ste zas zos pa de nyid lung ma bstan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis gang du yang ma gtogs par kha zas bza'o snyam ste zas zos pa de nyid lung ma bstan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats with the thought of eating food, but one does not have either of those two thoughts, then that very act of eating becomes indeterminate.

original: de bas na zas za ba'i tshe yang zas ma zos na bkres pa'i nad kyis 'debs so //
analyzed: de bas na zas za ba'i tshe yang zas ma zos na bkres pa'i nad kyis 'debs so //
translated: Therefore, even when eating food, if one does not eat, one is afflicted by the illness of hunger.

original: bkres pa'i nad kyis btab na dge ba byed mi nus pas /
analyzed: bkres pa'i nad kyis btab na dge ba byed mi nus pas /
translated: And if one is afflicted by the illness of hunger, one is unable to do wholesome actions.

original: kha zas zos la bkres pa'i nad bzlog la dge ba bya'o snyam pa'i bsam bas zas bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: kha zas zos la bkres pa'i nad bzlog la dge ba bya'o snyam pa'i bsam bas zas bza' bar bya ste /
translated: One should eat food with the thought, I will eat food to cure the disease of hunger and to do virtuous actions.

original: de lta bu'i @11b bsam pa bzang pos zos na kha zas zos pa de dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i @11b bsam pa bzang pos zos na kha zas zos pa de dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats with such a good thought, then eating food becomes a virtuous action.🔽Having eaten and drunk in this way, afterwards

original: zos shing de bzhin 'thungs pa dang // rung ba'i chu yis de 'og tu //
analyzed: zos shing de bzhin 'thungs pa dang // rung ba'i chu yis de 'og tu //
translated: with pure water,

original: sbyin pa yang dag 'phel bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang dag 'phel bya'i phyir //
translated: in order to increase generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod //
translated: one should recite two verses on generosity.

original: ces bya bas bsod nams bsngo ba bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya bas bsod nams bsngo ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the dedication of merit.

original: zos shing zhes bya bas ni bza' ba lnga zos shing bca' ba lnga 'chos so //
analyzed: zos shing zhes bya bas ni bza' ba lnga zos shing bca' ba lnga 'chos so //
translated: Having eaten means having eaten the five kinds of food and having chewed the five kinds of chewable food.

original: de la bza' ba ni kha zas la bya'o //🔽bca' ba ni spyan gzigs la bya'o //
analyzed: de la bza' ba ni kha zas la bya'o // bca' ba ni spyan gzigs la bya'o //
translated: Here, food refers to what is eaten.🔽Chewable food refers to what is chewed.

original: de bzhin 'thungs pa dang zhes bya bas ni btung bar bya ba 'thungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin 'thungs pa dang zhes bya bas ni btung bar bya ba 'thungs pa'o //
translated: Having drunk means having drunk what is to be drunk.

original: rung ba'i chu yis zhes bya ba ni btsags shing brtags pa'i chus lag pa dang kha bkrus la /
analyzed: rung ba'i chu yis zhes bya ba ni btsags shing brtags pa'i chus lag pa dang kha bkrus la /
translated: With pure water means having washed one's hands and mouth with water that has been filtered and examined.

original: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed kyang dag par bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhung bzed kyang dag par bkru bar bya'o //
translated: After that, the alms bowl should be washed well.

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: After that,

original: sbyin pa yang dag 'phel bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang dag 'phel bya'i phyir //
translated: in order to increase generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis shig brjod // ces bya ba la /
translated: two verses on generosity should be recited.

original: lag pa dang lhung bzed bkrus pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i yon bdag gi smon lam bdag dang gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba bzlog ste /
analyzed: lag pa dang lhung bzed bkrus pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i yon bdag gi smon lam bdag dang gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba bzlog ste /
translated: In this regard, after washing the hands and the alms bowl, one should stop the benefactors from making aspirations that would be harmful to themselves and others.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu lha dang mi'i lus thob pa'i longs spyod chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i yon bdag gi don du tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags pa dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags te de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis shig gdon to ;
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu lha dang mi'i lus thob pa'i longs spyod chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i yon bdag gi don du tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags pa dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklags te de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis shig gdon to ;
translated: For the sake of the benefactors, in order that they obtain the great enjoyments of a divine or human body as the fruit of their generosity, one verse should be recited, and for the sake of the nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, another verse should be recited. Thus two verses should be recited.

original: / man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: / man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya //
translated: If one has the instructions, one should practice meditative concentration.

original: rab tu 'bad de bklag par bya //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad de bklag par bya //
translated: One should read with great effort.

original: sdom dang cho ga mkhas pa dang // bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya //
analyzed: sdom dang cho ga mkhas pa dang // bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya //
translated: One should be skilled in the vows and rituals, and be diligent in practice.

original: zhes bya bas dge ba bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dge ba bya ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the performance of virtue.

original: de rnam pa bzhi yod de bsam gtan bya ba dang / bklag pa dang / ltung ba dang / mi ltung ba la mkhas pa dang / tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa bzhi yod de bsam gtan bya ba dang / bklag pa dang / ltung ba dang / mi ltung ba la mkhas pa dang / tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: It has four aspects: one should practice meditation, be skilled in reading, in falling, and in not falling, and one should maintain morality without decline.

original: man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: man ngag yod na bsam gtan bya //
translated: If there is instruction, one should meditate.

original: zhes bya bas bsam gtan bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bsam gtan bya bar bstan te /
translated: This teaches the practice of meditation.

original: de la yang gang zag rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la yang gang zag rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Therein, there are four types of persons:

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / gti mug la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / gti mug la spyod pa'i gang zag dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i gang zag go //
translated: the person who practices desire, the person who practices hatred, the person who practices delusion, and the person who practices discursive thought.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni mi gtsang ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni mi gtsang ba bsgom mo //
translated: Among them, the person who practices desire should cultivate impurity.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni sems can thams cad gnyen bshes dang nye du bzhin du sdug pa dang phangs par bsgom mo //🔽gti mug la @12a * //🔽spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni sems can thams cad gnyen bshes dang nye du bzhin du sdug pa dang phangs par bsgom mo // gti mug la @12a * // spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs bzhin 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom mo //
translated: The person who is given to hatred should cultivate the idea that all beings are dear and beloved, like a kinsman or a friend.🔽The person who is given to delusion should cultivate the characteristics of dependent origination in its direct and reverse order.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i gang zag gis ni dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bsgom mo //
translated: The person who is given to discursive thought should cultivate the in-breathing and out-breathing.

original: sgom pa 'di dag ni bdud rtsi'i sgo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgom pa 'di dag ni bdud rtsi'i sgo zhes bya ste /
translated: These cultivations are called the door to immortality,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: because they are the cause of attaining nirvana.

original: gal te bsam gtan 'di dag la sogs pa man ngag gang mkhan po dang slob dpon la thos nas zas zos pa'i 'og tu bsam gtan bya'o //🔽rab tu 'bad de klag par byed //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan 'di dag la sogs pa man ngag gang mkhan po dang slob dpon la thos nas zas zos pa'i 'og tu bsam gtan bya'o // rab tu 'bad de klag par byed //
translated: If one hears from the teacher or the master the instructions for these meditations, etc., one should practice them after eating.🔽One should read with great effort.

original: ces bya bas bklag par bya ba bsten te /
analyzed: ces bya bas bklag par bya ba bsten te /
translated: This shows that one should study.

original: gal te bsam gtan bsgom pa'i man ngag med na bklag par bya ste kha ton bya ba'am /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan bsgom pa'i man ngag med na bklag par bya ste kha ton bya ba'am /
translated: If one does not have the esoteric instructions for cultivating meditative stabilization, one should read the Dharma, or recite it.

original: dharma glegs bam la bklag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dharma glegs bam la bklag par bya ba'o //
translated: The Dharma is the scriptures.

original: de ltar klog pa'i dus na yang rab tu 'bad de bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar klog pa'i dus na yang rab tu 'bad de bklag par bya'o //
translated: One should read them with great effort.

original: dkyil 'khor dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas la sems ma yengs par rtse gcig tu bsdus nas lha klu la sogs pa la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas la sems ma yengs par rtse gcig tu bsdus nas lha klu la sogs pa la chos kyi sbyin pa bya'o //
translated: Having made a mandala offering, etc., one should give the gift of Dharma to gods, nagas, etc., with a mind that is not distracted, but is collected in single-pointed concentration.

original: ha cang yang mi drag ha cang yang mi dal bar ren par bya ste /
analyzed: ha cang yang mi drag ha cang yang mi dal bar ren par bya ste /
translated: One should read neither too quickly nor too slowly, but evenly.

original: zur phyin par bklag go //
analyzed: zur phyin par bklag go //
translated: One should read with a pleasant voice.

original: bklags pa'i rjes la yang bsod nams bdag dang sems can gyi don du bsngo'o //
analyzed: bklags pa'i rjes la yang bsod nams bdag dang sems can gyi don du bsngo'o //
translated: After reading, one should dedicate the merit to oneself and to all sentient beings.

original: sdom dang cho ga mkhas pa dang // zhes bya bas ltung ba dang mi ltung bar bya ba la mkhas par bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: sdom dang cho ga mkhas pa dang // zhes bya bas ltung ba dang mi ltung bar bya ba la mkhas par bya ba bstan te /
translated: The line skilled in the vows and rituals teaches that one should be skilled in what to adopt and what to reject.

original: sdom pa'i sgra ni phas pham pa bzhi la bya la /
analyzed: sdom pa'i sgra ni phas pham pa bzhi la bya la /
translated: The term vow refers to the four defeats.

original: cho ga'i sgra ni sbom po dang nyes byas la sogs pa bslab tshig phra mo dang dge sbyong gi bya ba rnams la bya ste /🔽mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni 'di tsam gyi phas pham par 'gyur la /
analyzed: cho ga'i sgra ni sbom po dang nyes byas la sogs pa bslab tshig phra mo dang dge sbyong gi bya ba rnams la bya ste / mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni 'di tsam gyi phas pham par 'gyur la /
translated: The term ritual refers to the subtle precepts of training, such as the serious and minor offenses, and to the activities of a monk.🔽The term expert refers to the knowledge of what constitutes a defeating offense and what does not,

original: 'di tsam gyis phas pham par mi 'gyur zhes shes par bya ba dang ; 'di dag ni nyes byas yin /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis phas pham par mi 'gyur zhes shes par bya ba dang ; 'di dag ni nyes byas yin /
translated: and the knowledge of what constitutes a minor offense,

original: 'di dag ni bdag gi las su bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gi las su bya ba yin /
translated: what is to be done by oneself,

original: 'di dag ni bdag gi las su bya ba ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gi las su bya ba ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: and what is not to be done by oneself.

original: bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya //
analyzed: bsgrub pa la ni brtson par bya //
translated: One should strive to accomplish the precepts.

original: zhes bya bas tshul khrims lhur len pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas tshul khrims lhur len pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the one who is intent on morality.

original: phas pham pa dang sbom po dang nyes byas la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsrung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: phas pham pa dang sbom po dang nyes byas la sogs pa mi 'byung bar bsrung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba la brtson pa yin no //
translated: He is intent on accomplishing the protection of the precepts, which prevents the occurrence of defeating offenses, serious offenses, minor offenses, and so on.

original: da ni phas pham pa'i gnas 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni phas pham pa'i gnas 'chad de /
translated: Now the grounds for a defeating offense will be explained.

original: de la phas pham pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la phas pham pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of defeating offense?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni chos kyi rgyal po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni chos kyi rgyal po //
translated: The Blessed Buddha is the king of Dharma.

original: bdag ni chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab bo //
analyzed: bdag ni chos kyi rgyal po'i rgyal tshab bo //
translated: I am the regent of the king of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa byang @12b chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni bdag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar bya ba'i grogs sam mig lta bu yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la sogs pa byang @12b chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni bdag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar bya ba'i grogs sam mig lta bu yin te /
translated: Morality, concentration, wisdom, and so forth, the factors of enlightenment, are like my eyes or friends for pacifying all my afflictions.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyis nyon mongs pa bcom nas chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas thob par bya ba yin pa las /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyis nyon mongs pa bcom nas chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas thob par bya ba yin pa las /
translated: Having conquered the afflictions with the factors of enlightenment, I will attain the state of the king of the Dharma.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med par byas pas bdag gis chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i skal ba med pa la
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa rnams kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med par byas pas bdag gis chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i skal ba med pa la
translated: But those who are under the power of afflictions such as attachment have destroyed the factors of enlightenment such as morality. Therefore, I have no fortune to attain the state of the king of the Dharma, nirvāṇa.

original: phas pham pa zhes pa bya ste /
analyzed: phas pham pa zhes pa bya ste /
translated: This is called a root downfall.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas su gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas su gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that I have become a basis for afflictions.

original: de la phas pham pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la phas pham pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of root downfalls.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and lying.

original: phas pham pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phas pham pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The causes of the defeat are of three kinds:

original: zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / 'dod chags dang / gti mug go //
translated: hatred, desire, and delusion.

original: de la zhe sdang las ni srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la zhe sdang las ni srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From hatred, the defeat of killing arises.

original: 'dod chags las ni ma byin par len pa dang mi tshangs par spyod pa'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags las ni ma byin par len pa dang mi tshangs par spyod pa'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From desire, the defeats of stealing and sexual misconduct arise.

original: gti mug las ni brdzun du smra ba'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gti mug las ni brdzun du smra ba'i phas pham pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From delusion, the defeat of lying arises.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lta ba mnyams skyon med pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lta ba mnyams skyon med pas /
translated: The Blessed One’s community of disciples remained for twelve years with their view intact and without fault.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir mdor bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One here summarized

original: nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa'i mdo bshad de bstan pa /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa'i mdo bshad de bstan pa /
translated: and taught the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness for the Disciples.

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not do any evil,

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: and cultivate what is wholesome.

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: One should thoroughly tame one’s own mind.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the body is good.

original: ngag gi sdom pa legs pa yin //
analyzed: ngag gi sdom pa legs pa yin //
translated: Restraint of speech is good.

original: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the mind is good.

original: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
analyzed: thams cad du ni sdom pa legs //
translated: Restraint in every way is good.

original: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //
analyzed: kun du bsdams pa'i dge slong ni //
translated: A monk who is restrained in every way

original: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu gol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rab tu gol //
translated: escapes all suffering.

original: ngag rnams bsrungs shing yid kyang rab bsdams te //
analyzed: ngag rnams bsrungs shing yid kyang rab bsdams te //
translated: Protecting speech and thoroughly restraining the mind,

original: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi spyod cing //
analyzed: lus kyis mi dge ba dag mi spyod cing //
translated: and not engaging in nonvirtue with the body,

original: las rnams gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs nas //
analyzed: las rnams gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs nas //
translated: having thoroughly trained in these three actions,

original: drang srong gsung ba'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: drang srong gsung ba'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the path taught by the ṛṣis.

original: zhes gsungs pas slob par zad do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas slob par zad do //
translated: Thus, they only trained.

original: lo bcu gnyis 'das nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la skyon dang phan 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis 'das nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la skyon dang phan 'byung ngo //
translated: After twelve years, faults and benefits arose in the teaching of the Bhagavān.

original: de la dang po srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa bshad de /
analyzed: de la dang po srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa bshad de /
translated: First, the defeat of killing is explained.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul bri dzi'i ljongs chu bo dga' skyed kyi 'gram thang shing gi nags stug bo na @13a * //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yul bri dzi'i ljongs chu bo dga' skyed kyi 'gram thang shing gi nags stug bo na @13a * //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was dwelling in the forest of thick trees on the banks of the Joy-Giving River in the land of Vṛji.

original: bzhugs so // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun la mi gtsang ba bsgom du bcug nas dge slong dag mi gtsang ba la brten nas bsgom pa lan mang du byas nas 'bras bu che zhing legs pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bsngags pa brjod pas /
analyzed: bzhugs so // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun la mi gtsang ba bsgom du bcug nas dge slong dag mi gtsang ba la brten nas bsgom pa lan mang du byas nas 'bras bu che zhing legs pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bsngags pa brjod pas /
translated: Then the Blessed One had the community of monks meditate on impurity. The monks, having meditated on impurity many times, praised it, saying, It becomes great and excellent.

original: dge slong rnams kyis mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas lus rnag can 'dis yid byung sgyid lug ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas lus rnag can 'dis yid byung sgyid lug ste /
translated: The monks, having meditated on impurity, became disgusted with this putrid body.

original: rnam par smod cing mtshon gyis kyang 'debs /
analyzed: rnam par smod cing mtshon gyis kyang 'debs /
translated: They despised it and even cut themselves with weapons.

original: dug kyang za /
analyzed: dug kyang za /
translated: They ate poison.

original: 'gegs kyang 'geg / g-yang du yang mchong /
analyzed: 'gegs kyang 'geg / g-yang du yang mchong /
translated: They killed themselves by hanging, and jumped off cliffs.

original: dge slong gis kyang dge slong yang gsod /
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang dge slong yang gsod /
translated: Monks even killed other monks.

original: de nas dge slong zhig lus la rnam par smod cing ri dags dbyig pa can dge sbyong srung ba la 'di skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong zhig lus la rnam par smod cing ri dags dbyig pa can dge sbyong srung ba la 'di skad ces smra'o //
translated: Then a monk, who was disgusted with his body, said to the deer-hunter, the ascetic Protector,

original: bzhin bzangs nga sod cig dang chos gos kyang khyod kyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs nga sod cig dang chos gos kyang khyod kyir 'gyur ro //
translated: “Good man, kill me and the robe will be yours.”

original: de nas dbyig pa can gyis de'i srog bcad nas ral gri khrag can chu bo dga' skyed la 'khru'o //
analyzed: de nas dbyig pa can gyis de'i srog bcad nas ral gri khrag can chu bo dga' skyed la 'khru'o //
translated: Then the hunter killed him and washed the bloody sword in the river Ganges.

original: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud cig chu bo'i rgyun la ma reg tsam du 'dug nas dbyug pa can la legs pa'i bsod nams mang du spel lo //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu'i bdud cig chu bo'i rgyun la ma reg tsam du 'dug nas dbyug pa can la legs pa'i bsod nams mang du spel lo //
translated: Then a son of the gods, Māra, stood in the river, just out of reach of the current, and praised the hunter with many good merits.

original: sems can no zhes bstod pas dbyig pa can yang chos gos dang lhung bzed 'dod pas bsod nams bya'o snyam nas ral gri rnon po mchan du bcug ste /
analyzed: sems can no zhes bstod pas dbyig pa can yang chos gos dang lhung bzed 'dod pas bsod nams bya'o snyam nas ral gri rnon po mchan du bcug ste /
translated: The hunter, wanting the robe and begging bowl, thought, “I will make merit.” He tucked a sharp sword under his arm

original: gtsug lag khang nas 'chag sa'i bar du gcig nas gcig tu dge slong drug cu'i bar du srog bcad nas dge slong rnams nyung zhing 'gribs par gyur to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas 'chag sa'i bar du gcig nas gcig tu dge slong drug cu'i bar du srog bcad nas dge slong rnams nyung zhing 'gribs par gyur to //
translated: and from the monastery to the walking path, one after another, he killed sixty monks. The monks became few and diminished.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gso sbyong bco lnga pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad la gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gso sbyong bco lnga pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad la gzigs nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then, when the Blessed One was observing the entire community of monks on the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony, he said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: rgyu rkyen gang gis da lta nga'i dge slong nyung zhing 'gribs par gyur zhes smras pa dang ji lta bur gyur pa rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gang gis da lta nga'i dge slong nyung zhing 'gribs par gyur zhes smras pa dang ji lta bur gyur pa rgyas par gsol to //
translated: “What is the cause and condition for my monks being few and decreasing now?” He explained in detail what had happened.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong gsod dam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong gsod dam /
translated: “Ānanda, are monks being killed?”

original: btsun pa 'gums lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa 'gums lags so //
translated: “Yes, they are being killed, Bhadanta.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma yin zhes rnam grangs du mas smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One, having rebuked them in many ways, saying, “They are not monks,”

original: legs pa bcu gzigs pa'i phyir bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: legs pa bcu gzigs pa'i phyir bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: established a rule of training for the sake of the ten benefits.

original: gleng gzhi ni yul bri dzi /
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni yul bri dzi /
translated: The frame story is in the country of Vṛji.

original: gang zag ni dbyig pa can dge sbyong srung /
analyzed: gang zag ni dbyig pa can dge sbyong srung /
translated: The person is the ascetic Daṇḍadhara.

original: nyon mongs pa ni mi bzod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni mi bzod pa /
translated: The affliction is impatience.

original: nyes pa ni gsod pa dang / dngos po ni mir chags pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gsod pa dang / dngos po ni mir chags pa'o //
translated: The offense is killing, and the thing is a human being.

original: srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa 'di rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa 'di rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This defeat on killing is taught by three things.

original: phas pham pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / sbom po'i gnas bstan pa @13b dang ; nyes byas kyi gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / sbom po'i gnas bstan pa @13b dang ; nyes byas kyi gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: and the presentation of the grounds of minor infraction.

original: phas pham pa'i gnas bstan pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: phas pham pa'i gnas bstan pa la gsum ste /
translated: The presentation of the grounds of defeat has three parts:

original: bdag gis bsad pa dang / gzhan gsod du bcug pa dang / thabs kyis bsad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bsad pa dang / gzhan gsod du bcug pa dang / thabs kyis bsad pa'o //
translated: killing oneself, causing another to kill, and killing by means of a ruse.

original: brtul zhugs gnas sems ma nyams pas //
analyzed: brtul zhugs gnas sems ma nyams pas //
translated: One who is steadfast in the vow, whose mind is not impaired,

original: ched du bsams te ma nor bar //🔽mi gzhan bdag gam gzhan rnams kyis //
analyzed: ched du bsams te ma nor bar // mi gzhan bdag gam gzhan rnams kyis //
translated: intentionally and without error,🔽kills another human being,

original: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
translated: either oneself or another, and violates the vow.

original: zhes bya ba bdag gis bsad pa dang / gzhan gyis bsad pa bstan te /🔽brtul zhugs gnas zhes bya bas bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag gis bsad pa dang / gzhan gyis bsad pa bstan te / brtul zhugs gnas zhes bya bas bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas /
translated: This shows killing oneself and killing another.🔽One who is steadfast in the vow is one who has not impaired the training.

original: bslab pa phul yang ma phul ba la brtul zhugs gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa phul yang ma phul ba la brtul zhugs gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has not returned the training is called steadfast in the vow.

original: 'dir rnam pa bzhi bzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa bzhi bzhag go //
translated: Here, four possibilities are set forth.

original: bslab pa phul la nyams par ma byas pa dang / bslab pa nyams par byas lam phul ba dang / bslab pa nyams par yang byas la phul ba dang / bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas phul yang ma phul lo //
analyzed: bslab pa phul la nyams par ma byas pa dang / bslab pa nyams par byas lam phul ba dang / bslab pa nyams par yang byas la phul ba dang / bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas phul yang ma phul lo //
translated: One has not damaged the training after returning it; one has damaged the training and returned it; one has both damaged the training and returned it; one has neither damaged the training nor returned it.

original: de la bslab pa phul la nyams par ma byas pa ni 'di ltar dge sbyong chags par gyur tam mi dga' 'am /
analyzed: de la bslab pa phul la nyams par ma byas pa ni 'di ltar dge sbyong chags par gyur tam mi dga' 'am /
translated: One has not damaged the training after returning it means that one has returned the training because one is attached to sensual pleasures, or because one is unhappy,

original: slar 'bab 'dod dam /
analyzed: slar 'bab 'dod dam /
translated: or because one wishes to return to a lower status,🔽or because one is not interested in the training.

original: dge sbyong don du mi gnyer bas dge sbyong gi gan du song nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong don du mi gnyer bas dge sbyong gi gan du song nas /
translated: One goes to a fully ordained monk and says,🔽“Venerable, please consider this. I, named so-and-so, return the training.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bslab par 'bul lo zhes zer ba dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun 'bul ba'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bslab par 'bul lo zhes zer ba dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun 'bul ba'am /
translated: Or one says, “I return the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha,”

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon 'bul lo zhes zer na bslab pa phul lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon 'bul lo zhes zer na bslab pa phul lo zhes bya'o //
translated: or “I return the preceptor and the teacher.”

original: bdag khyim pa yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: bdag khyim pa yin no zhe 'am /
translated: One says, “I am a layperson,”

original: dge bsnyen yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen yin no zhe 'am /
translated: or “I am a novice monk,”

original: mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'am /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byas pa'am /
translated: or “I have committed one of the five heinous actions,”

original: mu stegs can nam /
analyzed: mu stegs can nam /
translated: or “I am a heretic,”🔽or “I am a eunuch,”🔽or “I am a hermaphrodite.”

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed dang lhan cig 'grogs su ma dgongs so zhes zer na bslab pa phul ba yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed dang lhan cig 'grogs su ma dgongs so zhes zer na bslab pa phul ba yin te /
translated: If he says, “I do not wish to live with you, my fellow practitioners of pure conduct,” he has offered his training.

original: bslab ba nyams par byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bslab ba nyams par byas pa ma yin no //
translated: He has not damaged his training.

original: ji ltar bslab pa nyams par ni byas la bslab pa phul ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa nyams par ni byas la bslab pa phul ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How does one damage one’s training but not offer it?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong chags shing mi dga' ste 'bab bar 'dod nas mkhyen par mdzod cig tshangs par spyad pas rab tu dben pa dang / dgon pa ni spyad dka'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong chags shing mi dga' ste 'bab bar 'dod nas mkhyen par mdzod cig tshangs par spyad pas rab tu dben pa dang / dgon pa ni spyad dka'o //
translated: If a monk, out of attachment and discontent, wishes to leave the monastic life, he should be told, “Please understand that it is difficult to practice pure conduct and live in solitude in the forest.”

original: pham bu sring bu nu mkhan po dran no //
analyzed: pham bu sring bu nu mkhan po dran no //
translated: He should be reminded of his preceptor and teacher.

original: bdag bzo slob bo //
analyzed: bdag bzo slob bo //
translated: He should be told, “I will learn a craft.”🔽He should be told, “I will give you to those of your own class who are pleasant.”

original: bdag dga' ba'i rigs rnams la gtod cig / babs pa'i rtags smras kyang bslab pa 'bul zhes ma smras na bslab pa nyams par byas kyi phul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag dga' ba'i rigs rnams la gtod cig / babs pa'i rtags smras kyang bslab pa 'bul zhes ma smras na bslab pa nyams par byas kyi phul ba ma yin no //
translated: If he says, “I will leave the monastic life,” but does not say, “I offer my training,” he has damaged his training but not offered it.

original: ji ltar bslab pa nyams par yang byas phul ba yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa nyams par yang byas phul ba yang yin zhe na /
translated: How does one both damage one’s training and offer it?

original: dge sbyong @14a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong @14a * //
translated: If a monk

original: chags shing 'bab par 'dod pas tshangs par spyod pa dang dgon pa ni dka'o //
analyzed: chags shing 'bab par 'dod pas tshangs par spyod pa dang dgon pa ni dka'o //
translated: Since he is attached to and desires to descend, he says, “It is difficult to be celibate and live in the forest.”

original: pha dang ma dang mkhan po la sogs pa dran na bdag dga' ba'i rigs la gtod cig ces smra zhing tshig gis go bar bslab pa 'bul zhes zer na bslab pa nyams par yang byas pa bslab pa phul ba yang yin no ;
analyzed: pha dang ma dang mkhan po la sogs pa dran na bdag dga' ba'i rigs la gtod cig ces smra zhing tshig gis go bar bslab pa 'bul zhes zer na bslab pa nyams par yang byas pa bslab pa phul ba yang yin no ;
translated: If he says, “Remember your father, mother, preceptor, and so on. Give me your consent to engage in the activities that please me,” and he makes himself understood by these words, then he has both damaged the training and offered the training.

original: / ji ltar bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas la phul ba yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar bslab pa nyams par yang ma byas la phul ba yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he has neither damaged the training nor offered the training?

original: nyams pa'i tshig kyang ma smras 'bul ba'i tshig kyang ma smras pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa'i tshig kyang ma smras 'bul ba'i tshig kyang ma smras pa'o //
translated: He has not uttered the words of damage and he has not uttered the words of offering.

original: de la bslab pa ma phul yang nyams par byas pas kyang bslab pa nyams pa dang phul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bslab pa ma phul yang nyams par byas pas kyang bslab pa nyams pa dang phul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this case, he has damaged the training but not offered the training.🔽He has offered the training but not damaged it.

original: bslab pa ma phul ba las nyams par byas pa dang / bslab pa phul yang ma phul la nyams par yang ma byas pas ni phul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa ma phul ba las nyams par byas pa dang / bslab pa phul yang ma phul la nyams par yang ma byas pas ni phul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He has neither offered the training nor damaged it.

original: sems nyams pas zhes bya ba la sems nyams pa ni smyos te mi dran pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sems nyams pas zhes bya ba la sems nyams pa ni smyos te mi dran pa la bya ste /
translated: “Degraded mind” refers to insanity, a loss of memory.

original: bdag smyos kyang ma smyos te dran bzhin du bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag smyos kyang ma smyos te dran bzhin du bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills while insane but with a clear mind, then one commits a defeating offense.

original: smyos te mi dran par 'gyur nas bsad na ni phas pham par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smyos te mi dran par 'gyur nas bsad na ni phas pham par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills while insane and with a confused mind, then one does not commit a defeating offense.

original: ched du bsams te zhes bya ba la bsad par ni ma bsams kyi rtsed mo la sogs pa byed byed de shi nas phas pham par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ched du bsams te zhes bya ba la bsad par ni ma bsams kyi rtsed mo la sogs pa byed byed de shi nas phas pham par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Intentionally” means that if one does not intend to kill but kills while playing and so on, then one does not commit a defeating offense.

original: ched du gsad par bsams te shi nas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ched du gsad par bsams te shi nas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills with the intention to kill, then one commits a defeating offense.

original: ma nor ba zhes bya ba la yang mi rnam pa gsum bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ba las /🔽bdag kyang mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nor ba zhes bya ba la yang mi rnam pa gsum bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ba las / bdag kyang mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa yin te /
translated: “Without error” means that if one kills any of the three types of humans, then one commits a defeating offense.🔽If one kills oneself, then one does not commit a defeating offense, because one is a human being.

original: bdag gis bdag bsad pa na phas pham par mi 'gyur gyi bdag gis gzhan bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag bsad pa na phas pham par mi 'gyur gyi bdag gis gzhan bsad na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills another, then one commits a defeating offense.

original: bdag gis gzhan bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag gis gzhan bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If I kill another, my discipline would deteriorate.

original: bdag nyid kyis lag dar te mi rnam pa gsum bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur te phas pham pa 'byung bas dge sbyong du mi rung zhing 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skal ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis lag dar te mi rnam pa gsum bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur te phas pham pa 'byung bas dge sbyong du mi rung zhing 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i skal ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya
translated: If a monk kills a human being with his own hands, his discipline would deteriorate, he would incur a defeating offense, he would be unfit to be a monk and he would lack the fortune to see the noble truths and attain nirvana.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above statement.

original: de la bdag gis bsad pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gis bsad pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Killing by oneself has three types:

original: zin pa'i lus su gtogs pa dang / phyi rol gyis 'phangs pa dang / gnyis ka dang yang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa'i lus su gtogs pa dang / phyi rol gyis 'phangs pa dang / gnyis ka dang yang ldan pa'o //
translated: killing by one’s own body, killing by projecting the mind and killing by both.

original: ji ltar zin pa'i lus su gtogs pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar zin pa'i lus su gtogs pas she na /
translated: How is killing by one’s own body?

original: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis skyes pa dang / bud med dam ma ning khu tshur ram rdo'am tha na sor mo gcig bsnun te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis skyes pa dang / bud med dam ma ning khu tshur ram rdo'am tha na sor mo gcig bsnun te /
translated: If a monk kills a man, woman or neuter person with the intention to kill by striking with his own fist, a stone or even a single finger,

original: shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi @14b tshe'am phyis shi bar 'gyur na ni phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi @14b tshe'am phyis shi bar 'gyur na ni phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he dies at that time or later, there is a root downfall.

original: ma shi na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shi na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: If he does not die, there is a serious violation.

original: phyi rol gyis 'phangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyis 'phangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is being struck by an external object?

original: dge sbyong gis bsad sems kyis mi la mda' 'phangs pa'am /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bsad sems kyis mi la mda' 'phangs pa'am /
translated: If a monk shoots an arrow at a person with the intention to kill him,

original: mdung dang / be con dang / tha na rgya shug gis bsnun te des shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi tshe'am dus phyis shi na yang pas pham pa'o //
analyzed: mdung dang / be con dang / tha na rgya shug gis bsnun te des shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi tshe'am dus phyis shi na yang pas pham pa'o //
translated: or if he throws a spear, a club, or even an olive at him, thinking, “May he die from this,” and if he dies at that time or later, there is a root downfall.

original: ma shin sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shin sbom po'o //
translated: If he does not die, there is a serious violation.

original: gnyis ka dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is both?

analyzed: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la //

original: nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya //

analyzed: sman dang sngags dang rig pa dang // 'chi ba'i phyogs su btang ba'am //

original: mi gzhan thabs rnams sna tshogs kyis //
analyzed: mi gzhan thabs rnams sna tshogs kyis //
translated: One should not speak of the Dharma to those who are sick,🔽saying, If you are moral or immoral,🔽if you are afflicted by disease,🔽and if you hear this, you will die in despair.🔽One should not speak of the Dharma to those who are sick,

original: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //
translated: If killed, the spiritual practice will decline.

original: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis thabs kyis gsod pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yan chad kyis thabs kyis gsod pa bstan te /

analyzed: thabs kyis / tshul khrims ldan nam tshul khrims 'chal //

analyzed: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la //

original: gang thos sdug bsngal nyam thag ste //🔽nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya //
analyzed: gang thos sdug bsngal nyam thag ste // nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya //

analyzed: zhes bya bas tshig gi sgo nas tha bas kyis gsod pa rnams shig bstan te /
translated: By this, killing by means of harsh words is taught.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum yod de /

original: gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gang zhe na ;

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te /

analyzed: ldan pa khyod tshul khrims dang ldan pa dge pa'i chos can yin pas 'di nas shi 'phos nas tshe rabs gzhan du skyes na lo legs pa dang 'dra /

original: mtho ris ni dar las chod /
analyzed: mtho ris ni dar las chod /
translated: The higher realms are blocked by a silk cloth and liberation is blocked by a curtain.🔽When you are separated from your body, you will be born as a god.

analyzed: ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If he does not die, there is a serious transgression.🔽Do not speak of the faults of others,🔽do not speak of the faults of those with impaired ethics,🔽do not speak of what you have heard,

analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ces bya ba dang / gang thos zhes bya ba dang / nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya // zhes bya bar sbyar te /

analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba can la yo byad 'dod pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'chir gzhug go snyam du bsams nas tshe dang ldan pa sdig pa'i chos can lus dang ngag gis ngan par spyod pa khyod ji tsam du yun ring du gson pa de tsam ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba'i sdig 'phel bas rang gis rang sod cig ces bsgo
translated: Thinking, I will cause him to die, he says to the patient, Venerable, you are a sinner, your body and speech are evil. No matter how long you live, you will be born in the lower realms. Increase your sin and kill yourself.

original: ba las shi na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba las shi na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the patient dies, there is a defeat.

original: ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If the patient does not die, there is a serious transgression.

original: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la //🔽gang thos sdug bsngal nyam thag ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin nad kyis btab pa la // gang thos sdug bsngal nyam thag ste ;
translated: Similarly, with regard to the sick,

original: / nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya //
analyzed: / nges 'chi'i chos gtam de mi bya //
translated: one should not speak of the Dharma🔽to those who are distressed by suffering🔽and who will certainly die.

original: zhes bya bas nad pa sbyar te /🔽nad kyis btab pa'i nad pa la nad pa'i yo byad 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya bas nad pa sbyar te / nad kyis btab pa'i nad pa la nad pa'i yo byad 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: This verse is applied to the sick.

translated: One should not say to a sick person who is afflicted by illness, Venerable, you are sick and suffering. No matter how long you live, you will continue to suffer. Kill yourself.

analyzed: gal te gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur pa'i gtam byas pa las shi na phas pham pa'o // ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If the person dies as a result of the monk’s statement, the monk commits an immediate offense.🔽If the person does not die, the monk commits a serious offense.

original: gong du smos pa ltar bstan pa la dge sbyong gis 'gyod de da ni byis pa dang 'dra bas gyi na zhig smras kyi rang ma gsod cig ces bsgo ba las shi yang rung ma shi yang rung phyis 'gyod de bsgo na sbom por zad do //🔽sman dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong du smos pa ltar bstan pa la dge sbyong gis 'gyod de da ni byis pa dang 'dra bas gyi na zhig smras kyi rang ma gsod cig ces bsgo ba las shi yang rung ma shi yang rung phyis 'gyod de bsgo na sbom por zad do // sman dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the monk later regrets his statement, whether or not the person dies, the monk commits a serious offense.🔽Medicines

original: sman de dug gis bsad pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: sman de dug gis bsad pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The story of a medicine that was poisoned

original: bcom ldan 'das dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Jetavana.

original: de na khyim bdag stobs sde zhes bya ba longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug pa chung ma dang yongs su spyod pa las khye'u gnyis bdog ste /🔽phu bo ni sde pa /
analyzed: de na khyim bdag stobs sde zhes bya ba longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug pa chung ma dang yongs su spyod pa las khye'u gnyis bdog ste / phu bo ni sde pa /
translated: There was a householder named Baladhara who lived there. He was very wealthy. He and his wife had two sons.🔽The elder son was named Sena.

original: nu bo ni nye sde zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: nu bo ni nye sde zhes ming du btags so //
translated: The younger son was named Upagupta.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na sde pa gzhan du tshong la chas pas nor mang du rnyed pas de chags te /
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na sde pa gzhan du tshong la chas pas nor mang du rnyed pas de chags te /
translated: Later, when he went to another country to trade, he acquired much wealth.

original: yun ring du ma log go //
analyzed: yun ring du ma log go //
translated: He became attached to it and did not return for a long time.

original: de nas sde ba'i chung ma 'dod chags kyis khol bar gyur nas nye sde la lan du ma zhig bsgugs pa las /
analyzed: de nas sde ba'i chung ma 'dod chags kyis khol bar gyur nas nye sde la lan du ma zhig bsgugs pa las /
translated: Then the wife of the householder, who was tormented by desire, waited for Upasena many times.

original: nye sdes kyang @15b phyi zhig na spyad de bu chags so //
analyzed: nye sdes kyang @15b phyi zhig na spyad de bu chags so //
translated: Upasena also had intercourse with her once, and she became pregnant.

original: de nas sde pa 'ong ba thos nas nye sdes 'jigs nas dze ta'i tshal du rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas sde pa 'ong ba thos nas nye sdes 'jigs nas dze ta'i tshal du rab tu byung ngo //

original: des phyis bdag gi khyim du phyin pa dang / sde pa'i chung mas khyo ni 'ong khyod ni thar na bdag ji ltar bya zhes dris pa dang / nye sdes grogs po sman pa gcig la ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras nas /
analyzed: des phyis bdag gi khyim du phyin pa dang / sde pa'i chung mas khyo ni 'ong khyod ni thar na bdag ji ltar bya zhes dris pa dang / nye sdes grogs po sman pa gcig la ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras nas /
translated: Later, when he came to his house, the wife of the householder asked, “My husband is coming. You are free. What should I do?” Upasena told his friend, the physician, in detail what had happened.

original: sman pas bdag gis mngal 'jig par 'gyur ba'i sman gyis mngal na yod pa de dum bur zhig par 'gyur ba de sbyin no zhes byas te /
analyzed: sman pas bdag gis mngal 'jig par 'gyur ba'i sman gyis mngal na yod pa de dum bur zhig par 'gyur ba de sbyin no zhes byas te /
translated: The physician said, “I will give you medicine that will destroy the fetus. That will cause the one in the womb to be destroyed and to be expelled in pieces.”

original: sde pa'i chung ma la sman phye ma blud pas rum na yod pa yang med par gyur to //
analyzed: sde pa'i chung ma la sman phye ma blud pas rum na yod pa yang med par gyur to //
translated: He gave the wife of the head of the community a medicinal powder, and the child in her womb disappeared.

original: nye sde yang sman byas pa la yi rang nas cang ma smras so //
analyzed: nye sde yang sman byas pa la yi rang nas cang ma smras so //
translated: Upagupta, having made the medicine, rejoiced in it, but said nothing.

original: dus phyi zhig na de ltar gyur ba skye bo kun gyis thos nas dge slong zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na de ltar gyur ba skye bo kun gyis thos nas dge slong zhes 'dzer to //

original: de ltar gyur pa de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol te /
translated: The monks told the Blessed One what had happened.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye sde la khyod kyis de ltar byas pa bden nam zhes smras nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye sde la khyod kyis de ltar byas pa bden nam zhes smras nas /
translated: The Blessed One asked Upagupta, “Is it true that you did this?”

original: btsun pa de ltar ni ma bgyis kyi rjes su yi rang ba ni bgyis so zhes gsol pas /
analyzed: btsun pa de ltar ni ma bgyis kyi rjes su yi rang ba ni bgyis so zhes gsol pas /
translated: “I did not do it, Venerable One, but I rejoiced in it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nye sde la ni ltung ba med kyis phyin chad de lta bu la yi rang na nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye sde la ni ltung ba med kyis phyin chad de lta bu la yi rang na nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “There is no offense for Upagupta, but from now on, if you rejoice in such things, you will be at fault.”

original: dge sbyong gis skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning la gsad sems kyis kha zas kyi nang du dug sbyar ma blugs pa dang / khrus chu dang / skom dang ; bdug spos kyi nang du dug gi phye ma blugs te 'dis 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam na yang de nyid kyi tshe shi 'am dus phyis shi na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning la gsad sems kyis kha zas kyi nang du dug sbyar ma blugs pa dang / khrus chu dang / skom dang ; bdug spos kyi nang du dug gi phye ma blugs te 'dis 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam na yang de nyid kyi tshe shi 'am dus phyis shi na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If a monk, with the intention to kill, puts poison in the food, drink, or bath of a man, woman, or neuter person, or if he puts powdered poison in their drink, food, or incense, thinking, “They will die from this,” and they die from that, then he is defeated.

original: ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If they do not die, then it is a serious transgression.

original: dge sbyong gis chang ngam smyo ba'i sman byin te shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi tshe 'am phyis shi na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis chang ngam smyo ba'i sman byin te shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de nyid kyi tshe 'am phyis shi na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If a monk gives alcohol or crazy medicine to someone, thinking, “They will die,” and they die from that, then he is defeated.

original: ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If they do not die, then it is a serious transgression.

original: 'chi ba'i phyogs su btang ngam zhes bya ba la dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis g-yang du phul ba dang / mer phul ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyogs su btang ba dang / stag gzig la sogs pa gcan gzan gdug pa'i gnas su btang ba dang /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i phyogs su btang ngam zhes bya ba la dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis g-yang du phul ba dang / mer phul ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyogs su btang ba dang / stag gzig la sogs pa gcan gzan gdug pa'i gnas su btang ba dang /
translated: If a monk, with the intention to kill, pushes someone off a cliff, into a fire, or into a dangerous place, such as a tiger’s lair,

original: sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa srog chags gdug pa'i gnas su btang ba 'am /
analyzed: sbrul dang sdig pa la sogs pa srog chags gdug pa'i gnas su btang ba 'am /
translated: If one sends a person to a place of poisonous snakes, scorpions, and so on, or if one wishes to kill a person, and

original: gsad par 'dod pas grang ba'i tshe grib ma la bzhag nas lhags pa la bor ba dang / dro ba'i tshe nyi ma la bzhag nas dro khung du bzhag ste thabs 'dis shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de'i tshe shi 'am phyis shi na yang phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: gsad par 'dod pas grang ba'i tshe grib ma la bzhag nas lhags pa la bor ba dang / dro ba'i tshe nyi ma la bzhag nas dro khung du bzhag ste thabs 'dis shi bar gyur cig snyam pa las de'i tshe shi 'am phyis shi na yang phas pham pa'o //
translated: if that person dies from cold when left in the shade during the winter and exposed to the wind, or if that person dies from heat when left in the sun during the summer and placed in a sauna, and if one thinks, “By this means, may he die,” and if that person dies at that time or later, there is a root downfall.

original: mi gzhan thabs rnams sna tshogs @16a * //
analyzed: mi gzhan thabs rnams sna tshogs @16a * //
translated: If one kills another person by various means,

original: kyis ; / bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la gzhan gsad pa'i bsam pas thabs kyis 'chi bas bsad pa 'am shing la 'ching bas bsad pa dang / de la dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis spyugs nas stag gzig gam 'phar spyang la sogs pas zos sam /
analyzed: kyis ; / bsad na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la gzhan gsad pa'i bsam pas thabs kyis 'chi bas bsad pa 'am shing la 'ching bas bsad pa dang / de la dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis spyugs nas stag gzig gam 'phar spyang la sogs pas zos sam /
translated: one’s spiritual deportment is ruined.

original: thabs ci yang rung bas shi na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ci yang rung bas shi na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If one kills another person by various means, such as killing by means of a weapon or killing by means of a trap, and if that person dies by any means whatsoever, there is a root downfall.

original: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis mi shing la 'breng rlon gyis bcings te bzhag pa la stag gzig gam 'phar spyang la sogs pas zos sam ci'i thabs kyis shi yang pham pa'o //🔽dge sbyong gis bud med sbrum ma gsad par bsams te dku mnyes pa las ma shi na phas pham pa'o //

translated: If a monk binds a person with a wet vine with the thought to kill him, and the person dies from being eaten by tigers, leopards, or wolves, or by any means, it is a defeat.🔽If a monk thinks to kill a pregnant woman and massages her belly, but she does not die, it is a defeat.

original: bu shi la ma ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: bu shi la ma ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If the child dies but the mother does not, it is a serious transgression.

original: gnyis ka ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If neither dies, it is a serious transgression.

original: bu bsad par 'dod de /🔽dku mnyes pa las bu shi la ma ma shi na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: bu bsad par 'dod de / dku mnyes pa las bu shi la ma ma shi na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If he wishes to kill the child,🔽and the child dies but the mother does not, it is a defeat.

original: bu ma shi la ma shi na yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: bu ma shi la ma shi na yang sbom po'o //
translated: If the child does not die but the mother does, it is also a serious transgression.

original: gnyis ka ma shi na yang sbom po'o ;
analyzed: gnyis ka ma shi na yang sbom po'o ;
translated: If neither dies, it is also a serious transgression.

original: / de bzhin du dge spyong gis gsad sems kyis snying khar 'debs pa'i ral gri dang chu gri bzhag pa dang / gtor ma bzhag pa dang / sa mda' dang / rtsang btsugs pa la sogs pa bzhag pa la shi na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du dge spyong gis gsad sems kyis snying khar 'debs pa'i ral gri dang chu gri bzhag pa dang / gtor ma bzhag pa dang / sa mda' dang / rtsang btsugs pa la sogs pa bzhag pa la shi na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If a monk places a sword or a knife at the heart of a person with the thought to kill him, or if he places an offering, or a stake, or a spear, and so on, and the person dies, it is a defeat.

original: ma shi na sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma shi na sbom po'o //
translated: If the victim does not die, it is a serious transgression.

original: 'di yan chad kyis phas pham pa'i zla la sbom po yang bcad de bshad do //
