analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis phas pham pa'i zla la sbom po yang bcad de bshad do //
translated: Up to this point, the text has explained the serious transgression that is similar to a defeating offense.

original: yan lag bdun dang ldan na srog gcod pa'i mtshan nyid phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag bdun dang ldan na srog gcod pa'i mtshan nyid phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: When seven factors are present, the characteristic of killing is a defeating offense.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: mi'i rgyud yin /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud yin /
translated: The victim is a human being.

original: mi yin / gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: mi yin / gzhan ma yin /
translated: The victim is another person, not oneself.

original: mir 'du shes /
analyzed: mir 'du shes /
translated: One perceives the victim as such.

original: sbyor ba byas /
analyzed: sbyor ba byas /
translated: One performs the act.

original: 'tsho ba nyams /
analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams /
translated: One’s livelihood is not impaired.

original: bdag ma smyos pa'o //🔽byol song dang ni sems dmyal dang // yi dags 'on te lha yang rung //
analyzed: bdag ma smyos pa'o // byol song dang ni sems dmyal dang // yi dags 'on te lha yang rung //
translated: One is not insane.🔽If one kills an animal, a hell being, a ghost, or even a god,

original: bsad na ngan 'gror lhung ba yis //
analyzed: bsad na ngan 'gror lhung ba yis //
translated: one will fall into a miserable realm

original: sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur //
translated: and incur a serious transgression.

original: brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
translated: If one kills thinking, “I am a tantric practitioner,”

original: lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba las //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba las //
translated: and one’s actions are those of body and speech,

original: skye bo gson yang de la ni //
analyzed: skye bo gson yang de la ni //
translated: even if the victim lives,

original: kha na ma tho rnam gsum 'gyur //
analyzed: kha na ma tho rnam gsum 'gyur //
translated: one still commits the three kinds of misdeeds.

original: zhes bya bas nyes pa sbom po'i gnas bstan te ;
analyzed: zhes bya bas nyes pa sbom po'i gnas bstan te ;
translated: This verse teaches the basis of a serious transgression.

original: byol song ni rta dang ba lang dang lug la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byol song ni rta dang ba lang dang lug la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: “Animals” refers to horses, cows, sheep, and so on.

original: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis byol song bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis byol song bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If a monk kills an animal with the intention to kill, he obtains a serious offense.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba sems can dmyal ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang zhes bya ba sems can dmyal ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Hell beings and so on means that there are two types of hell beings:

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po @16b dang ; phyogs gcig pa'i sems can dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po @16b dang ; phyogs gcig pa'i sems can dmyal ba'o //
translated: great hell beings and hell beings in a specific place.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Great hell beings are of two types:

original: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang / grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba dang / grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba'o //
translated: hot hell beings and cold hell beings.

original: de la tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba ni mnar med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / ngu 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms dang / thig nag dang / yang sos so //
analyzed: de la tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba ni mnar med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / ngu 'bod dang / bsdus 'joms dang / thig nag dang / yang sos so //
translated: Hot hell beings are the Avīci, Tapana, Pratāpana, Mahāraurava, Raurava, Saṃghāta, Kālasūtra and Saṃjīva hells.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba chen po la yang brgyad de /
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba chen po la yang brgyad de /
translated: Cold hell beings are the eight great hells:

original: chu bur dang / chu bur chen po dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / autpa la dang / autpa la chen po dang / ha ha zhes zer ba dang ; hu hu zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chu bur dang / chu bur chen po dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / autpa la dang / autpa la chen po dang / ha ha zhes zer ba dang ; hu hu zhes zer ro //
translated: Blisters, Large Blisters, Red Lotus, Great Red Lotus, Blue Lotus, Great Blue Lotus, and Wailing.

original: phyogs gcig pa'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i longs spyod kyang yod la bar 'ga' ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang myong ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba ni lha'i longs spyod kyang yod la bar 'ga' ni sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang myong ba'o //
translated: The hell of partial suffering is so called because the gods experience the suffering of hell only occasionally.

original: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis sems can dmyal ba bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽yi dags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis sems can dmyal ba bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro // yi dags zhes bya ba la /
translated: If a monk kills a hell-being with the intention of killing a hell-being, he commits a serious offense.

original: yi dags zhes bya ba ni phal cher gcong rong dang mya ngan dag na gnas so //
analyzed: yi dags zhes bya ba ni phal cher gcong rong dang mya ngan dag na gnas so //
translated: The hungry ghosts are so called because they are mostly tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis yi dags bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis gsad sems kyis yi dags bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If a monk kills a hungry ghost with the intention of killing a hungry ghost, he commits a serious offense.

original: lha yang rung zhes bya bas 'dod khams kyi lha dang / gzugs khams kyi lha dang / gnas ris bcu bdun zhes bya ba na gnas pa'i lha rnams dge sbyong gis bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lha yang rung zhes bya bas 'dod khams kyi lha dang / gzugs khams kyi lha dang / gnas ris bcu bdun zhes bya ba na gnas pa'i lha rnams dge sbyong gis bsad na sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase even a god refers to the gods of the desire realm, the gods of the form realm, and the gods who abide in the seventeen abodes. The phrase if a spiritual practitioner kills them is to be supplied in each case.

original: sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba gang zhe na /🔽sdig pa sbom po'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa sbom po thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba gang zhe na / sdig pa sbom po'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: What is meant by the phrase “one would incur a grave misdeed”?

original: bsad na ngan song ltung ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsad na ngan song ltung ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result of a grave misdeed, the root text states that “one would fall into the lower realms.”

original: dper na dug chen pos kyang skyes bu chen po gsod la /
analyzed: dper na dug chen pos kyang skyes bu chen po gsod la /
translated: For example, a great poison can kill a great person.

original: dug chung dus kyang skyes bu chen po gsod pa dang / de bzhin du me stag chen pos kyang yul chen po tshig la me stag chung dus kyang yul chen po sreg pa dang / phas pham pa byung na ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyes pa sbom po byung ba la tshul bzhin du ma bshags na ngan song gsum du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
analyzed: dug chung dus kyang skyes bu chen po gsod pa dang / de bzhin du me stag chen pos kyang yul chen po tshig la me stag chung dus kyang yul chen po sreg pa dang / phas pham pa byung na ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyes pa sbom po byung ba la tshul bzhin du ma bshags na ngan song gsum du ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // brtul zhugs can gyis bsad snyam ste //
translated: Just as a small poison can kill a great person, and just as a small spark can burn a great country, and just as a small fault can cause a downfall into the three lower realms if it is not properly confessed, so also a great fault can cause a downfall into the three lower realms if it is not properly confessed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thinking “I will kill one who is celibate,”🔽one who is celibate is a monk, a nun, or a male or female novice.

original: dge sbyong gis skyes pa dang bud med dang / ma ning ste mi rnam pa gsum las gang yang rung ba cig bsad do snyam du bsams te lus dang ngag gi @17a * //🔽sbyor ba bshams pa las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis skyes pa dang bud med dang / ma ning ste mi rnam pa gsum las gang yang rung ba cig bsad do snyam du bsams te lus dang ngag gi @17a * // sbyor ba bshams pa las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thinking “I will kill one of these,” if one prepares the action with body and speech,

original: lus kyis bshams te khu tshur dang thal mo dang rdo dbyig dang mtshon chas kyang btab /
analyzed: lus kyis bshams te khu tshur dang thal mo dang rdo dbyig dang mtshon chas kyang btab /
translated: one prepares with the body by striking with one’s fist, palm, stone, club, or weapon.

original: ngag gis bshams te gong du bshad pa bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / nad pa rnams 'chi ba'i rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngag gis bshams te gong du bshad pa bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / nad pa rnams 'chi ba'i rigs so zhes bsngags pa brjod pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By speech, one prepares by saying, It is right to kill those who are immoral, as explained above, and It is right to kill the sick, and so on.

original: skye bo gson yang de la ni //🔽kha na ma tho rnam gsum 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bo gson yang de la ni // kha na ma tho rnam gsum 'gyur //
translated: Even if the person lives,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: there are three kinds of offenses.

original: gsad par yang bsams lus dang ngag gis kyang bshams pa las mi gsum po gson te ma shi yang dge sbyong de la kha na ma tho ba rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsad par yang bsams lus dang ngag gis kyang bshams pa las mi gsum po gson te ma shi yang dge sbyong de la kha na ma tho ba rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the three people live and do not die, the śramaṇa obtains three kinds of offenses:

original: yid kyi nyes pa sbom po dang / lus kyi nyes pa sbom po dang / ngag gi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes pa sbom po dang / lus kyi nyes pa sbom po dang / ngag gi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: a grave offense of the mind, a grave offense of the body, and a grave offense of speech.

original: de la gsad par bsams pas na yid kyi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gsad par bsams pas na yid kyi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, by thinking of killing, one obtains a grave offense of the mind.

original: lus kyis bshams pas na lus kyi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis bshams pas na lus kyi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By preparing with body and speech, one obtains a grave offense of the body and a grave offense of speech.

original: ngag gis bshams pas na ngag gi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gis bshams pas na ngag gi nyes pa sbom po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one has prepared it with speech, one obtains the grave fault of speech.🔽If one does not confess them properly, one will fall into the three lower realms.

original: de dag tshul bzhin du ma bshags na ngan song gsum du ltung ngo zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag tshul bzhin du ma bshags na ngan song gsum du ltung ngo zhes sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply the above explanation.🔽One should not strike with a stone, a stick, or a fist,🔽or harm others in any way,

original: rdo dbyug khu tshur 'tshog pa dang // de las gzhan pa'i gnod pa dang // ba lang la sogs gnod mi bya //
analyzed: rdo dbyug khu tshur 'tshog pa dang // de las gzhan pa'i gnod pa dang // ba lang la sogs gnod mi bya //
translated: or harm cattle and so on,

original: rta la sogs pa mi bzhon no //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa mi bzhon no //
translated: or ride horses and so on.

original: zhes bya bas nyes byas kyi gnas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas nyes byas kyi gnas bstan te /
translated: This teaches the bases of training.

original: de zhes bya ba la gsad sems ni med kyi dge sbyong gis khro sems kyis mi rnam pa gsum la btsogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la gsad sems ni med kyi dge sbyong gis khro sems kyis mi rnam pa gsum la btsogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: As for “one should not,” if one has no intention to kill, but out of anger a monk strikes any of the three types of persons, it becomes a minor offense.

original: khu tshur 'tshog pa dang zhes bya ba la gsad sems ni med kyis /
analyzed: khu tshur 'tshog pa dang zhes bya ba la gsad sems ni med kyis /
translated: As for “one should not strike with a stone, a stick, or a fist,” if one has no intention to kill,

original: khro sems kyis mi rnam pa gsum btsogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: khro sems kyis mi rnam pa gsum btsogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro ;
translated: but out of anger strikes any of the three types of persons, it becomes a minor offense.

original: / de las gzhan pa'i gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni gsad sems med par khro sems kyis mi rnams la thal mo bsnun nam /
analyzed: / de las gzhan pa'i gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni gsad sems med par khro sems kyis mi rnams la thal mo bsnun nam /
translated: “Any other harm” means that if, without the intention to kill, one strikes people with one’s palm or a whip out of anger,

original: lcag gis gzhus sam /🔽lhags pa'i tshe grang ba la bor tam /
analyzed: lcag gis gzhus sam / lhags pa'i tshe grang ba la bor tam /
translated: Or did you beat it with a whip?🔽Or did you throw it out in the cold when it was cold?🔽

original: tsha ba'i tshe dro ba la bor na nyes byas su 'gyur te dbyug pa la sogs pa'i grangs su phag pa nyes byas kyi grangs kyang de snyed cig 'thob bo //
analyzed: tsha ba'i tshe dro ba la bor na nyes byas su 'gyur te dbyug pa la sogs pa'i grangs su phag pa nyes byas kyi grangs kyang de snyed cig 'thob bo //
translated: if one throws them into the cold when it is cold, or into the heat when it is hot, one commits an offense of wrong conduct. One also obtains that many offenses of wrong conduct as there are sticks, and so on.

original: ba lang la sogs gnod mi bya //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs gnod mi bya //
translated: Do not harm cattle, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang ba lang dang glang po che dang rta dang lug la sogs pa la khal dgal ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang ba lang dang glang po che dang rta dang lug la sogs pa la khal dgal ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa mi bya ste /
translated: “Do not harm cattle, and so on” means that one should not harm cattle, elephants, horses, sheep, and so on, by making them carry loads, beating them, and so on.

original: de lta bu'i gnod pa byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnod pa byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one harms them in such ways, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rta la sogs pa mi bzhon @17b no ;
analyzed: rta la sogs pa mi bzhon @17b no ;
translated: Do not ride horses, and so on.

original: / zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gis rta dang glang po che la sogs pa bzhon par mi bya ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gis rta dang glang po che la sogs pa bzhon par mi bya ste /
translated: “Do not ride horses, and so on” means that a monk should not ride horses, elephants, and so on.

original: zhon na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhon na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de la gnod sems med la yan lag gzhan yod na ni nyes byas su bzhag go //
analyzed: de la gnod sems med la yan lag gzhan yod na ni nyes byas su bzhag go //
translated: If there is no malice but there are other branches, it is considered a minor offense.

original: gnod sems yod la yan lag gzhan mi ldan na sbom po'o //
analyzed: gnod sems yod la yan lag gzhan mi ldan na sbom po'o //
translated: If there is malice but there are no other branches, it is a serious offense.

original: yan lag thams cad dang ldan na mi de nor te gzhan bsad na yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad dang ldan na mi de nor te gzhan bsad na yang sbom po'o //
translated: If all the branches are present, even if the person is killed by mistake, it is a serious offense.

original: gsad par bsams te sbyor ba byas pa las ma shi na yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: gsad par bsams te sbyor ba byas pa las ma shi na yang sbom po'o //
translated: If one prepares to kill but the person does not die, it is a serious offense.

original: yan lag thams cad dang ldan na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad dang ldan na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If all the branches are present, it is a defeating offense.

original: phas pham pa bzhi las srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: phas pham pa bzhi las srog gcod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so /
translated: The defeating offense of killing is complete.

original: // / ma byin par len pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yul rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / ma byin par len pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yul rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The Background for Taking What is Not Given The Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Bamboo Grove, in the Squirrels’ Feeding Ground.

original: de'i tshe sngon rdza mkhan las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong nor can zhes bya ba zhig rgyal po'i khab kyi dgon pa na spyil po byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon rdza mkhan las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong nor can zhes bya ba zhig rgyal po'i khab kyi dgon pa na spyil po byas nas gnas so //
translated: At that time, a monk named Dhanika, who had previously been a potter, had built a hut in a forest near Rājagṛha and was staying there.

original: de nas nor can gang gi tshe rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab kyi phyugs rdzi dang shing thun rnams kyis spyil po bshig dral cing rtsva dang shing rnams so sor khyer ro //
analyzed: de nas nor can gang gi tshe rgyal po'i khab tu bsod snyoms la zhugs pa de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab kyi phyugs rdzi dang shing thun rnams kyis spyil po bshig dral cing rtsva dang shing rnams so sor khyer ro //
translated: Then, when he went to the capital for alms, the cowherds and wood-gatherers of the capital destroyed his hut and carried off the grass and wood.

original: de lta bu lan du ma zhig byas pa dang rdza mkhan nor can gyis bsams pa 'di lta bu thams cad du gtses shing spyil po byed pa yang shin tu nyon mongs la dag ba'i bar chad du yang 'gyur bas 'o na bdag gis sngon gyi gnas rjes
analyzed: de lta bu lan du ma zhig byas pa dang rdza mkhan nor can gyis bsams pa 'di lta bu thams cad du gtses shing spyil po byed pa yang shin tu nyon mongs la dag ba'i bar chad du yang 'gyur bas 'o na bdag gis sngon gyi gnas rjes
translated: When this happened many times, the potter Dhṛḍha thought, “This is very troublesome. It is a hindrance to my work. Now I will build a hut on the ground and live there.”

original: su bsgrub pas sa'i spyil po zhig byas la so btang ste gnas so snyam du bsams nas khang bu'i rmang bting zhing brtsigs nas so btang nas shin tu mdzes pa me tog dzi ba ka bzhin du dmar zhing 'tsher ba zhig byas te gnas so //
analyzed: su bsgrub pas sa'i spyil po zhig byas la so btang ste gnas so snyam du bsams nas khang bu'i rmang bting zhing brtsigs nas so btang nas shin tu mdzes pa me tog dzi ba ka bzhin du dmar zhing 'tsher ba zhig byas te gnas so //
translated: He built the foundation of a house, built it up, put on the roof, and made it very beautiful, red and shiny like a jīvaka flower.

original: dus gzhan zhig na bcom ldan 'das 'khor dge slong rnams dang gnas rgyu zhing gshegs pas khang bu gzigs nas su'i yin /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na bcom ldan 'das 'khor dge slong rnams dang gnas rgyu zhing gshegs pas khang bu gzigs nas su'i yin /
translated: He asked, To whom does this belong?

original: de ni dge slong nor can gyi lags so zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ni dge slong nor can gyi lags so zhes smras so //
translated: They replied, It belongs to the monk Dhanika.

original: 'di lta bu'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams ngal 'phya bar 'gyur gyis khang bu choms shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i phyir mu stegs pa rnams ngal 'phya bar 'gyur gyis khang bu choms shig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, This is the kind of thing that causes non-Buddhists to criticize us. Destroy the hut.

original: dge slong rnams kyis khang bu bcom ste gnas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis khang bu bcom ste gnas so //
translated: The monks destroyed the hut and stayed there.

original: de nas yang nor can gyis bsam pa rgyal po'i khab gyi shing srungs kyi dpon dang bdag mdza' bas shing gi khang pa zhig bya'o snyam du bsams nas /🔽shing srungs pa la lhas shing byin pa 'on cig ces smras pa dang / shing @18a * //
analyzed: de nas yang nor can gyis bsam pa rgyal po'i khab gyi shing srungs kyi dpon dang bdag mdza' bas shing gi khang pa zhig bya'o snyam du bsams nas / shing srungs pa la lhas shing byin pa 'on cig ces smras pa dang / shing @18a * //
translated: Then Dhanika thought, Since I am friends with the head of the foresters of Rājagṛha, I will build a wooden hut.🔽He said to the head forester, Please give me some wood from the king's forest.

original: srungs kyi dpon pos kyang lhas phul na btsun pa ci bder snoms shig ces smras nas /
analyzed: srungs kyi dpon pos kyang lhas phul na btsun pa ci bder snoms shig ces smras nas /
translated: The head forester said, If it is offered by the king, Venerable, please take it as you wish.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi zhig ral bcos pa'i rgyu shing bcad pa du ma zhig gshags gtubs te khyer ba grong khyer srungs pa'i dpon pos mthong nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra la smras so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi zhig ral bcos pa'i rgyu shing bcad pa du ma zhig gshags gtubs te khyer ba grong khyer srungs pa'i dpon pos mthong nas rgyal po ma skyes dgra la smras so //
translated: The chief of the city guards saw that many of the trees that had been cut down to repair the damage in Rājagṛha had been cut and carried away. He told King Ajātaśatru.

original: rgyu mtshan can bkug ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can bkug ste /
translated: The king summoned the monk and said,

original: dge slong khyod ni shing ma byin par len pa dbang byas pa dang / mi dbang gis bdag la stsal to //
analyzed: dge slong khyod ni shing ma byin par len pa dbang byas pa dang / mi dbang gis bdag la stsal to //
translated: “Monk, you have taken wood without giving the price and have been given it by someone without authority.”

original: sngon yab kyis lha khyod rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe nga'i yul dge bar grags pas dge slong dang bram ze rnams rtsva dang shing dang chu ma byin par mi spyod pa de thams cad ci bder spyod cig ces khyu mchog gi sgra chen po bsgrags pa ni
analyzed: sngon yab kyis lha khyod rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe nga'i yul dge bar grags pas dge slong dang bram ze rnams rtsva dang shing dang chu ma byin par mi spyod pa de thams cad ci bder spyod cig ces khyu mchog gi sgra chen po bsgrags pa ni
translated: “Previously, when your father consecrated you as king, he proclaimed with the great lion’s roar, ‘Since my country is known for its virtue, monks and brahmans may use grass, wood, and water without giving the price. All of them may use these as they wish.’

original: mi dgongs sam /
analyzed: mi dgongs sam /
translated: Do you not remember that?”🔽The king said,

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,🔽🔽

original: de ni yongs su bzung ba med pa la bya'i yongs su bzung ba la ni ma yin no zhes smras pa dang / yongs su ma bzung ba la ni rgyal pos mnga' bgyir ci mchis zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po shin tu khros nas ma byin par len pa'i dge slong bsad par rigs na khyod da slan chad de ltar ma byed cig ces spyos nas slar btang ngo //
analyzed: de ni yongs su bzung ba med pa la bya'i yongs su bzung ba la ni ma yin no zhes smras pa dang / yongs su ma bzung ba la ni rgyal pos mnga' bgyir ci mchis zhes gsol pa dang / rgyal po shin tu khros nas ma byin par len pa'i dge slong bsad par rigs na khyod da slan chad de ltar ma byed cig ces spyos nas slar btang ngo //
translated: The king became very angry and said, It is right to kill a monk who takes what is not given. From now on, do not do that again. He scolded him and sent him back.

original: de nas de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: Then the monks told the Blessed One what had happened.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo khyod song la rgyal po'i grong dpon dang ded dpon lam byin par len pa ji tsam zhig blangs pas srog la 'bab pa dang yul nas dbyung ba'i chad pa gcod par byed smos shig ces bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bos de bzhin du smras pa dang /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod song la rgyal po'i grong dpon dang ded dpon lam byin par len pa ji tsam zhig blangs pas srog la 'bab pa dang yul nas dbyung ba'i chad pa gcod par byed smos shig ces bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bos de bzhin du smras pa dang /
translated: Ānanda, go and tell the king's chief and captain that they should impose a punishment of death or banishment for taking what is not given to the extent that it endangers life. Ānanda did as he was told.

original: ma sha ka lnga'am lnga las lhag pa blangs pas srog la 'bab pa dang yul nas 'byin pa'i chad pa gcod do zhes mchi ba bcom ldan 'das la de bzhin gsol pas /
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga'am lnga las lhag pa blangs pas srog la 'bab pa dang yul nas 'byin pa'i chad pa gcod do zhes mchi ba bcom ldan 'das la de bzhin gsol pas /
translated: If a monk takes five māsakas or more than five, he is subject to the penalty of death or banishment from the country.

original: dge slong nor can bkug nas rnam grangs du mar smad nas 'dul bal bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong nor can bkug nas rnam grangs du mar smad nas 'dul bal bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One was informed of this, and after summoning the monk Dhanika, he reprimanded him in many ways and established a rule of training for the monks.

original: dge tshul bdag gam gzhan rnams kyis //
analyzed: dge tshul bdag gam gzhan rnams kyis //
translated: A novice monk, whether himself or through others,

original: rku sems mthu dang 'jab bu yis //🔽'khrul pa med par mi gzhan gyi //
analyzed: rku sems mthu dang 'jab bu yis // 'khrul pa med par mi gzhan gyi //
translated: with the intention to steal, by force or stealth,🔽without error,

original: gnas nas ma sha lnga tsam mam //
analyzed: gnas nas ma sha lnga tsam mam //
translated: from the place of another, five māsakas or more,

original: rang gi yul nas byung ba yang //
analyzed: rang gi yul nas byung ba yang //
translated: or from his own country,

original: k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus //
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus //
translated: four kārṣāpaṇas or more,

original: de brkus tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur //
analyzed: de brkus tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur //
translated: if he steals that, his morality is destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba la dge tshul ni rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dge tshul ni rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: A novice monk is one who abides in the vows of ordination.

original: bdag gis kyang rku sems dang ldan pas mthu dang 'jab bu @18b yis brkus na tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang rku sems dang ldan pas mthu dang 'jab bu @18b yis brkus na tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If he himself, with the intention to steal, steals by force or stealth, his morality is destroyed.

original: 'di ltar rku sems dang ldan pas mthu dang 'jab bus k'ar sh'a pana'i bzhi cha brkus te rin thang tshang na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rku sems dang ldan pas mthu dang 'jab bus k'ar sh'a pana'i bzhi cha brkus te rin thang tshang na phas pham pa'o //
translated: Thus, if one steals with a mind of theft, through power or stealth, a quarter of a kārṣāpaṇa, if the value is complete, there is a root downfall.🔽If there is no mind of theft, there is a single offense of wrongdoing to be restricted.

original: rku sems med na bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas gcig / gzhan gyis mthu dang 'jab bus brkus na tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rku sems med na bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas gcig / gzhan gyis mthu dang 'jab bus brkus na tshul khrims zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: If one steals through the power or stealth of another, the moral discipline is destroyed.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin gyis dge slong grogs po zhig la rkur bcug pa las des mthu dang 'jab bus brkus te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin gyis dge slong grogs po zhig la rkur bcug pa las des mthu dang 'jab bus brkus te /
translated: If one does not do it oneself, but one induces a companion bhikṣu to steal, and he steals through his own power or stealth,

original: nor bdag cag so sor bgos rin thang tshang na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor bdag cag so sor bgos rin thang tshang na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: if the owners divide the stolen property among themselves, and the value is complete, there is a root downfall.🔽If the value is incomplete, there is a single serious offense.🔽If one steals a portion of the stolen property, there is a single serious offense.🔽If one steals without error,🔽there is a single serious offense.

original: rin thang ma tshang na nyes byas sbom po re re brkus na brkus shas kyi skal ba blangs na nyes pa sbom po gcig /'khrul pa med par mi gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa ni rmongs pa dang mi dran pa yin la de med pa ni🔽sems rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rin thang ma tshang na nyes byas sbom po re re brkus na brkus shas kyi skal ba blangs na nyes pa sbom po gcig /'khrul pa med par mi gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la 'khrul pa ni rmongs pa dang mi dran pa yin la de med pa ni🔽sems rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: Error is delusion and forgetfulness.

original: yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de nyid mngon par thob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang brku bar bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de nyid mngon par thob pa la bya ste /
translated: Also, the object to be stolen is the object that is actually obtained.🔽Until the object to be stolen is obtained, it is said that one is confused about the object obtained from another.

original: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas nyid ni ma thob kyi bar du rdzas gzhan gyis thob pa las 'khrul zhes bya ste de ni rin thang tshang yang phas pham par mi bya ste spom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rdzas nyid ni ma thob kyi bar du rdzas gzhan gyis thob pa las 'khrul zhes bya ste de ni rin thang tshang yang phas pham par mi bya ste spom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the value is complete, it is not a defeating offense, but a serious transgression.

original: mi gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nor dgar ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mi gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag gi nor dgar ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Another person refers to someone who is not a relative.

original: mi gzhan gyi nor brkus na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gzhan gyi nor brkus na phas pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals the property of another person, it is a defeating offense.

original: bdag gi nor brkus na rin thang tshang yang spom por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi nor brkus na rin thang tshang yang spom por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals one’s own property, even if the value is complete, it is not a defeating offense.

original: gnas nas ma sha lnga tsam zhes bya ba la gnas ni nor rdzas gnas nas spags te bar du chod rin thang tshang ba las pham pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas ma sha lnga tsam zhes bya ba la gnas ni nor rdzas gnas nas spags te bar du chod rin thang tshang ba las pham pa'o //
translated: If one steals from a place, it is a defeating offense if the value is complete and the theft is from a place that is not one’s own property.

original: de yang gnas gcig ste gzhi ma nyams pa la tshon la sogs pa ma grogs pa dang / sa sgar sgur med na gzhi gcig pa zhes bya ba ste nam tha dad pa gcig gis ma chod kyi bar du pham par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de yang gnas gcig ste gzhi ma nyams pa la tshon la sogs pa ma grogs pa dang / sa sgar sgur med na gzhi gcig pa zhes bya ba ste nam tha dad pa gcig gis ma chod kyi bar du pham par mi gzhag go //
translated: Furthermore, if the basis, the one place, is not damaged, and if the color and so forth are not damaged, and if the ground is not uneven, it is called “one basis.”

original: ma sha lnga tsam zhes bya ba ni rgya gar gyi rin thang gzhal na dngul zho gcig tsam brkus na pham bar brtsi'o //
analyzed: ma sha lnga tsam zhes bya ba ni rgya gar gyi rin thang gzhal na dngul zho gcig tsam brkus na pham bar brtsi'o //
translated: As for “the value of five Indian masha coins,” if one steals the value of one Indian zho, it is considered a defeat.

original: yang kha cig gis ni zho'i brgyad cha gcig la byas te de tsam gyis ni rin thang tshang bar brtsi'o //
analyzed: yang kha cig gis ni zho'i brgyad cha gcig la byas te de tsam gyis ni rin thang tshang bar brtsi'o //
translated: Some say that it is one eighth of a zho, and that the value is considered complete with that much.

original: rang gi yul nas byung ba gang zhes bya ba ni rin thang tshang ba yang brkus ba'i dus de nyid na rin thang tshang ma tshang brtsi'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul nas byung ba gang zhes bya ba ni rin thang tshang ba yang brkus ba'i dus de nyid na rin thang tshang ma tshang brtsi'o //
translated: “Whatever comes from one’s own country” means that if the value is complete, the value is considered complete at the time of the theft.

original: kha cig brkus pa'i dus de nyid na rin thang ma tshang la dkon mod dang sbyar te /
analyzed: kha cig brkus pa'i dus de nyid na rin thang ma tshang la dkon mod dang sbyar te /
translated: Some say that at the time of the theft the value is not complete, but it is considered complete in relation to the rarity.

original: dus phyi zhig na rin thang tshang ba lta bu ni pham par mi gzhag sbom po'o //
analyzed: dus phyi zhig na rin thang tshang ba lta bu ni pham par mi gzhag sbom po'o //
translated: If the value is complete at a later time, it is not considered a defeat, but a serious transgression.

original: k'arsh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus //
analyzed: k'arsh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus //
translated: The fourth part of a kārṣāpaṇa is the measure of stealing a trifling object.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du ma sha lnga bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du ma sha lnga bshad pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The five māsas are as explained above.

original: @19a * // sbyor ba'i tshe na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni dang po brku bar bsams te stan dang khri las langs pa'i dus nyid na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //🔽rdo khu rtsa ba 'bras bu shing //
analyzed: @19a * // sbyor ba'i tshe na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni dang po brku bar bsams te stan dang khri las langs pa'i dus nyid na nyes byas su 'gyur ro // rdo khu rtsa ba 'bras bu shing //
translated: At the time of preparation, there is an offense of wrong conduct means that at the very time of thinking to steal and rising from one's seat, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The root text states, Roots, fruits, trees, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la rtsa ba ni gla sgang dang bod nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rtsa ba ni gla sgang dang bod nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Roots are ginger, garlic, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni shing thog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni shing thog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fruits are fruit trees and so on.

original: shing ni skyed shing rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: shing ni skyed shing rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: Trees are various kinds of fruit trees.

original: de dag brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa ma tshang na sbom po'o //🔽sdong bu lo ma shun pa chu //
analyzed: de dag brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa ma tshang na sbom po'o // sdong bu lo ma shun pa chu //
translated: If the value of those stolen is complete, there is a defeating offense; if incomplete, there is a serious offense.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, Stems, leaves, bark, water, and so on.

original: sdong bu ni mar dang sman khril bu'i rigs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdong bu ni mar dang sman khril bu'i rigs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Stems are stems that belong to the category of butter and medicinal plants.

original: lo ma ni shing lo ldum longs spyad par 'os par rung ba'o //
analyzed: lo ma ni shing lo ldum longs spyad par 'os par rung ba'o //
translated: Leaves are leaves that are suitable for use as vegetables.

original: shun pa ni gro ga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shun pa ni gro ga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bark is birch bark and so on.

original: chu ni khrus chu dang btung chu lta bu ste rgya mtshor zhugs pa dang mya ngam lta bur 'gro ba ste chu shin du dkon pa'i dus na brku ba'o //
analyzed: chu ni khrus chu dang btung chu lta bu ste rgya mtshor zhugs pa dang mya ngam lta bur 'gro ba ste chu shin du dkon pa'i dus na brku ba'o //
translated: Water is for bathing and drinking. Stealing it is when one draws off the water of a river or canal, or when one steals the water of a well or spring in a time of drought.🔽Flowers are those growing in water and those growing on land.

original: me tog chu skyes thang skyes dang // zhes bya ba ni me tog chu nas skyes pa padma dang autpal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: me tog chu skyes thang skyes dang // zhes bya ba ni me tog chu nas skyes pa padma dang autpal la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those growing in water are lotuses, water lilies, and so on.

original: thang las skyes pa ste n'a ga ge sar la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: thang las skyes pa ste n'a ga ge sar la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Those growing on land are jasmine, campaka, and so on.

original: / zhing dang lo thog sa gzhi dang // zhes bya ba la zhing gi mu rku ba ste /🔽yul gyi rgyal po'i bka' khrims las byung ba bzhin rin thang brtsi'o //
analyzed: / zhing dang lo thog sa gzhi dang // zhes bya ba la zhing gi mu rku ba ste /🔽yul gyi rgyal po'i bka' khrims las byung ba bzhin rin thang brtsi'o //
translated: Fields, crops, and land are fields belonging to others, and crops are rice, barley, and so on.🔽Land is the ground.

original: lo tog ni than pa chen po'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing la chu gtong ba gcod cing bdag gi zhing la chu gtong ba dang / char pa che ba'i dus na bdag gi zhing la chu bcad nas gzhan gyi zhing la btang ste bdag gi lo legs la gzhan gyi lo nyes na rin thang tshang na pham pa /
analyzed: lo tog ni than pa chen po'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing la chu gtong ba gcod cing bdag gi zhing la chu gtong ba dang / char pa che ba'i dus na bdag gi zhing la chu bcad nas gzhan gyi zhing la btang ste bdag gi lo legs la gzhan gyi lo nyes na rin thang tshang na pham pa /
translated: When there is a great drought, if one diverts the water to one's own field, cutting off the water to another's field, or when there is a great deal of rain, if one diverts the water to another's field, cutting off the water to one's own field, and if one's own crops are good and another's crops are bad, then if the value is complete, there is a root downfall.

original: ma tshang na sbom po'o //
analyzed: ma tshang na sbom po'o //
translated: If it is incomplete, there is a serious transgression.

original: lo tog gnyis ka la ma phan yang bla snyam pas zhing rku sems de ltar btang ste pha rol po la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo tog gnyis ka la ma phan yang bla snyam pas zhing rku sems de ltar btang ste pha rol po la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if both crops are not benefited, if one thinks, 'It does not matter,' and sends the mind of stealing to the field, then for the other person there is a serious transgression.

original: zhing rku ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhing rku ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of stealing fields:

original: shags bkar gtong ba dang ra bas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: shags bkar gtong ba dang ra bas bskor ba'o //
translated: fields that are assigned by lot and fields that are surrounded by fences.

original: dge sbyong gis zhal che ba 'am yul dpon gyi mdun du shags bkye la dge sbyong rgyal bar bcad la khyim pas kyang sbyor ba'i bsam pa btang na pham pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis zhal che ba 'am yul dpon gyi mdun du shags bkye la dge sbyong rgyal bar bcad la khyim pas kyang sbyor ba'i bsam pa btang na pham pa /
translated: If an ascetic engages in a lawsuit in the presence of a judge or a local ruler, and if the ascetic is declared the winner, then if the householder gives up the thought of engaging in the action, there is a root downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i bsam pa ma btang na sbom po'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bsam pa ma btang na sbom po'o //
translated: If the householder does not give up the thought of engaging in the action, there is a serious transgression.

original: rgyal pos rgyal bar bcad na yul gyi gtso bos rgyal bar gyur par gcad ma thag tu pham pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos rgyal bar bcad na yul gyi gtso bos rgyal bar gyur par gcad ma thag tu pham pa'o //
translated: If the king decides in favor of the king, then as soon as the head of the country decides in favor of the king, there is defeat.

original: bskor bas brku ba ni zhing la ra ba dang 'obs lta bus skor bar byed pa na nam langs kyi sna ma phrad kyi bar du sbom po'o //
analyzed: bskor bas brku ba ni zhing la ra ba dang 'obs lta bus skor bar byed pa na nam langs kyi sna ma phrad kyi bar du sbom po'o //
translated: Stealing by surrounding is when one surrounds a field with a wall or a moat. As long as one does not reach the wall or moat at dawn, there is a serious violation.

original: phrad na pham par gzhag go //
analyzed: phrad na pham par gzhag go //
translated: If one reaches it, it is considered defeat.

original: sa gzhi ni khangs dang tshong dus lta bu ste /
analyzed: sa gzhi ni khangs dang tshong dus lta bu ste /
translated: The ground is like snow or a marketplace.

original: dge sbyong gis mi dbang bzhin brkus na rin thang tshang na pham @19b pa'o ;
analyzed: dge sbyong gis mi dbang bzhin brkus na rin thang tshang na pham @19b pa'o ;
translated: If a monk steals like a powerful man, if the value is complete, there is defeat.

original: / ma tshang na sbom por bzhag go //
analyzed: / ma tshang na sbom por bzhag go //
translated: If it is incomplete, it is considered a serious violation.🔽Boats, trees, and taxes.

original: gru dang shing dang sho gam dang // zhes bya ba la dge slong gis gru rku bar bsams te chu rgyun las gyen du bzlog de gru tshugs las gru 'jug thal na pham pa /
analyzed: gru dang shing dang sho gam dang // zhes bya ba la dge slong gis gru rku bar bsams te chu rgyun las gyen du bzlog de gru tshugs las gru 'jug thal na pham pa /
translated: A monk who intends to steal a boat turns it upstream. If the boat goes beyond the boat landing, there is defeat.

original: chu rgyun thog thag khyer te sgur dang gad pa dang sne'u chod na sbom po'o //
analyzed: chu rgyun thog thag khyer te sgur dang gad pa dang sne'u chod na sbom po'o //
translated: If it is carried by the current, if it is bent, broken, or damaged, there is a serious violation.

original: de mi snang na pham pa /
analyzed: de mi snang na pham pa /
translated: If it is not visible, there is defeat.

original: thad kar rku na pha rol gyi 'gram skam sa la phyin na pham pa /
analyzed: thad kar rku na pha rol gyi 'gram skam sa la phyin na pham pa /
translated: If one steals directly, if one goes to the other side of the river, one is defeated.

original: de nyid rdzab dang sa'i 'og tu sbas na gru mi snang bar gyur tsam na pham pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdzab dang sa'i 'og tu sbas na gru mi snang bar gyur tsam na pham pa'o //
translated: If one buries the boat in the mud or in the ground, one is defeated as soon as the boat disappears.

original: shing ni bza' shing dang me tog gi shing dang grib shing lta bu ste rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
analyzed: shing ni bza' shing dang me tog gi shing dang grib shing lta bu ste rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
translated: If one steals a tree, such as a fruit tree, a flower tree, or a shade tree, one is defeated if the value is complete.

original: gseb lam dang lam gyi sho gam lta bu bka' khrims gyis mi sbyin du me rung ba las gzhan gyi dge sbyong gis bzlas sam gang gis gang zag gzhan la gsangs te sho gam ma byin te rin thang brtsis te tshang na pham pa /
analyzed: gseb lam dang lam gyi sho gam lta bu bka' khrims gyis mi sbyin du me rung ba las gzhan gyi dge sbyong gis bzlas sam gang gis gang zag gzhan la gsangs te sho gam ma byin te rin thang brtsis te tshang na pham pa /
translated: If one steals a road or a tollgate, or something else that is not to be given by the king's law, or if one steals the toll of another monk, or if one steals in secret for another person, and the value is complete, one is defeated.🔽This should also be applied to the passage:

original: de bzhin gru yi btsas rnams dang // zhes pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gru yi btsas rnams dang // zhes pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And the fees for the boat.🔽If one steals a living being without legs, with many legs, or with two legs,

original: srog chags rkang pa med pa dang // rkang mangs rkang gnyis rku ba dang // brtul zhugs can gyis mi yi nor //
analyzed: srog chags rkang pa med pa dang // rkang mangs rkang gnyis rku ba dang // brtul zhugs can gyis mi yi nor //
translated: or if one steals the wealth of humans,

original: dbyig la sogs pa gang yang rung //
analyzed: dbyig la sogs pa gang yang rung //
translated: such as gold and so forth,🔽the monk is defeated.

original: rku ba'i sems kyis gang brkus kyang //
analyzed: rku ba'i sems kyis gang brkus kyang //
translated: If one steals with the thought of stealing,

original: rin thang tshang na sdom pa zhig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rin thang tshang na sdom pa zhig / ces bya ba la /
translated: even if the value is not complete, there is a downfall.

original: mi'i longs spyod dgos par bya ba'i phyir gsos shing btsal ba srog chags rkang pa med pa sbrul dang 'bu lta bu dang / rkang pa gnyis pa mi lta bu dang / pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir rkang mngas sdig pa la sogs pa lta bu /
analyzed: mi'i longs spyod dgos par bya ba'i phyir gsos shing btsal ba srog chags rkang pa med pa sbrul dang 'bu lta bu dang / rkang pa gnyis pa mi lta bu dang / pha rol la gnod par bya ba'i phyir rkang mngas sdig pa la sogs pa lta bu /
translated: In order to use the wealth of others, one steals it by nurturing and seeking it, such as a creature without legs, like a snake or a worm; one with two legs, like a human; or one with many legs, like a centipede, in order to harm others.

original: rang nyid kyis brkus pa dang / rkur bcug pa dang / yang gzhan gyi nor gser dngul lta bu rnams rku ba'i sems kyis brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis brkus pa dang / rkur bcug pa dang / yang gzhan gyi nor gser dngul lta bu rnams rku ba'i sems kyis brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
translated: If one steals it oneself, or one induces another to steal it, and the value is complete, there is a downfall.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mi'i nor rnyi dang spre'u dang bya rgya dang bod rgya dang nya rgya la sogs pa rku ba yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mi'i nor rnyi dang spre'u dang bya rgya dang bod rgya dang nya rgya la sogs pa rku ba yang bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the stealing of human wealth, such as nets, monkeys, birds, deer, and fish.

original: 'dir dge sbyong gis bdag gi nor du rku sems kyis ming du smos pa 'di dag brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge sbyong gis bdag gi nor du rku sems kyis ming du smos pa 'di dag brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
translated: Here, if a monk steals these things, which are named, with the intention to steal, and the value is complete, there is a defeat.

original: bdag gi don du ma yin gyi pha rol la gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pas rku na pham pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don du ma yin gyi pha rol la gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pas rku na pham pa'o //
translated: If it is not for one’s own sake, but with the intention to harm another, then there is a defeat.

original: gnyis ka la phan gnod med pa'i bsam bas de dag dral zhing bsregs na yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la phan gnod med pa'i bsam bas de dag dral zhing bsregs na yang sbom po'o //
translated: If one digs them up or burns them with the intention of neither benefiting nor harming either of them, then there is a serious violation.

original: snying rje'i bsam pas dal zhing bsregs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pas dal zhing bsregs na nyes byas so //
translated: If one digs them up or burns them with a compassionate intention, then there is an offense.

original: de dag gis zin pa'i srog chags brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zin pa'i srog chags brkus te rin thang tshang na pham pa'o //
translated: If one steals a living being that is attached to them, and the value is complete, then there is a defeat.

original: gnyis ka la mi phan pa'i bsam pas btang na sbom po'o //🔽snying rje'i bsam @20a * //
analyzed: gnyis ka la mi phan pa'i bsam pas btang na sbom po'o // snying rje'i bsam @20a * //
translated: If one lets them go with the intention of neither benefiting nor harming either of them, then there is a serious violation.

original: pas btang na nyes byas so //
analyzed: pas btang na nyes byas so //
translated: If one lets them go with a compassionate intention, then there is an offense.

original: sngags kyi bdag po yod pa'i gter bdag gir bya sa pa sgrub pa las gter phas 'ong na ji tsam mig gis ma mthong gi bar du sbom po'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag po yod pa'i gter bdag gir bya sa pa sgrub pa las gter phas 'ong na ji tsam mig gis ma mthong gi bar du sbom po'o //
translated: If one steals a treasure that belongs to the owner of the treasure who has a mantra, then as long as the treasure is not out of sight of the owner, there is a serious violation.

original: mthong ste rin thang tshang na lag tu ma thob kyang pham pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ste rin thang tshang na lag tu ma thob kyang pham pa'o //
translated: If he sees it and it is of value, he is defeated even if he does not take it.

original: bdag po med pa'i gter bsgrubs pa las phas 'ong ba ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas /
analyzed: bdag po med pa'i gter bsgrubs pa las phas 'ong ba ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas /
translated: If he obtains a treasure that belongs to no one, he commits an offense of wrong conduct until he sees it.

original: mthong ste rin thang tshang na sbom po'o //
analyzed: mthong ste rin thang tshang na sbom po'o //
translated: If he sees it and it is of value, he commits a serious offense.

original: lhung bzed la sogs rkun khyer na //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs rkun khyer na //
translated: If a monk steals a begging-bowl or other monastic requisites,

original: chos bshad nas ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: chos bshad nas ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: he should confess the deed and make it right

original: yang na ri ba'i rin gyis blu //
analyzed: yang na ri ba'i rin gyis blu //
translated: by paying the market price for the item.

original: de ltar ma byas nyes byas so //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not do so, he commits an offense.

original: zhes bya bas ni ma byin par len pa'i dngos po thams cad nas thams cad du mi bya bar dgag pa ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ma byin par len pa'i dngos po thams cad nas thams cad du mi bya bar dgag pa ste ;
translated: This verse teaches that a monk should never take what is not given in any way.

original: 'di ltar bdag gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad med du mi rung ba lhung bzed dang khar gsil dang / chos gos la sogs pa rkun pos khyer zhing phrogs na rku ba'i rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa thob par 'gyur ba'i chos bshad nas slar blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad med du mi rung ba lhung bzed dang khar gsil dang / chos gos la sogs pa rkun pos khyer zhing phrogs na rku ba'i rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba la sogs pa rnam par smin pa thob par 'gyur ba'i chos bshad nas slar blang bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk’s begging-bowl, water filter, robes, and other requisites necessary for his livelihood are stolen, he should confess the deed and make it right by explaining the unpleasant ripening of the act of stealing.

original: de ltar chos bshad pa las slar ma ster na yo byad de dag dge sbyong bdag la med du mi rung bas ci ri ba'i rin gyis blus te blang par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos bshad pa las slar ma ster na yo byad de dag dge sbyong bdag la med du mi rung bas ci ri ba'i rin gyis blus te blang par bya'o //
translated: If, in spite of such an explanation, the monk is still not willing to give up the article, the monk should buy it from him for whatever price is appropriate, since the article is indispensable to the ascetic.

original: de ltar ma byas par nan gyis blangs sam phrogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas par nan gyis blangs sam phrogs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not do this, but instead takes the article by force or steals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phas pham pa gnyis pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: phas pham pa gnyis pa bshad zin to /
translated: The second defeating offense has been explained.

original: // / phas pham pa gsum pa mi tshangs par spyod pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / phas pham pa gsum pa mi tshangs par spyod pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The third defeating offense is sexual intercourse.

original: bcom ldan 'das yul ka lan da ka gnas pa'i grong na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul ka lan da ka gnas pa'i grong na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha was staying in the town of Kalanda-kagama.

original: de'i tshe khyim bdag ka lan da ka'i bu bzang byin zhes bya ba zhig rab tu byung nas gnas pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyim bdag ka lan da ka'i bu bzang byin zhes bya ba zhig rab tu byung nas gnas pa las /
translated: At that time, a householder’s son named Bhadradatta had gone forth and was staying there.

original: de'i mas bu khyod pha dang ma'i nor ni sbyin du yod pa la bdag cag bza' bran rgas te shi bar gyur na kun kyang rgyal po'i nor du gyur na khyod slar 'babs su mi rung na yang sa bon cung zad cig zhog cig ces byas nas /
analyzed: de'i mas bu khyod pha dang ma'i nor ni sbyin du yod pa la bdag cag bza' bran rgas te shi bar gyur na kun kyang rgyal po'i nor du gyur na khyod slar 'babs su mi rung na yang sa bon cung zad cig zhog cig ces byas nas /
translated: His mother said to him, “Son, you can give away the wealth of your father and mother, but we are old and will die. If that happens, everything will become the king’s property. It is not right for you to leave without a trace. Plant some seeds.”

original: bzang byin gyi chung ma zla mtshan dang ldan zhing dus la bab pa rgyan gyis klubs te khrid de 'ongs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin yang 'dod chags bdo ba dang nyes dmigs ma mthong bas mi tshangs par spyod do //🔽de nas dus mi ring ba bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyes pa las dpral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzang byin gyi chung ma zla mtshan dang ldan zhing dus la bab pa rgyan gyis klubs te khrid de 'ongs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin yang 'dod chags bdo ba dang nyes dmigs ma mthong bas mi tshangs par spyod do // de nas dus mi ring ba bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyes pa las dpral ba'i phyir /
translated: Bhadra was overcome with desire and did not see the danger.🔽Soon after, the Blessed One explained to the monks the Dharma that frees the mind and frees wisdom from the faults of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i chos bshad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin nyes pa dran nas shin tu 'gyod cing mi @20b dga' nas /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang shes rab rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i chos bshad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin nyes pa dran nas shin tu 'gyod cing mi @20b dga' nas /
translated: The venerable Bhadra remembered the fault and was very remorseful and unhappy.

original: de dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas ci nyes smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin gyis drang por smras so //
analyzed: de dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas ci nyes smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa bzang byin gyis drang por smras so //
translated: The monks saw him and asked what was wrong. The venerable Bhadra told them truthfully.

original: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bzang byin la rnam pa du mas smad nas legs pa bcu gzigs te 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das la gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bzang byin la rnam pa du mas smad nas legs pa bcu gzigs te 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Having made such a request to the Bhagavān, the Bhagavān, having reproached Bhadrasena in many ways, saw ten good qualities and established the basis of training in the Vinaya.

original: sdom can nyams pa med sems kyis //
analyzed: sdom can nyams pa med sems kyis //
translated: One with vows, with an undiminished mind,

original: nyams pa med pa'i sgo gsum du //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i sgo gsum du //
translated: with an undiminished body, speech, and mind,

original: chags pas nang du nor bu 'das //
analyzed: chags pas nang du nor bu 'das //
translated: through attachment, inserts the jewel inside,

original: dga' ba tshor na brtul zhugs nyams //
analyzed: dga' ba tshor na brtul zhugs nyams //
translated: if pleasure is felt, the discipline is diminished.

original: zhes bya bas mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: This explains the nature of sexual misconduct.

original: sdom pa can dge sbyong bslab pa ma phul zhing nyams pa med pa'i sems rang bzhin du gnas pas kha dang / rkub dang / mo mtshan te sgo gsum po 'di dag ma rul ba dang / rma ma byung ba dang / 'bu zhugs pa lta bu nyams pa med pa spyad du bzod par bdag nyid chags pa'i sems kyis nang du bcug ste mtshams 'das la /
analyzed: sdom pa can dge sbyong bslab pa ma phul zhing nyams pa med pa'i sems rang bzhin du gnas pas kha dang / rkub dang / mo mtshan te sgo gsum po 'di dag ma rul ba dang / rma ma byung ba dang / 'bu zhugs pa lta bu nyams pa med pa spyad du bzod par bdag nyid chags pa'i sems kyis nang du bcug ste mtshams 'das la /
translated: One with vows, a renunciate who has not offered back the training and whose mind remains undiminished, with an undiminished body, speech, and mind, using these three doors that are not rotten, not wounded, and not diminished like an infested wound, with a mind of attachment, inserts inside, and if pleasure is felt, the discipline is diminished.

original: dga' ba tshong na brtul zhugs nyams te pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba tshong na brtul zhugs nyams te pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one sells one's joy, one's discipline is impaired and one is defeated.

original: de la yan lag ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The branches are fivefold:

original: sems ma nyams /
analyzed: sems ma nyams /
translated: one's mind is impaired;

original: sgo gsum spyad bzod /
analyzed: sgo gsum spyad bzod /
translated: one is not patient with the three doors;

original: chags sems yod /
analyzed: chags sems yod /
translated: one has attachment;

original: mtshams las 'das /
analyzed: mtshams las 'das /
translated: one transgresses the limits;

original: dga' ba tshor /
analyzed: dga' ba tshor /
translated: one experiences the taste of joy.

original: de rnams gcig dang mi ldan na sbom por gzhag go //🔽skyes pa bud med ma ning gis //
analyzed: de rnams gcig dang mi ldan na sbom por gzhag go // skyes pa bud med ma ning gis //
translated: If one does not possess any of these, one is said to have a gross transgression.🔽Whether male, female, or neuter,

original: tshan kar bor te mnan pa las //
analyzed: tshan kar bor te mnan pa las //
translated: if one is pressed by three people

original: gang gis bde ba'i ro myong ba //
analyzed: gang gis bde ba'i ro myong ba //
translated: and experiences the taste of bliss,

original: de yang sdom pa zhig par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang sdom pa zhig par 'gyur //
translated: one's vows are destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag dge sbyong mthu chung zhing zhan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag dge sbyong mthu chung zhing zhan pa la /
translated: This is said of a weak and feeble spiritual practitioner.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning ste /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning ste /
translated: Whether male, female, or neuter,🔽if one is pressed by three people,

original: mi rnam pa gsum gyis tshan kar bor te mnan nas bdag dang de dag gi sgo gsum gang yang rung bar bcug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mi rnam pa gsum gyis tshan kar bor te mnan nas bdag dang de dag gi sgo gsum gang yang rung bar bcug pa'i tshe /
translated: and at that time one inserts anything into one's three doors,

original: bdag nyid kyis nyams su blangs te dga' ba tshor na de yang sdom pa zhig ste phas pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis nyams su blangs te dga' ba tshor na de yang sdom pa zhig ste phas pham par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one experiences pleasure by practicing it oneself, that vow is also broken, and one incurs a defeating offense.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar gyur yang nyams su mi blang ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar gyur yang nyams su mi blang ba ston to //
translated: This shows that one should not practice it under any circumstances.

original: yan lag skyes nas bde 'dod pas //
analyzed: yan lag skyes nas bde 'dod pas //
translated: Better to put one’s limb

original: gdug pa sbrul gyi khar bcug bla //
analyzed: gdug pa sbrul gyi khar bcug bla //
translated: into the mouth of a poisonous snake

original: lus la dka' thub mi gzhig ces ;🔽/ rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lus la dka' thub mi gzhig ces ; / rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: than to destroy the body,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the Buddha has said, through ascetic practices.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi dbang gis bdag gi yan lag skyes bsgrengs te shin tu bdo bar gyur pa 'dod chags de dang bral zhing bde bar 'dod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi dbang gis bdag gi yan lag skyes bsgrengs te shin tu bdo bar gyur pa 'dod chags de dang bral zhing bde bar 'dod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If, out of desire, one were to put one’s limb, which has arisen from oneself, into the mouth of a poisonous snake, in order to be free from that desire and to be happy,

original: sbrul gdug pa'i khar bcug ste /🔽'dod chags dang bral @21a * //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa'i khar bcug ste / 'dod chags dang bral @21a * //
translated: that would be all right.🔽But it would be better to be free from desire

original: bar gyur pa ni bdag la phan pa yin pas bla'i /
analyzed: bar gyur pa ni bdag la phan pa yin pas bla'i /
translated: and to be happy by not destroying the body,🔽which is the basis for achieving all one’s goals.

original: lus la bdag gi sdom pa ni mi gzhig par bya'o zhes rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lus la bdag gi sdom pa ni mi gzhig par bya'o zhes rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: The perfect Buddha, the Blessed One, has declared that one should not destroy the vow of morality in the body.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te sbrul gyis gsad gyur kyang //🔽tshul khrims gnas la de phan te //
analyzed: gal te sbrul gyis gsad gyur kyang // tshul khrims gnas la de phan te //
translated: Even if one is killed by a snake,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is beneficial for one who abides in morality.

original: gal te chags pa'i dbang gis yan lag skyes bsgrengs nas sbrul gdug pa'i khar bcug ste shi bar gyur pa ni sgo gsum snang ba'i gnas su ma bcug ba tshul khrims can de la phan te mtho ris su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te chags pa'i dbang gis yan lag skyes bsgrengs nas sbrul gdug pa'i khar bcug ste shi bar gyur pa ni sgo gsum snang ba'i gnas su ma bcug ba tshul khrims can de la phan te mtho ris su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If, out of attachment, one extends a limb into the mouth of a poisonous snake and dies, that is beneficial for the one with morality, because they are reborn in the higher realms.

original: tshul khrims de zhig par gyur pas sdug bsngal yin te ngan song gsum du skye'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims de zhig par gyur pas sdug bsngal yin te ngan song gsum du skye'o ;
translated: But if that morality is destroyed, it is suffering, because one is reborn in the three lower realms.

original: / der yang ma zad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang sgrib par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / der yang ma zad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la'ang sgrib par 'gyur te /
translated: Not only that, it becomes an obstruction to nirvana.

original: tshul khrims nyams na thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i skal ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams na thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i skal ba yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If morality is impaired, one loses the fortune of liberation, nirvana.

original: phas pham pa gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: phas pham pa gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: The third defeating offense has been explained.

original: // / phas pham pa bzhi pa brdzun gyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / phas pham pa bzhi pa brdzun gyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The fourth defeating offense is lying.

original: bcom ldan 'das yul yangs pa can gyi spre'u rdzing gi 'gram na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul yangs pa can gyi spre'u rdzing gi 'gram na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha was staying in the region of Vaisali, on the bank of the Monkey Pond.

original: de'i tshe mu ge chen po byung nas kha zas kyis shin tu brel te pha ma yang bu la kha zas mi ster ba tsam du dkon pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe mu ge chen po byung nas kha zas kyis shin tu brel te pha ma yang bu la kha zas mi ster ba tsam du dkon pa'i tshe /
translated: At that time, a great famine occurred, and food was so scarce that parents could not give food to their children.

original: dge slong rdzu 'phrul can dang gnas brtan rnams ni byang gi sgra mi snyan la sogs pa yul gzhan 'byor cing rgyas pa dag tu dong zhing bdag nyid kyang za /🔽gang zag gzhan la yang stobs so //
analyzed: dge slong rdzu 'phrul can dang gnas brtan rnams ni byang gi sgra mi snyan la sogs pa yul gzhan 'byor cing rgyas pa dag tu dong zhing bdag nyid kyang za / gang zag gzhan la yang stobs so //
translated: The monks who had miraculous powers and the elders went to other prosperous and flourishing regions such as Uttarakuru, and they ate themselves and gave to others.

original: de la nya pa las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong lnga brgya la sogs pa dag gis kyang dge slong de dag ltar bya zhing dbyar tshul du 'jug tu ni rdzu 'phrul yang ma thob cing thos pa dag kyang nyung zhing de ltar mi nus kyis bdag cag
analyzed: de la nya pa las rab tu byung ba'i dge slong lnga brgya la sogs pa dag gis kyang dge slong de dag ltar bya zhing dbyar tshul du 'jug tu ni rdzu 'phrul yang ma thob cing thos pa dag kyang nyung zhing de ltar mi nus kyis bdag cag
translated: Five hundred monks who had been fishermen and others said, “We will do as those monks did. We will enter the rainy season retreat, but we have not attained miraculous powers, we have little learning, and we are not able to do that.

original: gis yul nyid du dbyar tshul du zhugs la bdag cag so so'i yon tan bsgrags te rnyed pa bsgrub po snyam nas tshul du zhugs so //
analyzed: gis yul nyid du dbyar tshul du zhugs la bdag cag so so'i yon tan bsgrags te rnyed pa bsgrub po snyam nas tshul du zhugs so //
translated: We will enter the rainy season retreat in the same place, and we will proclaim our own good qualities and acquire gain. And so they entered the rainy season retreat.

original: de nas lnga brgya po de dag gis gcig gis gcig gi yon tan brjod pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas lnga brgya po de dag gis gcig gis gcig gi yon tan brjod pa la zhugs so //
translated: Then those five hundred monks began to proclaim each other's good qualities.

original: 'dis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: 'dis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: This one has attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'dis lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //🔽'dis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: 'dis lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo // 'dis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: This one has attained the fruit of once-returning.🔽This one has attained the fruit of non-returning.

original: 'dis ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob bo /
analyzed: 'dis ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob bo /
translated: This one has attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis grub bo //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis grub bo //
translated: This one has accomplished it through the worldly path.

original: 'di ni sde snod gsum smra ba'o zhes so so'i yon tan brjod pas kha zas la sogs pa mang po du ma rnyed de sha khrag gi lus shin tu rtas pas gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ni sde snod gsum smra ba'o zhes so so'i yon tan brjod pas kha zas la sogs pa mang po du ma rnyed de sha khrag gi lus shin tu rtas pas gnas so //
translated: This one is a proponent of the three baskets. By proclaiming each other's good qualities, they acquired much food and other things, and their flesh and blood bodies became very plump.

original: de nas dbyar @21b 'das nas tshul nas byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dbyar @21b 'das nas tshul nas byung ste /
translated: Then, after the rainy season retreat, they emerged from seclusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du phyin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du phyin to //
translated: They went to pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: dang por kun dga' bo dang phrad pa dang smras pa /
analyzed: dang por kun dga' bo dang phrad pa dang smras pa /
translated: At first they met with Ananda and said:

original: mu ge chen po byung ba'i dus na dge slong gzhan rnams ni rmya ste lhags na /
analyzed: mu ge chen po byung ba'i dus na dge slong gzhan rnams ni rmya ste lhags na /
translated: “When a great famine occurred, other monks became emaciated and haggard.🔽But you are very healthy. What is the cause of that?”

original: khyod ni shin tu tsho ste byung na de ci'i rgyu zhes smras pa dang / bdag cag so so'i yon tan brjod pas rnyed pa mang po byung ste lus rtas so zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu tsho ste byung na de ci'i rgyu zhes smras pa dang / bdag cag so so'i yon tan brjod pas rnyed pa mang po byung ste lus rtas so zhes smras so //
translated: They replied, “We obtained much wealth by praising our own good qualities and our bodies became plump.”

original: khyed la yon tan yod de brjod dam med de brjod /
analyzed: khyed la yon tan yod de brjod dam med de brjod /
translated: “Do you have good qualities or not?🔽“We have no good qualities.”🔽“It is not at all right for you to say that you have good qualities when you do not have them, and to say that you have nothing when you have something.

original: bdag cag la yon tan med par brjod do zhes smras pa dang / zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa med pa la yod pa gzhan bzhin du sma ba shin tu mi rigs so zhes kun dga' bo la sogs pa rnams kyis smras so //
analyzed: bdag cag la yon tan med par brjod do zhes smras pa dang / zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa med pa la yod pa gzhan bzhin du sma ba shin tu mi rigs so zhes kun dga' bo la sogs pa rnams kyis smras so //
translated: ” Ananda and the others said this.

original: de ltar gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan to //
translated: The Bhagavan heard about this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gyis rnam pa du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gyis rnam pa du mas smad nas 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Then the Bhagavan criticized them in many ways and established a rule of training in the vinaya.

original: lha dag mthong zhes de yi sgra //
analyzed: lha dag mthong zhes de yi sgra //
translated: The words seeing gods and so on

original: thos par gyur dang kun smra dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thos par gyur dang kun smra dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are to be understood as hearing and speaking.

original: dge sbyong gis bdag gis lha mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bdag gis lha mthong ngo //
translated: If a monk says, I see gods,

original: lha'i sgra thos so //
analyzed: lha'i sgra thos so //
translated: I hear the voices of gods,🔽I speak and converse with gods, he commits three downfalls.

original: lha rnams dang bdag tu smra zhing kun du smra bar byed do zhes zer na gsum char la yang pham pa re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rnams dang bdag tu smra zhing kun du smra bar byed do zhes zer na gsum char la yang pham pa re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If he says, The gods come to where I am,

original: gang na bdag 'dug lha 'ong zhing //🔽bdag kyang de yi gnas 'gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang na bdag 'dug lha 'ong zhing // bdag kyang de yi gnas 'gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and I go to where the gods are,

original: dge sbyong gis bdag gang na 'dug pa'i gnas su lha dag 'ong ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bdag gang na 'dug pa'i gnas su lha dag 'ong ngo //
translated: if a monk says, The gods come to where I am,

original: bdag lha gang na gnas pa'i gnas de dag tu 'gro'o zhe na yang pham pa /
analyzed: bdag lha gang na gnas pa'i gnas de dag tu 'gro'o zhe na yang pham pa /
translated: and I go to where the gods are, he commits a root downfall.

original: ji ltar lha mthong zhing sgra thos zer ba dang / lha dang smra zhing kun du smra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lha mthong zhing sgra thos zer ba dang / lha dang smra zhing kun du smra'o //
translated: Just as with the words I see gods and so on, he says,🔽The gods come to where I am,

original: bdag 'dug pa'i gnas su 'ong ngo zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dug pa'i gnas su 'ong ngo zhes smra'o //
translated: and I go to where the gods are.

original: de bzhin dri za grul bum klu //
analyzed: de bzhin dri za grul bum klu //
translated: Gandharvas, kumbhandas, and nagas

original: gnod sbyin lto 'phye chen po dang // sha za yi dags mi'am ci //
analyzed: gnod sbyin lto 'phye chen po dang // sha za yi dags mi'am ci //
translated: Yakshas, mahoragas, flesh-eaters, pretas, kinnaras,🔽and so on.

original: mthong ngo zhes la sogs smra'am //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes la sogs smra'am //
translated: If one says, I saw, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽bsam gtan mngon shes tshad med dang // rgyun zhugs la sogs 'bras bu dang // lam la rab tu zhugs pa 'ang rung //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o // bsam gtan mngon shes tshad med dang // rgyun zhugs la sogs 'bras bu dang // lam la rab tu zhugs pa 'ang rung //
translated: it is also to be applied to those.🔽 If one says, I attained the dhyanas, superknowledges, immeasurables,🔽the fruits of stream-entry and so on,

original: bdag gis thob ces smras na ni //
analyzed: bdag gis thob ces smras na ni //
translated: and entered the path,

original: don rig pa las brdzun pa'i tshig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: don rig pa las brdzun pa'i tshig / ces bya ba la /
translated: then it is a lie from one who knows the meaning.

original: dge sbyong gi 'du shes sbas nas /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'du shes sbas nas /
translated: Concealing the perception of a monk,

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po thob bo zhe'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po thob bo zhe'am /
translated: if one says, I attained the first dhyana of the form realm,

original: gnyis pa thob po zhe'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa thob po zhe'am /
translated: I attained the second,

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa thob bo zhes smra na yang pham pa /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa thob bo zhes smra na yang pham pa /
translated: I attained the third and fourth, it is a defeat.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga las gang yang rung ba zhig thob po zhes smra na yang pham pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga las gang yang rung ba zhig thob po zhes smra na yang pham pa'o //
translated: Similarly, if one says, I attained any of the five superknowledges, it is a defeat.

original: yang 'du shes sbas nas @22a * //
analyzed: yang 'du shes sbas nas @22a * //
translated: Again, concealing the perception,

original: tshad med pa bzhi gang yang rung ba zhig grub po zhes zer ba dang / dge sbyong gi 'du shes sbas nas 'bras bu bzhi las bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo zhe'am /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi gang yang rung ba zhig grub po zhes zer ba dang / dge sbyong gi 'du shes sbas nas 'bras bu bzhi las bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo zhe'am /
translated: One has attained any of the four immeasurables.🔽Or, having concealed the perception of a spiritual practitioner, one says, “I have attained the fruit of stream entry,” or

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob po zhes smras te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob po zhes smras te /
translated: “I have attained the fruit of once-returner, nonreturner, or arhat.”

original: gzhan gyis don go bas don rig ste go na brdzun gyi tshig ste pham par 'gyur ro //
