analyzed: gzhan gyis don go bas don rig ste go na brdzun gyi tshig ste pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the other person understands the meaning, then, having spoken a lie, one commits a downfall that is a defeating offense.

original: lam la rab tu zhugs pa ni dge sbyong gis 'du shes sbas te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bdag gis thob po zhes smras na pham pa'o //
analyzed: lam la rab tu zhugs pa ni dge sbyong gis 'du shes sbas te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bdag gis thob po zhes smras na pham pa'o //
translated: If one says, “I have attained the supramundane path,” then, having concealed the perception of a spiritual practitioner, one commits a defeating offense.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma 'ga' zhig la brten te 'dod chags dang gnod sems la mi spyod do zhes zer na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma 'ga' zhig la brten te 'dod chags dang gnod sems la mi spyod do zhes zer na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says, “I do not engage in attachment and malice, because I rely on some sign of mundane meditative serenity,” then one commits a serious violation.

original: khyad par thob pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: khyad par thob pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the attainment of distinction

original: ma nyams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma nyams zhes bya ba la /
translated: is not impaired.

original: dge sbyong bdag gis sems ma smyos pa nad kyis gzir bar ma gyur te rang bzhin du gnas /
analyzed: dge sbyong bdag gis sems ma smyos pa nad kyis gzir bar ma gyur te rang bzhin du gnas /
translated: If a monk says, “I have not lost my mind, I have not been stricken by illness, I am in my right mind,

original: gong du bstan pa'i yon tan khyad par can thob cing mthong zhes smras na phas pham par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i yon tan khyad par can thob cing mthong zhes smras na phas pham par 'gyur gyi /
translated: I have attained the special qualities taught above, and I have seen them,” he incurs a defeating offense.

original: sems smyos pa dang nad kyis gzir ba rnams ni pham par mi 'gyur gyi sbom por gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems smyos pa dang nad kyis gzir ba rnams ni pham par mi 'gyur gyi sbom por gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, if he is insane or stricken by illness, he does not incur a defeating offense, but a serious transgression.

original: nga rgyal med bzhin du /
analyzed: nga rgyal med bzhin du /
translated: Even if you are not proud,

original: smras na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras na brtul zhugs nyams par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: you will lose your discipline if you boast.

original: sngon dge sbyong zhig dgon pa na gnas pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcom ste /
analyzed: sngon dge sbyong zhig dgon pa na gnas pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bcom ste /
translated: In the past, a monk who lived in the forest destroyed the afflictions by means of the mundane path.

original: mi 'byung bar byas nas yun ring mo zhig lon pa na /
analyzed: mi 'byung bar byas nas yun ring mo zhig lon pa na /
translated: After a long time, he thought, “I have destroyed the afflictions and will not be reborn again.”

original: nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i gnas rnams la brtags na nyon mongs pa mi skye bas bdag cag gis nyon mongs pa spangs so zhes bsams shing brjod nas slar grong du lhags pa las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rtsad nas ma phyin pa'i phyir nyon
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i gnas rnams la brtags na nyon mongs pa mi skye bas bdag cag gis nyon mongs pa spangs so zhes bsams shing brjod nas slar grong du lhags pa las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rtsad nas ma phyin pa'i phyir nyon
translated: When they examined the places where afflictions do not arise, they thought, We have abandoned afflictions, and said so. Then they returned to the village.🔽 Because they had not completely eliminated afflictions by the mundane path, when they saw women, enemies, and so on, objects that give rise to afflictions, their afflictions arose again.

original: mongs pa skye ba'i yul bud med dang dgra la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa dang nyon mongs pa slar skyes nas dge slong de dag bdag cag gis nyon mongs pa ma spangs par spangs so zhes spras te mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i pham par ma
analyzed: mongs pa skye ba'i yul bud med dang dgra la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa dang nyon mongs pa slar skyes nas dge slong de dag bdag cag gis nyon mongs pa ma spangs par spangs so zhes spras te mi'i chos las bla mar gyur pa'i pham par ma
translated: Those monks boasted, We have abandoned afflictions that have not been abandoned. They asked the Bhagavan, Have we not committed a defeating offense that is a transgression of a fundamental training?

original: gyur grang zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de lta bu ma gtogs te slan chad de lta bu'i khyad par zhig thob na yang smra bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gyur grang zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de lta bu ma gtogs te slan chad de lta bu'i khyad par zhig thob na yang smra bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Bhagavan said, Except for those who are arrogant, if you obtain such a distinction in the future, you should not speak of it.

original: de lta bu ni pham par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bu ni pham par mi gzhag go //
translated: Such a person is not to be considered defeated.

original: dge sbyong gis 'du shes sbas ta /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis 'du shes sbas ta /
translated: A monk who conceals his perception

original: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin mthong ba dag yod @22b do zhes ni smra la /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin mthong ba dag yod @22b do zhes ni smra la /
translated: and says, “I have seen gods, nāgas, and yakṣas,”

original: bdag nyid yin no zhes ni mi smra na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin no zhes ni mi smra na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: but does not say, “I myself have seen them,” commits a serious offense.

original: sha za rnams mthong ba yod do zhes smra la /
analyzed: sha za rnams mthong ba yod do zhes smra la /
translated: If he says, “I have seen piśācas,”

original: bdag nyid yin par mi smra na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin par mi smra na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: but does not say, “I myself have seen them,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dgon pa na dge slong du gnas pa de la mi ma yin pa rnams kyis gtses pa las 'phags pa rnams la mi gtse ste bdag la yang mi gtse zer na pham pa /
analyzed: dgon pa na dge slong du gnas pa de la mi ma yin pa rnams kyis gtses pa las 'phags pa rnams la mi gtse ste bdag la yang mi gtse zer na pham pa /
translated: If a monk who is staying in the wilderness is bothered by non-human spirits and says, “Noble ones, do not bother them. Do not bother me either,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi phyir khyim bdag rnams stan khra bo 'dings te bdag gi phyir yang khyim bdag stan khra bo 'dings so zhes zer ba yang don rig na pham pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi phyir khyim bdag rnams stan khra bo 'dings te bdag gi phyir yang khyim bdag stan khra bo 'dings so zhes zer ba yang don rig na pham pa'o //
translated: If he says, “For the sake of the noble ones, the householders have spread out a variegated seat. For my sake, the householders have spread out a variegated seat,” and the meaning is understood, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.🔽The following verse was taught to show that he commits an offense of wrong conduct:

original: khyad par thob pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par thob pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes byas su 'gyur ba bstan to //
translated: “Except for the attainment of distinction.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i brdzun tshig rnams //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i brdzun tshig rnams //
translated: All other false speech

original: de dag thams cad sdig mang 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni gong du yon tan khyad par can thob bo zhes bya ba las ma gtogs par ku re dang kyal ka la sogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad sdig mang 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni gong du yon tan khyad par can thob bo zhes bya ba las ma gtogs par ku re dang kyal ka la sogs pa'i phyir /
translated: All of these are great sins.🔽This verse teaches that lying is a great sin, except for the previously mentioned special virtues, such as for the sake of jest or to save a person from death.

original: brdzun pa'i tshig smras na sdig pa mang du 'gyur te nyes byas lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i tshig smras na sdig pa mang du 'gyur te nyes byas lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The second fault of speech is indicated by the verse:🔽Do not speak divisive words

original: ji ltar mdza' bo 'byed 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji ltar mdza' bo 'byed 'gyur ba //
translated: that create disunity among friends.🔽Do not speak divisive words that create disunity among friends who are harmonious and united.🔽The third fault of speech is indicated by the verse:

original: phra ma'i tshig rnams smra mi bya //🔽zhes bya bas ni ngag gi nyes pa gnyis pa bstan te 'dum zhing mdza' bar 'gyur bas 'thab cing dbye bar 'gyur ba'i phra ma'i tshig gis dbye ba rnams slar mi sdum zhing dbyes su 'gyur ba phra ma'i tshig rnams mi bya'o //🔽ngan du zer la ngan mi smra //
analyzed: phra ma'i tshig rnams smra mi bya // zhes bya bas ni ngag gi nyes pa gnyis pa bstan te 'dum zhing mdza' bar 'gyur bas 'thab cing dbye bar 'gyur ba'i phra ma'i tshig gis dbye ba rnams slar mi sdum zhing dbyes su 'gyur ba phra ma'i tshig rnams mi bya'o // ngan du zer la ngan mi smra //
translated: Do not speak harsh words🔽even to enemies.🔽Do not speak words that are

original: gshe ba la yang slar mi gshe //
analyzed: gshe ba la yang slar mi gshe //
translated: unpleasant to hear.🔽The fourth fault of speech is indicated by the verse:🔽Do not speak idle words

original: mtshang 'bru ba la slar mi 'bru //
analyzed: mtshang 'bru ba la slar mi 'bru //
translated: that are meaningless.

original: rdeg pa la yang slar mi rdeg / ces bya bas ni ngag gi nyes pa spong ba dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdeg pa la yang slar mi rdeg / ces bya bas ni ngag gi nyes pa spong ba dge sbyong gi tshul bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth rule of the spiritual practitioner is to avoid verbal faults, as stated in the line “And do not strike back when struck.”

original: bdag nyid la nyes pa rnams la'ang mi rigs par mi bya na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la nyes pa rnams la'ang mi rigs par mi bya na /
translated: If you should not commit any faults yourself,

original: sems can nyes pa med pa rnams la bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par bya ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: sems can nyes pa med pa rnams la bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par bya ba lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention that you should not commit any faults toward other sentient beings who are without fault?

original: gzhan gyis ngan du smra bal sogs pa byas pa slar lan mi glan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ngan du smra bal sogs pa byas pa slar lan mi glan no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the line “Do not respond to others’ verbal abuse and so on” is that you should not respond in kind.

original: blo ldan bslab pa 'dod ba yin //
analyzed: blo ldan bslab pa 'dod ba yin //
translated: The wise one is desirous of training.

original: bsgrims te ngag gi skyon rnams spang //
analyzed: bsgrims te ngag gi skyon rnams spang //
translated: With effort, he abandons the faults of speech.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi nyes pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi nyes pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: This is the fourth verbal fault.

original: rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom po'i gtam dang / tshong pa'i gtam la sogs pa ni tshig kyal pa ste ngag gi skyon rnams te gang bslab par 'dod pa'i dge slong blo dang ldan pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom po'i gtam dang / tshong pa'i gtam la sogs pa ni tshig kyal pa ste ngag gi skyon rnams te gang bslab par 'dod pa'i dge slong blo dang ldan pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: The faults of speech are idle talk such as stories about kings, stories about thieves, stories about trade, and so on. The wise one who is desirous of training should abandon them.

original: de ltar 'gyur bar rig nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bar rig nas ni //
translated: Knowing that this is so,

original: ngag rnams shin tu bsdam par bya //
analyzed: ngag rnams shin tu bsdam par bya //
translated: you should restrain your speech.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ngag gis nyes pa bzhi spyad na brdzun dang sbom po dang nyes byas su rig @23a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ngag gis nyes pa bzhi spyad na brdzun dang sbom po dang nyes byas su rig @23a * //
translated: As explained above, if one commits the four verbal faults, one should know that they are lies, serious mistakes, and faults.

original: nas de dag bsdam zhing spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nas de dag bsdam zhing spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should restrain and abandon them.🔽The explanation of the fourth defeat is complete.

original: pham pa bzhi pa bshad pa ste phas pham pa bzhi'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pham pa bzhi pa bshad pa ste phas pham pa bzhi'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the four defeats is complete.

original: // / de ltar phas pham pa'i gnas bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar phas pham pa'i gnas bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the grounds for defeat,

original: da ni bslab pa phra mo'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
analyzed: da ni bslab pa phra mo'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir / 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
translated: now, in order to explain the grounds for subtle training,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says fermented grain mixed with yeast, and so on.

original: de yang rnam pa drug ste /🔽'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug ste / 'bru btags phabs dang sbyar ba yi //
translated: Moreover, there are six types:🔽Fermented grain mixed with yeast

original: btung ba'i bye brag 'bru yi chang //🔽zhes bya ba ni nas 'bras btags te chang du bya ba'am /
analyzed: btung ba'i bye brag 'bru yi chang // zhes bya ba ni nas 'bras btags te chang du bya ba'am /
translated: is a type of drink, a grain beer.🔽This means that barley and rice are fermented to make beer,

original: ma btags pa chang du byas pa rnams te /
analyzed: ma btags pa chang du byas pa rnams te /
translated: or that unfermented [grains] are made into beer.

original: de ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
analyzed: de ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
translated: Knowing that it causes intoxication,

original: rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo //🔽zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo //🔽zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one should not drink even with kuśa grass.

original: sdong bu me tog 'bras bu las //
analyzed: sdong bu me tog 'bras bu las //
translated: The juice prepared from the stem, flower, and fruit

original: sbyar ba'i khu ba bcos pa'i chang //
analyzed: sbyar ba'i khu ba bcos pa'i chang //
translated: is an intoxicating beverage.

original: de ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
analyzed: de ni myos par 'gyur rig nas //
translated: Knowing that it intoxicates,

original: zhes bya ba dang / rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo // zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: one should not drink even the juice of sugarcane.🔽The juice prepared from the stem, flower, and fruit is an intoxicating beverage.

original: 'di ltar sdong bu ste bur ma shing bcir ba las byas pa dang / me tog 'bras bu ste rgun 'brum la sogs pa sbyar ba'i khu bas myos shing dran pa nyams par 'gyur bar rig nas bdag nyid kyang rtsva mchog gis mi btung la gzhan la yang sbyin par mi bya zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdong bu ste bur ma shing bcir ba las byas pa dang / me tog 'bras bu ste rgun 'brum la sogs pa sbyar ba'i khu bas myos shing dran pa nyams par 'gyur bar rig nas bdag nyid kyang rtsva mchog gis mi btung la gzhan la yang sbyin par mi bya zhes ston to //
translated: Knowing that it intoxicates and impairs memory, one should not drink it oneself or give it to others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sdom can phan 'dod mi btung ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sdom can phan 'dod mi btung ngo //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One who is restrained and seeks benefit should not drink it.🔽One who is restrained and seeks benefit should not drink it.

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong sdom pa can bslab pa la gnas pas bdag la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong sdom pa can bslab pa la gnas pas bdag la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one who is restrained as a śramaṇa and abides in the training should not drink it for the sake of benefiting and comforting oneself.

original: 'thungs na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'thungs na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault of drinking it?

original: de 'thungs na ni dran nyams shing //
analyzed: de 'thungs na ni dran nyams shing //
translated: If one drinks it, memory is impaired.

original: brtul zhugs ldan pa bag med 'gyur //🔽bag med pa las brtul zhugs nyams //
analyzed: brtul zhugs ldan pa bag med 'gyur // bag med pa las brtul zhugs nyams //
translated: The one who is disciplined becomes heedless.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From heedlessness, the discipline is destroyed.

original: gong du smos pa'i chang gi rnam pa de dag 'thungs shing gzhan la blud na bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rang bzhin du gnas shing gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i dran pa nyams pas lus kyis rjes su rdeg btsog dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshig ngan pa la sogs pa bag med pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i chang gi rnam pa de dag 'thungs shing gzhan la blud na bdag dang gzhan gyi sems rang bzhin du gnas shing gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i dran pa nyams pas lus kyis rjes su rdeg btsog dang / ngag gi sgo nas tshig ngan pa la sogs pa bag med pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If one drinks those kinds of alcohol mentioned above and gives it to others, one’s own and others’ minds lose the experience of clarity and stability, and memory is impaired. As a result, one becomes heedless and one’s body becomes rough and one’s speech becomes coarse and so forth.

original: de ltar bag med pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa brtul zhugs te tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bag med pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa brtul zhugs te tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, through heedlessness, one’s discipline, that is, one’s morality, is destroyed, and one kills, steals, and so forth.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bas ston pa'i bka' dran bya //
analyzed: de bas ston pa'i bka' dran bya //
translated: One should remember the Teacher’s words:

original: myos 'gyur nyes pa 'phel 'gyur ba //🔽rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo //
analyzed: myos 'gyur nyes pa 'phel 'gyur ba // rtsva mchog gis kyang mi btung ngo //
translated: “The faults of intoxication increase.

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: One should not drink even the amount in a blade of grass.”

original: de bas na ston pa @23b sangs rgyas kyi bka' tshad ma dran par byas la dran pa nyams shing myos par 'gyur ba'i gnas nyes pa rnam pa du ma 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu rtsva mchog gis kyang reg par mi bya na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos
analyzed: de bas na ston pa @23b sangs rgyas kyi bka' tshad ma dran par byas la dran pa nyams shing myos par 'gyur ba'i gnas nyes pa rnam pa du ma 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu rtsva mchog gis kyang reg par mi bya na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos
translated: Therefore, one should remember the authoritative statements of the Teacher, the Buddha, and not touch even the grass of the cause that increases the many faults that are the basis for the loss of mindfulness and intoxication, much less other things.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar chang 'thungs na nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du glum dang sbang ma zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar chang 'thungs na nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du glum dang sbang ma zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as drinking alcohol is a fault, so eating fermented rice and barley is a fault.

original: 'di ltar chang la chang gi kha dog dang dri dang ro dang myos par 'gyur ba'i mthu dang bzhi char ldan pa 'thungs na nyes par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar chang la chang gi kha dog dang dri dang ro dang myos par 'gyur ba'i mthu dang bzhi char ldan pa 'thungs na nyes par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, drinking alcohol is established as a fault when it has the four qualities of the color, smell, taste, and intoxicating power of alcohol.

original: sbrang rtsi dang bro ba la sogs pa myos pa'i mthu yod du zin kyang kha dog dang dri dang ro la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten la sogs pa smad pa ma yin pas de dag gis myos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang bro ba la sogs pa myos pa'i mthu yod du zin kyang kha dog dang dri dang ro la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten la sogs pa smad pa ma yin pas de dag gis myos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if honey and other substances have the intoxicating power, they are not intoxicating if they do not have the color, smell, taste, and so on of alcohol and are not condemned by the world and so on.

original: gal te dge sbyong nad kyis thebs te chang gi cho ga bya dgos na chang gis lus la bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge sbyong nad kyis thebs te chang gi cho ga bya dgos na chang gis lus la bsku bar bya'o //
translated: If a sick ascetic needs to perform a rite with alcohol, he should anoint his body with it.

original: yi ga 'chus pa phan par bya na yang khar blugs pa las btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yi ga 'chus pa phan par bya na yang khar blugs pa las btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: If he needs to drink it to cure an illness, he should pour it into his mouth but not swallow it.

original: chang ma 'thungs na yang mi 'tsho ba tsam du thug na bskol ba chang gi ro dang myos pa'i mthu med par byas te /
analyzed: chang ma 'thungs na yang mi 'tsho ba tsam du thug na bskol ba chang gi ro dang myos pa'i mthu med par byas te /
translated: If he is in danger of dying and there is no other remedy, he may drink alcohol that has been boiled until it no longer tastes like alcohol and has lost its power to intoxicate.

original: chang dang ro nyams pa dang kha dog dang 'dra ba tsam bya'o //
analyzed: chang dang ro nyams pa dang kha dog dang 'dra ba tsam bya'o //
translated: It should be made to look like alcohol, but should not have the taste or intoxicating power of alcohol.🔽The story of the song, dance, and music

original: glu gar rol mo'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: glu gar rol mo'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Rājagṛha.

original: rgyal po gzugs can snying pos klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang yid 'ong gi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsigs nas dus ston chen po byas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying pos klu'i rgyal po ri bo dang yid 'ong gi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsigs nas dus ston chen po byas pa'i tshe /
translated: King Bimbisāra built a temple for the nāga kings Giri and Priyaṃkara and held a great festival there.

original: lho phyogs nas gar mkhan 'ongs te drug sde ci byed pa'i lad mo bzlas pa dang / drug sde khros nas dus gzhan zhig na dus ston byed pa'i gar mkhan la gnod pa'i phyir drug sdes bro gar byas pa dang / skye bo kun gar mkhan la mi lta bar drug sdes bro gar byed pa la bltas nas rol mo mkhan gyis rnyed pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: lho phyogs nas gar mkhan 'ongs te drug sde ci byed pa'i lad mo bzlas pa dang / drug sde khros nas dus gzhan zhig na dus ston byed pa'i gar mkhan la gnod pa'i phyir drug sdes bro gar byas pa dang / skye bo kun gar mkhan la mi lta bar drug sdes bro gar byed pa la bltas nas rol mo mkhan gyis rnyed pa ma grub ste /
translated: The people all watched the dancers and did not watch the group of six dance. The musicians did not receive any gifts.

original: 'tsho ba chad nas rol mo mkhan kha zer ba la bcas /
analyzed: 'tsho ba chad nas rol mo mkhan kha zer ba la bcas /
translated: Their livelihood was cut off and the musicians complained.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang / nyes pa ni glu gar rol mo'i sgra byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang / nyes pa ni glu gar rol mo'i sgra byed pa'o //
translated: The affliction was anger. The fault was singing, dancing, and making music.

original: glu gar de bzhin sil snyan rnams //
analyzed: glu gar de bzhin sil snyan rnams //
translated: Singing, dancing, and likewise, musical instruments,

original: sdom la gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdom la gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: should not be done by one who abides in the vows.

original: zhes bya bas dregs pa'i nyes pa spang ba ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dregs pa'i nyes pa spang ba ston te /
translated: This teaches the avoidance of the fault of pride.

original: de la glu ni shar dang gnad ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la glu ni shar dang gnad ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Singing is songs, melodies, and so forth.

original: gar ni rkang lag g-yob cing lus sgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gar ni rkang lag g-yob cing lus sgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: Dancing is waving the arms and legs and moving the body.

original: de gnyis sdom pa la gnas pas byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis sdom pa la gnas pas byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who is established in the vow does these two, there is an offense.

original: gzhan byed du mi gzhug ste byed du bcug @24a * //
analyzed: gzhan byed du mi gzhug ste byed du bcug @24a * //
translated: One should not cause others to do them,

original: na nyes byas so //
analyzed: na nyes byas so //
translated: and if one does cause them to be done, there is an offense.

original: sil snyan ni mchod pa'i yo byad dang rol mo'i cha byad do //
analyzed: sil snyan ni mchod pa'i yo byad dang rol mo'i cha byad do //
translated: Musical instruments are the articles of worship and the articles of music.

original: de gsil zhing dkrol ba rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: de gsil zhing dkrol ba rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: They are the various kinds of cymbals and bells.

original: de dag sdom pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sdom pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: One who is established in the vow should not do these.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni rgya gas shing dregs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de dag ni rgya gas shing dregs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because they are the cause of pride and arrogance,

original: yan lag 'khor bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag 'khor bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the cause of the turning of the limbs.

original: mchod pa bya ba'i phyir glu gar byed du bcug na yang glu gar byed du mi gzhug / lha dang lha ma yin gyi dbang pos mchod pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhabs kyi rdul la mchod pa gyis shig ces byas la byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: mchod pa bya ba'i phyir glu gar byed du bcug na yang glu gar byed du mi gzhug / lha dang lha ma yin gyi dbang pos mchod pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhabs kyi rdul la mchod pa gyis shig ces byas la byed du gzhug go //
translated: If one causes others to sing and dance for the sake of worship, one should not cause them to sing and dance, but should cause them to worship the dust on the feet of the Buddha, saying, “Worship the Buddha as if he were the lord of the gods and the lord of the demigods.”

original: yang na gnang ba ni sems can gzhan rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang na gnang ba ni sems can gzhan rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ;
translated: Or, the permission is for the sake of generating faith in other sentient beings.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi che ba'i yon tan bstod ra rnams dbyangs dang glu bsres te byas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi che ba'i yon tan bstod ra rnams dbyangs dang glu bsres te byas na nyes pa med do //
translated: If one sings praises of the great qualities of the Three Jewels, mixing them with songs and music, there is no fault.

original: glu dbyangs dag mi shes te slob 'dod na yang shes pa khrid de gnas dben par slob tu gzhug go //
analyzed: glu dbyangs dag mi shes te slob 'dod na yang shes pa khrid de gnas dben par slob tu gzhug go //
translated: If one does not know songs and music, and wishes to learn, one should be taught by someone who knows, in a secluded place.

original: 'dir blu gar la sogs pa dngos su ma byas kyang chu la sogs pa la brda thabs dang lag thabs su byad na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir blu gar la sogs pa dngos su ma byas kyang chu la sogs pa la brda thabs dang lag thabs su byad na yang nyes byas so //
translated: Here, if one does not actually perform singing, dancing, etc., but does it symbolically with water, etc., it is also a misdeed.

original: phreng ba dang spos dang byug pa dang / rgyan 'dogs pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: phreng ba dang spos dang byug pa dang / rgyan 'dogs pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the story of garlands, incense, ointments, and ornaments is that the Bhagavān was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: de'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi dus ston byed pa na drug sde kha dog gis brgyan nas gar byas pa la bcas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi dus ston byed pa na drug sde kha dog gis brgyan nas gar byas pa la bcas so //
translated: At that time, when the temple festival was being held, the group of six adorned themselves with colors and danced, and were reprimanded.

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place is Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person is the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang / nyes pa ni rgyan phreng dang kha dog 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang / nyes pa ni rgyan phreng dang kha dog 'chang ba'o //
translated: The affliction is anger. The fault is wearing jewelry and colors.

original: lus la sbos kyis mi byug ste //
analyzed: lus la sbos kyis mi byug ste //
translated: Do not anoint the body with perfume.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka phyed dang gsum gyis kha dog gi nyes pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka phyed dang gsum gyis kha dog gi nyes pa ston to //
translated: The three and a half verses beginning with this line teach the fault of colors.

original: de la lus la spos kyis byug pa ni lus kyi mdog mdzes pa dang dri zhim par bya ba'i ched du aa ka ru dang 'bu sug la sogs pa dri zhim po'i rnam pa lde gu dang phye mar byas te lus la bsku zhing gdags par mi bya'o
analyzed: de la lus la spos kyis byug pa ni lus kyi mdog mdzes pa dang dri zhim par bya ba'i ched du aa ka ru dang 'bu sug la sogs pa dri zhim po'i rnam pa lde gu dang phye mar byas te lus la bsku zhing gdags par mi bya'o
translated: There, anointing the body with perfume is to make a paste or powder of fragrant substances such as aloe and camphor for the purpose of beautifying and perfuming the body, and to apply it to the body.

original: // de bzhin du tsandan la sogs pa mi bsku'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin du tsandan la sogs pa mi bsku'o //
translated: Likewise, one should not anoint with sandalwood, etc.

original: yung dang gur gum la sogs pas /
analyzed: yung dang gur gum la sogs pas /
translated: With indigo, saffron, etc.

original: kha dog rnams su ma bri'o ste /
analyzed: kha dog rnams su ma bri'o ste /
translated: One should not paint the body with colors.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis kyang lus kyi mdzes shing spa ba dang dri zhim par bya ba'i ched du lus la gdags shing bsku ba dpral ba la res su mi bya'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis kyang lus kyi mdzes shing spa ba dang dri zhim par bya ba'i ched du lus la gdags shing bsku ba dpral ba la res su mi bya'o //
translated: Even with these named substances, for the purpose of beautifying, adorning, and perfuming the body, one should not apply and anoint the body, including the forehead.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mtshal dang li khri dang / kha dog mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mtshal dang li khri dang / kha dog mdzes par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes vermilion, minium, and other substances that make the body beautiful.

original: me @24b tog mgo rgyan phreng ba dag / brtul zhugs can gyis gdags mi bya //
analyzed: me @24b tog mgo rgyan phreng ba dag / brtul zhugs can gyis gdags mi bya //
translated: The ascetic should not wear flowers in his hair or garlands.

original: zhes bya ba ni me tog brgyus pa'i chun pos mgo dang mgul du mi gdags shing spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gser la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me tog brgyus pa'i chun pos mgo dang mgul du mi gdags shing spang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // gser la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kyis //
translated: The meaning is that he should not wear flowers in his hair or around his neck.

original: bdag la brgyan par mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag la brgyan par mi bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He should not adorn himself with ornaments of gold, etc.

original: dge sbyong bdag nyid gser dang dngul dang mu tig la sogs pa nor bu rin po che'i rgyan rnams kyis bdag gi mgul dang rkang lag la sogs pa brgyan cing gdags par mi bya'o //🔽dud pa la sogs mig sman rnams //
analyzed: dge sbyong bdag nyid gser dang dngul dang mu tig la sogs pa nor bu rin po che'i rgyan rnams kyis bdag gi mgul dang rkang lag la sogs pa brgyan cing gdags par mi bya'o // dud pa la sogs mig sman rnams //
translated: He should not adorn his neck, arms, etc., with ornaments of gold, silver, pearls, and so on, which are precious gems.

original: mig mi na bar mi byug go //
analyzed: mig mi na bar mi byug go //
translated: He should not apply collyrium, etc., to his eyes, unless they are diseased.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge slong bdag nyid mig mi na bar mtshal dang gur gum dang ga bur dang dud pa sbyar ba la sogs pas mig la bsku bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge slong bdag nyid mig mi na bar mtshal dang gur gum dang ga bur dang dud pa sbyar ba la sogs pas mig la bsku bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk should not apply to his eyes collyrium, saffron, camphor, or smoke, etc., when his eyes are not diseased.

original: lus kyi mdog mdzes pa dang chags pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir me long dang chu dang ba la blta bar mi bya /
analyzed: lus kyi mdog mdzes pa dang chags pa skye bar bya ba'i phyir me long dang chu dang ba la blta bar mi bya /
translated: He should not look in a mirror or in clear water to make his complexion beautiful or to arouse passion.

original: sen mo mi bcos /
analyzed: sen mo mi bcos /
translated: He should not clip his nails.

original: chags pa'i bsam pas so rtsil sogs pa bza' zhing mchu dmar por mi bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i bsam pas so rtsil sogs pa bza' zhing mchu dmar por mi bya'o //
translated: He should not eat with his teeth or make his lips red out of a passionate attitude.

original: g-yan pa dang 'brum bu'i nad med par lus 'jam pa dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir rdo dang so phag gis mi brud /
analyzed: g-yan pa dang 'brum bu'i nad med par lus 'jam pa dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir rdo dang so phag gis mi brud /
translated: He should not scratch himself with stone or tile to make his smooth and beautiful body free of scabs and pimples.

original: khrus chu la sogs pa'i nang du dri zhim po sna tshogs sbyar la mi blugs /
analyzed: khrus chu la sogs pa'i nang du dri zhim po sna tshogs sbyar la mi blugs /
translated: He should not pour various fragrant substances into his bath water.

original: yon bdag dang pa can 'ga' zhig dri 'bul te lus la mi bskur mi rung na yang yid bsrung ba'i phyir skad cig tsam bskus la yon bdag song ma khad du ma tshor bar dbyi'o //
analyzed: yon bdag dang pa can 'ga' zhig dri 'bul te lus la mi bskur mi rung na yang yid bsrung ba'i phyir skad cig tsam bskus la yon bdag song ma khad du ma tshor bar dbyi'o //
translated: If it is not suitable to apply fragrance to the body because some generous donors have offered it, he should apply it for a moment to protect their minds, and then remove it before they notice.

original: rims nad dang g-yan pa'i nad la phan pa'i phyir tsandan dang gur kum gyis lus la bsku dgos na 'jig rten pas mi 'phya bar bsku'o //
analyzed: rims nad dang g-yan pa'i nad la phan pa'i phyir tsandan dang gur kum gyis lus la bsku dgos na 'jig rten pas mi 'phya bar bsku'o //
translated: If one should anoint one's body with sandalwood and saffron in order to cure a fever or a skin disease, one should do so without being scorned by the world.

original: shing khri khru gang mtho ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gcig gis mthon po na 'dug pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
analyzed: shing khri khru gang mtho ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gcig gis mthon po na 'dug pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
translated: One verse on the ill consequences of lying on a high couch, etc.

original: shing khri khru gang las mtho ba zhes bya ba ste de la nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: shing khri khru gang las mtho ba zhes bya ba ste de la nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not lie down on a wooden couch higher than a cubit, etc.

original: ba so la sogs brgyan pa'i khri //
analyzed: ba so la sogs brgyan pa'i khri //
translated: One should not lie down on a couch adorned with ivory, etc.

original: dma' yang nyal khri bzang po la //
analyzed: dma' yang nyal khri bzang po la //
translated: Even if low, on a good couch, etc.

original: nyal la sogs pa mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni khru gang snyed du mi mtho zin kyang ba so dang dung dang rva las byas pa'i khri 'am /
analyzed: nyal la sogs pa mi bya'o // zhes bya ba ni khru gang snyed du mi mtho zin kyang ba so dang dung dang rva las byas pa'i khri 'am /
translated: One should not lie down, etc.🔽Even if it is not higher than a cubit, one should not lie down on a couch made of ivory, conch shell, or bone, or on a good couch adorned with those.

original: de dag gis brgyan pa'i khri bzang po dma' yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brgyan pa'i khri bzang po dma' yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even if low, one should not lie down on a good couch.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mal stan mthon po dang bzang po dang chen po la nyal na mal gyi bde ba la chags shing rlom sems 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du na bkra mi shis par yang 'chad pas nyal bar mi bya'o //🔽gnang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kha don du 'don @25a * //
analyzed: mal stan mthon po dang bzang po dang chen po la nyal na mal gyi bde ba la chags shing rlom sems 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gzhan du na bkra mi shis par yang 'chad pas nyal bar mi bya'o // gnang ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kha don du 'don @25a * //
translated: Moreover, it is explained that it is inauspicious, so one should not sleep on it.

original: cing 'chad pa'i tshe ni rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i khri la 'dug tu gnang ngo //
analyzed: cing 'chad pa'i tshe ni rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i khri la 'dug tu gnang ngo //
translated: The permission is that when one is reciting and explaining the scriptures of the Tathāgata, it is permitted to sit on a throne adorned with various jewels.

original: de la 'dug pa'i tshe yang chags shing bde ba'i bsam pas ni 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dug pa'i tshe yang chags shing bde ba'i bsam pas ni 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: Even when sitting on that, one should not sit with thoughts of attachment and comfort.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin par bsams te 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin par bsams te 'dug par bya'o //
translated: One should sit contemplating that all conditioned things are momentary and impermanent.

original: gding ba ko lpags 'chang ba gnang ba ni yul mtha' 'khob dang lhags pa che ba dag tu ni mal gos dang stan gnyis ka ko lpags las byed du gnang gi yul dbus ma ga dh'a'i phyogs su ni mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: gding ba ko lpags 'chang ba gnang ba ni yul mtha' 'khob dang lhags pa che ba dag tu ni mal gos dang stan gnyis ka ko lpags las byed du gnang gi yul dbus ma ga dh'a'i phyogs su ni mi gnang ngo //
translated: The permission to use a skin as a mat and a coverlet is for the border regions and for places with strong winds. It is not permitted in the central region of Magadha.

original: ko lpags bcang du gnang ba yang gzhan gyi gnang gi pa glang dang stag dang seng ge dang do ma dang dred dang rta dang byi la'i pags pa 'di bdun bkra mi shis shing /
analyzed: ko lpags bcang du gnang ba yang gzhan gyi gnang gi pa glang dang stag dang seng ge dang do ma dang dred dang rta dang byi la'i pags pa 'di bdun bkra mi shis shing /
translated: The permission to use a skin is for the skins of other animals, but it is not permitted to use the skins of the seven animals that are impure: the elephant, tiger, lion, hyena, bear, horse, and cat.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis smad cing dkon pa yin pa spyod cing 'dug tu mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis smad cing dkon pa yin pa spyod cing 'dug tu mi gnang ngo //
translated: These are despised and rare in the world.

original: nad kyi gzhi la phan na ni sman pas bsgo ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nad kyi gzhi la phan na ni sman pas bsgo ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is beneficial for the basis of a disease, there is no fault in following the doctor’s advice.🔽One should rely on song, dance, and so forth,

original: glu gar la sogs bsten pa dang // gang la dregs pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: glu gar la sogs bsten pa dang // gang la dregs pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: but not to the extent that one becomes arrogant.

original: dregs pa'i yan lag spangs nas ni //
analyzed: dregs pa'i yan lag spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the branches of arrogance,

original: brtul zhugs gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
analyzed: brtul zhugs gnas zhes brjod pa yin //
translated: one is called a disciplined one.

original: zhes bya ba ni dregs pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phan yon yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dregs pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phan yon yin te /
translated: This is the benefit of abandoning the fault of pride.

original: 'di ltar glu dang gar la sogs pa dngos po gnag bsten cing gnas na dregs pa dang rgyags pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i dregs pa'i yan lag gam dngos po de yang spang sna brtul zhugs gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar glu dang gar la sogs pa dngos po gnag bsten cing gnas na dregs pa dang rgyags pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i dregs pa'i yan lag gam dngos po de yang spang sna brtul zhugs gnas pa ste /
translated: Thus, if one relies on and abides in the things of darkness, such as singing, dancing, and so on, pride and intoxication will arise. One should abandon those things or limbs of pride.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One who abides in the vow is one who possesses ethical discipline.

original: nyi ma phyed mtshams phan chad nas / zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gsum gyis ni dus ma yin pas zas za ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed mtshams phan chad nas / zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gsum gyis ni dus ma yin pas zas za ba'i nyes pa bstan to //
translated: The three verses beginning with “after noon” teach the fault of eating at improper times.

original: de la dge sbyong gis zas za ba'i dus ma yin pa ni rang gi gnas 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed mtshams tshun chad nas bzung ste skya rengs ma shar bar du za ba'i dus ma yin par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong gis zas za ba'i dus ma yin pa ni rang gi gnas 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed mtshams tshun chad nas bzung ste skya rengs ma shar bar du za ba'i dus ma yin par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: The Blessed Buddha said that the improper time for a religious person to eat is from noon until dawn, when the sky is not yet light.

original: dge sbyong sdom pa la gnas pas dus der zas mi bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong sdom pa la gnas pas dus der zas mi bza' bar bya ste /
translated: Those who maintain the vows of a spiritual practitioner should not eat at that time.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore:

original: nyi ma phyed mtshams phan chad nas //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed mtshams phan chad nas //
translated: From noon until dawn

original: skya rengs ma shar dus min te //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar dus min te //
translated: is not the right time.

original: de ni rgyal bas dus min gsungs //
analyzed: de ni rgyal bas dus min gsungs //
translated: The Victorious One has declared it to be the wrong time.

original: sdom can rnams kyis der mi bza' //
analyzed: sdom can rnams kyis der mi bza' //
translated: Those who are restrained should not eat then.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: 'o na dge sbyong gi zas bza' ba'i dus gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dge sbyong gi zas bza' ba'i dus gang zhe na /
translated: What then is the right time for a spiritual practitioner to eat?

original: skya rengs shar nas phyed kyi bar //
analyzed: skya rengs shar nas phyed kyi bar //
translated: From dawn until noon

original: de yi skabs su zos na ni //
analyzed: de yi skabs su zos na ni //
translated: if one eats during that period

original: de ni bdag @25b shes sdom pa ste //
analyzed: de ni bdag @25b shes sdom pa ste //
translated: one is said to be restrained and mindful.

original: bza' ba dus su zos pa yin //🔽zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: bza' ba dus su zos pa yin // zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Eating at the right time is eating food.

original: 'di ltar rang gi gnas ni 'dzam bu'i gling du skya rengs shar pa nyi ma phyed ma yol gyi bar skabs der bza' ba zos pa ni bdag shes bzhin dang ldan pa sdom pa la gnas pa ste dge sbyong gis gnas bza' ba'i dus su zos pa yin
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi gnas ni 'dzam bu'i gling du skya rengs shar pa nyi ma phyed ma yol gyi bar skabs der bza' ba zos pa ni bdag shes bzhin dang ldan pa sdom pa la gnas pa ste dge sbyong gis gnas bza' ba'i dus su zos pa yin
translated: Thus, in Jambudvīpa, the right time for a spiritual practitioner to eat food is from dawn until noon.

original: te de ni dus yin no //
analyzed: te de ni dus yin no //
translated: Eating during that period is said to be eating at the right time.

original: dus min dus su 'du shes nas //
analyzed: dus min dus su 'du shes nas //
translated: Perceiving the untimely as timely,🔽

original: nam yang bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nam yang bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should never eat, thinking🔽that the untimely is timely.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyed mtshams phan chad du sa ma yin pa las dus yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes bzhag nas bza' ba rnams bza' bar bya ba ni nam yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyed mtshams phan chad du sa ma yin pa las dus yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes bzhag nas bza' ba rnams bza' bar bya ba ni nam yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should never eat the foods, thinking that what is not the proper time is the proper time, beginning from the afternoon.

original: dus ma yin par bzar gnang ba ni /🔽sman pas nyon mongs bsgo na ni //
analyzed: dus ma yin par bzar gnang ba ni / sman pas nyon mongs bsgo na ni //
translated: The untimely is permitted when🔽a physician orders it,

original: nad pas nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad pas nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and for a sick person there is no offense.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: snga dro zos pas 'tsho bar mi nus na phyi dro yang zo cig ces sman pas bsgo na nyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / lam du zhugs te dpag tshad gcig tsam du 'gro ba dang / mu ge chen po byung ste nyam thag pa'i dus su ni dus dang sbyar ba'i gtol med pas nam zas rnyed pa'i tshe dus ma yin par bzar gnang ngo //
analyzed: snga dro zos pas 'tsho bar mi nus na phyi dro yang zo cig ces sman pas bsgo na nyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / lam du zhugs te dpag tshad gcig tsam du 'gro ba dang / mu ge chen po byung ste nyam thag pa'i dus su ni dus dang sbyar ba'i gtol med pas nam zas rnyed pa'i tshe dus ma yin par bzar gnang ngo //
translated: If one cannot live by eating in the morning, one should eat in the evening. If a physician orders it, there is no offense. If one is traveling a distance of one krośa, and so on, and if there is a famine and one is weak, then since there is no fixed rule about time, one should eat when food is obtained, even if it is the improper time.

original: dge slong ba lang bdag bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pas mid pa gnyis yod par gyur na snga dro ni mid pa gcig nas nang du rgyu /
analyzed: dge slong ba lang bdag bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pas mid pa gnyis yod par gyur na snga dro ni mid pa gcig nas nang du rgyu /
translated: If, like the monk Govardhana, you have two necks due to the ripening of karma, then in the morning you swallow food through one neck and it moves inside.🔽In the evening you swallow food through the other neck and it moves outside.

original: phyi dro ni gcig nas phyir rgyu zhing za ba'i dus yin pas de lta bu ni dang po kham gcig gnyis tsam gyis phyir bor te slar kha bkru bar bya /
analyzed: phyi dro ni gcig nas phyir rgyu zhing za ba'i dus yin pas de lta bu ni dang po kham gcig gnyis tsam gyis phyir bor te slar kha bkru bar bya /
translated: Since this is the time for eating, you should spit out the food through the first neck and then wash your mouth.

original: de'i phyi ma phan chad bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi ma phan chad bza' bar bya'o //
translated: You should eat from the second neck onward.🔽Except for such cases, if a piece of food falls into the midst of your vomit, do not eat it together with the vomit.

original: de lta bu ma gtogs pa rnams ni sgregs pa'i khrod na kha zas kyi tshal ma zhig byung na kha zas dang bcas par mi bya'i brtags pa'i chus kha dag par bkru bar bya'o //🔽sa le sbram ni gser yin te //
analyzed: de lta bu ma gtogs pa rnams ni sgregs pa'i khrod na kha zas kyi tshal ma zhig byung na kha zas dang bcas par mi bya'i brtags pa'i chus kha dag par bkru bar bya'o // sa le sbram ni gser yin te //
translated: You should wash your mouth with water that you have examined.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gsum gyis dbyig 'chang ba'i nyes pa spang ba ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gsum gyis dbyig 'chang ba'i nyes pa spang ba ston te /
translated: The three verses beginning with “Gold is pure” teach the avoidance of the faults of handling gold.

original: dge sbyong gis bdag gi ched du gser sa le sbram dang / bdog pa la sogs pa dang / dngul la sogs pa ste rin po che rnams sbyin bdag rnams kyis de byin na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bdag gi ched du gser sa le sbram dang / bdog pa la sogs pa dang / dngul la sogs pa ste rin po che rnams sbyin bdag rnams kyis de byin na /
translated: If a goldsmith or a donor gives gold, silver, or precious things to a śramaṇa for his own sake,

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang mi blang la //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang mi blang la //
translated: he should not accept them himself.

original: gzhan yang len du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: gzhan yang len du mi gzhug go //
translated: He should not have others accept them either.

original: gal te de ltar ma byas par blangs na nyes byas te lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma byas par blangs na nyes byas te lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he accepts them in spite of this, it is a serious offense.

original: dge spyong gis khab ral dang gir shubs la sogs pa rva dang ba so dang rus pa las byas pa dang / gser dngul la sogs pa las @26a * //
analyzed: dge spyong gis khab ral dang gir shubs la sogs pa rva dang ba so dang rus pa las byas pa dang / gser dngul la sogs pa las @26a * //
translated: A śramaṇa should not use a needle case or a belt made of horn, ivory, or bone, or made of gold, silver, or precious things,

original: byas pa'am / gser dngul dang rin po ches spras pa la sogs pa gdags shing bcang bar mi bya ste byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: byas pa'am / gser dngul dang rin po ches spras pa la sogs pa gdags shing bcang bar mi bya ste byas na nyes byas so //
translated: or decorated with gold, silver, or precious things. If he uses them, it is an offense.

original: tshon mo steng dang zha nye dang khar ba la sogs pa la reg na nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshon mo steng dang zha nye dang khar ba la sogs pa la reg na nyes byas so //
translated: If he touches bright red lac, tin, or a staff, it is an offense.

original: 'o na dge sbyong gser dngul la sogs pa la ci nas kyang reg tu mi rung ngam zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na dge sbyong gser dngul la sogs pa la ci nas kyang reg tu mi rung ngam zhe na ;
translated: “Well, then, is it not the case that a śramaṇa should not touch gold, silver, and so on at all?”

original: bdag gis rung ba ma yin 'dis //
analyzed: bdag gis rung ba ma yin 'dis //
translated: I am not suitable for this.🔽

original: rung ba'i dngos po btsal snyam du //
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po btsal snyam du //
translated: I will use this to obtain suitable goods.

original: de ltar mngon par bsams nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par bsams nas ni //
translated: Having thought in this way,

original: de nas gzhan zhig len du gzhug / ces smos te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan zhig len du gzhug / ces smos te /
translated: he should then have another take possession of it.

original: dge sbyong gis bsams pa 'di gzhan te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bsams pa 'di gzhan te /
translated: The thought of the ascetic is different from this.

original: bdag gis gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba'i dngos po ma yin pa 'dis /
analyzed: bdag gis gser dngul la sogs pa rung ba'i dngos po ma yin pa 'dis /
translated: I will use this unsuitable gold and silver to obtain suitable goods, the three Dharma robes,🔽and a little gold and silver to keep for my livelihood, because if I do not keep them, my livelihood will be cut off. And I will keep them for the sake of medicine, because if I do not have medicine, I will be tormented by illness.

original: rung ba'i dngos po chos gos gsum btsal ba'i zong dang / gser dngul cung zad ma bcangs na 'tsho ba 'chad par 'gyur bas 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / sman med nad kyis gtses par 'gyur bas sman btsal ba'i zong gi phyir bcang zhing blang ngo snyam du bsams te dge bsnyen nam khyim bdag gzhan len du gzhug go //🔽yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po chos gos gsum btsal ba'i zong dang / gser dngul cung zad ma bcangs na 'tsho ba 'chad par 'gyur bas 'tsho ba'i phyir dang / sman med nad kyis gtses par 'gyur bas sman btsal ba'i zong gi phyir bcang zhing blang ngo snyam du bsams te dge bsnyen nam khyim bdag gzhan len du gzhug go // yang nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Having thought in this way, he should have another, a layperson or householder, take possession of it.🔽There is no fault if it is for the sake of the Three Jewels,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi ched ka dang // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod rnams kyi //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi ched ka dang // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod rnams kyi //
translated: or for the sake of those who practice pure conduct,

original: gser dang dngul la reg gyur kyang //
analyzed: gser dang dngul la reg gyur kyang //
translated: and he touches gold and silver.

original: nyes par gyur pa ma yin no //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nyes par gyur pa ma yin no // zhes pa ste /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du ste de'i dkor du gtogs pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhan po dang slob dpon gcig pa'i dge sbyong gi yo byad lta bu dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi yo byad du gtogs pa'i gser dngul la dge sbyong bdag gis reg kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du ste de'i dkor du gtogs pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhan po dang slob dpon gcig pa'i dge sbyong gi yo byad lta bu dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi yo byad du gtogs pa'i gser dngul la dge sbyong bdag gis reg kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for the sake of the Three Jewels, for the sake of their property, for the sake of the requisites of the ascetics who are fellow practitioners, who have the same preceptor and teacher, and for the sake of the requisites of the preceptor and teacher, if the ascetic touches gold and silver, there is no fault.🔽Again, thinking,

original: yang / bdag gis rung ba ma yin 'dis //
analyzed: yang / bdag gis rung ba ma yin 'dis //
translated: “With this unallowable thing,

original: rung ba'i dngos po btsal snyam du //
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po btsal snyam du //
translated: I will seek an allowable thing,”

original: zhes bya ba ni gser dngul 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs lugs su blugs shing ris su bris pa dang / dharma bris shing glegs bam du byas pa dang / dge 'dun spyi la 'bul ba'i bsams pas blangs na nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gser dngul 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs lugs su blugs shing ris su bris pa dang / dharma bris shing glegs bam du byas pa dang / dge 'dun spyi la 'bul ba'i bsams pas blangs na nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if one takes gold and silver with the intention of using it to make an image of the Tathāgata, whether cast or painted, or to make a Dharma book, or to offer to the Saṅgha, there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: dge sbyong gis khe sbogs 'dod pa'i phyir bdag gi nor gzhan la 'tshod du bcol tam /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis khe sbogs 'dod pa'i phyir bdag gi nor gzhan la 'tshod du bcol tam /
translated: If a monk, for the sake of profit, has another person work his merchandise for him,

original: gzhan gyi nor bdag gis blangs te tshong byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor bdag gis blangs te tshong byas na nyes byas so //
translated: or if he himself takes the merchandise of another and works it, he commits an offense.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi phyir ram /
translated: If it is for the sake of the Three Jewels,

original: de ltar ma byas na sman zong tsam yang med la 'tsho ba yang 'chad par 'gyur ba zhig gam /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na sman zong tsam yang med la 'tsho ba yang 'chad par 'gyur ba zhig gam /
translated: or if he thinks, “If I do not do this, I will not even have the cost of medicine, and my livelihood will be cut off,”

original: bsod nams bya ba zhig tu bsams @26b te tshong gi khe spogs bya dgos na yang bdag nyid kyis mi bya'i /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba zhig tu bsams @26b te tshong gi khe spogs bya dgos na yang bdag nyid kyis mi bya'i /
translated: or if he thinks, “I must make a profit from this merchandise for the sake of making merit,” he should not do it himself,

original: khyim pa gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: but should have another layperson do it.

original: de ltar bcol ba'i 'os med na yang bdag nyid tshor byed pa'i tshe bdag gis nan dang mthus mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcol ba'i 'os med na yang bdag nyid tshor byed pa'i tshe bdag gis nan dang mthus mi bya'o //
translated: If there is no suitable person to do this, then when he himself works the merchandise, he should not do it with force or violence.

original: rung gnam mi rung dga' mi dga' //
analyzed: rung gnam mi rung dga' mi dga' //
translated: “Is it suitable? Is it agreeable?”

original: zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris la /
analyzed: zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris la /
translated: He should ask this up to three times.

original: mi dga' ba med de rung ngo zhes zer na tshong bya'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba med de rung ngo zhes zer na tshong bya'o //
translated: If the other person says, “It is agreeable. It is suitable,” then he should work the merchandise.

original: pha rol po ma dad bzhin du nan gyis tshong byas te rin brtsis la thob na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po ma dad bzhin du nan gyis tshong byas te rin brtsis la thob na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one forces a sale to an unwilling buyer and receives payment, one incurs a defeat.

original: de ltar 'di yan chad du dge sbyong gi bslab tshig bcu po mdo tsam du bshad zin to /🔽// /'dod pas bar du gcod byed cing //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yan chad du dge sbyong gi bslab tshig bcu po mdo tsam du bshad zin to / // /'dod pas bar du gcod byed cing //
translated: Thus far, the ten precepts of a renunciate have been explained in brief.🔽The Buddha said that desire creates obstacles

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa rnams ni mo tha ris dang thar pa la bar du gcod pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu byung ba rnams 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brten pa rnams ni mo tha ris dang thar pa la bar du gcod pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa las /
translated: The Blessed One said that for renunciates, relying on the five sense pleasures creates obstacles to liberation.

original: nye dga'i slob ma dge sbyong tsher ma can dang mchod sbyin gnyis na re 'dod pas par du gcod pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: nye dga'i slob ma dge sbyong tsher ma can dang mchod sbyin gnyis na re 'dod pas par du gcod pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But two of Upasena's students, the ascetics Kanakavatsa and Yajnadatta, said, The Blessed One said that desire creates obstacles, but that is not so.

original: 'dod pa la brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te de'i don bdag gis shes so zhes smras pa las /
analyzed: 'dod pa la brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te de'i don bdag gis shes so zhes smras pa las /
translated: Even if one relies on desire, it does not create obstacles. I understand the meaning of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol te bka' stsal pa /🔽de skad du smra ba la dang por tshig 'jam pos smros shig / des ma btub na gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las kyis dge tshul gti mug ma smra shig ces bsgo zhig / de skad du bsgo ba las kyang ma btub ste de skad smra na dge 'dun gyis 'tsho ba'i yo byad du gtogs pa longs spyod rnams dang phral nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol te bka' stsal pa / de skad du smra ba la dang por tshig 'jam pos smros shig / des ma btub na gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las kyis dge tshul gti mug ma smra shig ces bsgo zhig / de skad du bsgo ba las kyang ma btub ste de skad smra na dge 'dun gyis 'tsho ba'i yo byad du gtogs pa longs spyod rnams dang phral nas /
translated: The Blessed One was informed of this and said,

original: gtsug lag khang nas bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas bskrad par bya'o //
translated: “First, speak to him with gentle words. If he does not stop, then request the saṅgha to do so. The saṅgha should then order the novice, ‘Do not speak out of delusion.’ If he does not stop even when so ordered, the saṅgha should take away his possessions and expel him from the monastery.🔽“

original: de ltar bskrad pa'i dge sbyong de ni dge sbyong dang gnyis gnas khang gcig tu nyal ba gnang ba de la med na /
analyzed: de ltar bskrad pa'i dge sbyong de ni dge sbyong dang gnyis gnas khang gcig tu nyal ba gnang ba de la med na /
translated: If the expelled monk does not have the permission to sleep in the same room as a monk,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang spyod pa gcig cing yo byad gcig pa dang / lta ba gcig pa rnams kyang de la med pas na /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang spyod pa gcig cing yo byad gcig pa dang / lta ba gcig pa rnams kyang de la med pas na /
translated: then he will not be able to practice with those who are celibate, share the same conduct, share the same possessions, and share the same views.

original: de nas ro dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //🔽'phyar dang rta gad byed la sogs //
analyzed: de nas ro dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //🔽'phyar dang rta gad byed la sogs //
translated: Therefore, he will be like a corpse.🔽He will be arrogant and deceitful,

original: 'chi bar bsams te mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi bar bsams te mi bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not do it, thinking of death.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni dul zhing zhi ba'i rang bzhin pas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni dul zhing zhi ba'i rang bzhin pas /
translated: As for the one who has gone forth, his nature is one of self-control and calm.

original: gdol pa dang ma rabs kyi chos lus kyi sgo nas mchong zhing brgal ba la sogs pa dag dang / ngag gi sgo nas rta gad drag po la sogs pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdol pa dang ma rabs kyi chos lus kyi sgo nas mchong zhing brgal ba la sogs pa dag dang / ngag gi sgo nas rta gad drag po la sogs pa mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he should not do such things as jumping and leaping with his body, or such things as loud and boisterous laughter with his speech, which are the ways of the untamed and the vulgar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'phyar ba ni ma brtags pa'i chos yin @27a * //
analyzed: 'phyar ba ni ma brtags pa'i chos yin @27a * //
translated: Because it is unbecoming for one who has gone forth to be unrestrained.

original: ba dang / rta gad dang gag tshil byed pa ni rlung 'tshub cing sngon shi bdag byung bas /
analyzed: ba dang / rta gad dang gag tshil byed pa ni rlung 'tshub cing sngon shi bdag byung bas /
translated: And because it is unbecoming to laugh loudly and boisterously, since it is a sign of agitation and a precursor of death.

original: de'i phyir 'chi bar bsams shing mi bya'o //🔽glal tshe lag la sogs pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi bar bsams shing mi bya'o // glal tshe lag la sogs pa yis //
translated: Therefore, one should not do it, thinking of death.🔽When yawning, one should cover one’s mouth

original: kha dgab par yang nan tan bya //
analyzed: kha dgab par yang nan tan bya //
translated: with one’s hand, and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: so snang ba dang gcan gzan chad pa ltar shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so snang ba dang gcan gzan chad pa ltar shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is very unbecoming, like the appearance of a wild animal’s fangs.

original: rgan la sbrid byung phyag bya ste //
analyzed: rgan la sbrid byung phyag bya ste //
translated: When an elder yawns, one should say, “May you live long!”

original: gzhon la nad med gyur zhes bya //
analyzed: gzhon la nad med gyur zhes bya //
translated: To a youth, one should say, “May you be free from illness!”

original: khyim pa sbrid pa byung ba dang // yun ring sos zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: khyim pa sbrid pa byung ba dang // yun ring sos zhes brjod par bya //
translated: If the householder becomes drowsy,🔽one should say, “It will be over soon.”🔽

original: zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las /
translated: When a householder sneezes, one should say, “May you live a long time!”

original: rgan pa ni bdag pas tshul khrims dang shes pa rgan pa'am mkhan po dang slob dpon no //
analyzed: rgan pa ni bdag pas tshul khrims dang shes pa rgan pa'am mkhan po dang slob dpon no //
translated: The elder is one who is older in virtue and knowledge than oneself, or a preceptor or an instructor.

original: gzhon pa ni bdag pas de dag gis dma' ba chung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhon pa ni bdag pas de dag gis dma' ba chung ba'o //
translated: The younger is one who is inferior to oneself in those qualities.

original: yun rings pos zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams ni tshe ring ba la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun rings pos zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams ni tshe ring ba la dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “May you live a long time!” is said because householders delight in longevity.🔽One should not

original: bla ma dag gi mdun dag tu //🔽snabs dang mchil ma mi dor zhing //
analyzed: bla ma dag gi mdun dag tu // snabs dang mchil ma mi dor zhing //
translated: sneeze in the presence of superiors🔽without covering one’s mouth.

original: so shing bca' bar mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin stan la mi 'dug cing //
analyzed: so shing bca' bar mi bya'o // de bzhin stan la mi 'dug cing //
translated: One should not chew tooth wood🔽in front of them,

original: mdun du bcag par mi bya'o //🔽gos gcig dag kyang bgo mi bya //
analyzed: mdun du bcag par mi bya'o // gos gcig dag kyang bgo mi bya //
translated: nor should one sit on a high seat🔽or in front of them.🔽One should not cover oneself with a single garment

original: khyed rengs su yang mi dbyung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyed rengs su yang mi dbyung ngo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: or bare one’s thighs.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang shes pa dang tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyis 'phags pa rnams ni bla ma ste /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang shes pa dang tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyis 'phags pa rnams ni bla ma ste /
translated: One who is superior in virtue and knowledge is a superior.

original: de dag gi mdun du ming gis 'byung ba de dag mi dor mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mdun du ming gis 'byung ba de dag mi dor mi bya'o //
translated: One should not discard the names that are in front of them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rabs smad pa'i chos yin pa dang ; ma gus shing bsnyems pa'i tshul yin pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rabs smad pa'i chos yin pa dang ; ma gus shing bsnyems pa'i tshul yin pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Because it is a contemptible, low-class practice, and it is a disrespectful, arrogant manner, so it should be abandoned.

original: so shing za na yang phu rung gis kha bkab ste bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: so shing za na yang phu rung gis kha bkab ste bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Even when eating a tooth stick, one should cover one’s mouth with one’s robe.

original: bla ma rnams la ji ltar bya zhe na /🔽rgan po rnams la sdom can gyis //
analyzed: bla ma rnams la ji ltar bya zhe na / rgan po rnams la sdom can gyis //
translated: What should one do with regard to the gurus?🔽The one who has taken vows

original: gus bcas zhe sar bcas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gus bcas zhe sar bcas par bya ba ste /
translated: should be respectful and reverent to the elders.

original: rgan pa gong du smos pa rnams la lus kyi sgo nas kyang gus shing zhi bar bya ba dang / ngag gi sgo nas kyang tshig 'jam zhing gsong por smra ba dang zhe sa dang bcas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa gong du smos pa rnams la lus kyi sgo nas kyang gus shing zhi bar bya ba dang / ngag gi sgo nas kyang tshig 'jam zhing gsong por smra ba dang zhe sa dang bcas par bya'o //
translated: One should be respectful and reverent to the elders mentioned above, and one should speak gently and pleasantly to them with words of respect.

original: bslab pa phra mo'i gnas bstan zin to /
analyzed: bslab pa phra mo'i gnas bstan zin to /
translated: The explanation of the topics of the subtle trainings is finished.

original: // / lag pa dag par bsnyal nas ni //
analyzed: // / lag pa dag par bsnyal nas ni //
translated: Having washed one’s hands well,

original: bum pa la sogs rdul med bya //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs rdul med bya //
translated: one should make the water-pot and so forth free of dust.

original: zhes bya ba ni zas zos pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zas zos pa'i 'og tu /
translated: This is said to be after one has eaten food.

original: kha lag legs par bkrus nas nang par spyad par bya ba'i chu btsag cing blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha lag legs par bkrus nas nang par spyad par bya ba'i chu btsag cing blang bar bya'o //
translated: Having washed your hands well, you should boil water and take it up for use in the morning.

original: chu'i snod bum pa la sogs pa rdul dang dri ma med par srog chags mad par brtags nas chu yang btsag cing blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: chu'i snod bum pa la sogs pa rdul dang dri ma med par srog chags mad par brtags nas chu yang btsag cing blang bar bya ste /
translated: Having examined the water vessel, such as a pot, to make sure it is free of dust and stains and that it is not inhabited by living creatures, you should boil the water and take it up.

original: chu btsag pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: chu btsag pa'i thabs ni /
translated: The method of boiling water is as follows.

original: srog chags yod na legs par btsag / ces pa'i skabs su @27b bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srog chags yod na legs par btsag / ces pa'i skabs su @27b bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, “If there are living creatures, boil it well.”

original: gnas med par ni gnas mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo bcu'am /
analyzed: gnas med par ni gnas mi bya // zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo bcu'am /
translated: Do not stay in a place without a monk.🔽This means that until ten or five years have passed since one’s full ordination, one is not allowed to stay in a place without a monk.

original: lnga ma lon gyi bar du gnas ma bcas par gnas su mi dbang bas dge sbyong rnams kyis gnas med par zhag gcig kyang gnas su mi gnang ngo zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lnga ma lon gyi bar du gnas ma bcas par gnas su mi dbang bas dge sbyong rnams kyis gnas med par zhag gcig kyang gnas su mi gnang ngo zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Buddha has said that monks are not allowed to stay even one night in a place without a monk.

original: dge 'dun mal stan la sogs pa //
analyzed: dge 'dun mal stan la sogs pa //
translated: Do not stay in a place without the saṅgha’s bedding and so forth.

original: dran pa med par 'dug mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa med par 'dug mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Do not stay in a place without mindfulness.

original: dge 'dun spyi'i mal cha dang stan khri dang khri'u la sogs pa ni shin tu spyad par bya ba ma yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos dran par byas te 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyi'i mal cha dang stan khri dang khri'u la sogs pa ni shin tu spyad par bya ba ma yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos dran par byas te 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: But it is not right to sit on the bedding, seats, couches, etc. of the community in general. Therefore, one should remember the impermanence of things, etc., and not sit on them.

original: de lta bu'i dran pa med par ni 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dran pa med par ni 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sit down without such mindfulness.

original: de lta bu'i chos yid la byed pa dang ldan pas 'dug tu gnang ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos yid la byed pa dang ldan pas 'dug tu gnang ste /
translated: One is permitted to sit down with mindfulness of the Dharma.

original: de bas na dran dang ldan na nyes med do //🔽so bkru ba dang chu btung dang // bshang gci byed du 'gro ba dang // mtshams nang ston la phyag bya ba //
analyzed: de bas na dran dang ldan na nyes med do // so bkru ba dang chu btung dang // bshang gci byed du 'gro ba dang // mtshams nang ston la phyag bya ba //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault if one is mindful.

original: de dag ma zhus nyes med do //
analyzed: de dag ma zhus nyes med do //
translated: There is no fault in not asking permission to clean one’s teeth, drink water, go to the bathroom, or bow to one’s teacher within the boundaries of the monastery.

original: zhes bya ba'i ming gis 'byung ba 'di dag ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la ma zhus kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽brtul zhugs can gyis bya ba gzhan //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ming gis 'byung ba 'di dag ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la ma zhus kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // brtul zhugs can gyis bya ba gzhan //
translated: This verse teaches that there is no fault in not asking permission of one’s preceptor or instructor for these activities.🔽All other activities

original: de dag thams cad ma lus par //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ma lus par //
translated: of the one who is disciplined

original: gal te bla ma ma zhus par //
analyzed: gal te bla ma ma zhus par //
translated: should be done after asking permission,🔽except in emergencies.

original: byas na de ni nyes byas 'gyur //
analyzed: byas na de ni nyes byas 'gyur //
translated: If so, then that would be a misdeed.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he does it, it is a duṣkṛta offense.

original: dge sbyong gis bsgom zhing bklag par bya ba dang / gos dra ba dang 'drub pa la sogs pa las su ci bya ba kun kyang mkhan po la zhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis bsgom zhing bklag par bya ba dang / gos dra ba dang 'drub pa la sogs pa las su ci bya ba kun kyang mkhan po la zhu bar bya ste /
translated: The novice should ask the preceptor about all the duties of a monk, such as meditation, recitation, sewing robes, and so forth.

original: gal te ma zhus par sna 'ga' byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te ma zhus par sna 'ga' byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If he does any of these without asking, it is a duṣkṛta offense.

original: mchod rten la sogs phyag byas te //
analyzed: mchod rten la sogs phyag byas te //
translated: Having paid homage to the caitya and so forth,

original: mi nyal byas nas de 'og tu //🔽bla ma'i rkang bkru //
analyzed: mi nyal byas nas de 'og tu // bla ma'i rkang bkru //
translated: having made the resolution not to sleep,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: he should wash the feet of the guru.

original: nub mo dge sbyong gis mchod rten dang sku gzugs la sogs pa la phyag byas te /🔽zhu ba'i gnas gang yin pa'i gang zag la sang nang par gyi bar du mi nyal bar dge ba rngo thogs tshad du bgyi zhes zhu zhing de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu mkhan po dang slob dpon gnyis ka dang bla ma rnams kyi rkang pa chu gtsang mas
analyzed: nub mo dge sbyong gis mchod rten dang sku gzugs la sogs pa la phyag byas te / zhu ba'i gnas gang yin pa'i gang zag la sang nang par gyi bar du mi nyal bar dge ba rngo thogs tshad du bgyi zhes zhu zhing de ltar byas pa'i 'og tu mkhan po dang slob dpon gnyis ka dang bla ma rnams kyi rkang pa chu gtsang mas
