translated: At night, the novice should pay homage to the caitya, the image, and so forth.🔽He should make the resolution, “Until tomorrow morning, I will not sleep, but will do whatever is possible for virtue,” and then he should do it.

original: bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: bkru bar bya'o //
translated: After that, he should wash the feet of the preceptor, the master, and the gurus with clean water.

original: bla ma la //
analyzed: bla ma la //
translated: To the teacher.

original: brtul zhugs can gyis kun zhus te //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can gyis kun zhus te //
translated: The one who is disciplined should ask about everything.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bla ma'i rkang lag bkru bar byas nas dge ba la sogs pa ci bya brtul zhugs can dge sbyong bdag gis zhus nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bla ma'i rkang lag bkru bar byas nas dge ba la sogs pa ci bya brtul zhugs can dge sbyong bdag gis zhus nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, having washed the teacher's feet, the one who is disciplined, the ascetic, should ask about what should be done, such as virtue, etc. This is the meaning of the one who is disciplined should ask about everything.

original: ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done?

original: rkang pa gnyis ka bkrus nas ni //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis ka bkrus nas ni //
translated: Having washed both feet,

original: nam gyi cha stod cha smad la //🔽bsgrims te mi @28a * //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod cha smad la // bsgrims te mi @28a * //
translated: in the first and last watches of the night,🔽one should be diligent,

original: nyal bya ba ste //
analyzed: nyal bya ba ste //
translated: not sleeping.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: slar bdag gi gnas khang du phyin nas /
analyzed: slar bdag gi gnas khang du phyin nas /
translated: Having returned to one's own dwelling place,

original: rkang pa gnyis dag tu bkrus te zhus pa bzhin nam gyi cha stod srod dang nam gyi cha smad tho rangs la bsgrims pa brtson 'grus chen pos mi nyal bar dge sbyor bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis dag tu bkrus te zhus pa bzhin nam gyi cha stod srod dang nam gyi cha smad tho rangs la bsgrims pa brtson 'grus chen pos mi nyal bar dge sbyor bya'o //
translated: having washed both feet, one should practice virtue in the first watch of the night, in the evening, and in the last watch of the night, at dawn, with great diligence, not sleeping.

original: de ltar byas na zhus pa bzhin dge sbyong des ni bden par smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhus pa bzhin dge sbyong des ni bden par smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one acts in this way, the ascetic, having done what was asked, becomes one who speaks the truth.

original: zhus pa bzhin du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du byas pa yin no //
translated: Having done what was asked,

original: ldang dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis //
analyzed: ldang dang snang ba'i 'du shes kyis //
translated: with the perception of rising and light,

original: seng ge'i nyal thabs bzhin du bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: seng ge'i nyal thabs bzhin du bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should lie down like a lion.

original: gnyid 'ong ste mal du lus phab pa'i tshe na yang bsam pa med par nyal bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: gnyid 'ong ste mal du lus phab pa'i tshe na yang bsam pa med par nyal bar mi bya'i /
translated: When sleep comes and one is about to lie down, one should not fall asleep without thinking.

original: myur du ldang ba'i bsam pa dang myur du sang cing snang ba'i 'du shes yid la byas nas seng ge bzhin du glo g-yas pa phab ste nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: myur du ldang ba'i bsam pa dang myur du sang cing snang ba'i 'du shes yid la byas nas seng ge bzhin du glo g-yas pa phab ste nyal bar bya'o //
translated: One should think, “I will quickly get up,” and, having thought, “I will quickly get up and have the perception of light,” one should lie down like a lion, on the right side.🔽With a mind of mindfulness and thought,

original: dran dang bsam pa'i rgyud dag dang // de bzhin myur du sad nas ni //
analyzed: dran dang bsam pa'i rgyud dag dang // de bzhin myur du sad nas ni //
translated: and likewise, quickly getting up,

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should do as has been taught.

original: de ltar snang ba dang ldang ba'i 'du shes kyis nyal ba ni dran pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba dang ldang ba'i 'du shes kyis nyal ba ni dran pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one lies down with the perception of light and getting up, one has a mind of mindfulness and thought.

original: des ni myur du sad cing ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni myur du sad cing ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one quickly gets up and lies down.

original: de ltar sad nas /🔽nam gyi cha smad mal nas langs //
analyzed: de ltar sad nas / nam gyi cha smad mal nas langs //
translated: Having gotten up,

original: nam langs bar du kha ton bya //
analyzed: nam langs bar du kha ton bya //
translated: in the last part of the night, one should get up from bed.🔽Until dawn, one should recite one’s texts.

original: zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub cing bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub cing bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should practice and meditate in accordance with the teachings.

original: phyi dro phan chad kyi bya ba bstan zin te //
analyzed: phyi dro phan chad kyi bya ba bstan zin te //
translated: The activities for the rest of the afternoon have been explained.

original: da ni tshig rkang gsum gyis dge sbyong gi bslab tshig bsrung ba dang / snga dro dang phyi dro'i dus su kha zas bza' zhing chu gtsang ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma rnams la lus ngag gi sgo nas bkur sti la sogs pa'i las su bya ba ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du nyams su blangs te bsgrubs na yon tan dang 'bras bu gsum 'thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshig rkang gsum gyis dge sbyong gi bslab tshig bsrung ba dang / snga dro dang phyi dro'i dus su kha zas bza' zhing chu gtsang ba dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma rnams la lus ngag gi sgo nas bkur sti la sogs pa'i las su bya ba ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du nyams su blangs te bsgrubs na yon tan dang 'bras bu gsum 'thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain that if one practices and accomplishes the activities of honoring the precepts of a spiritual practitioner, eating food at the proper times in the morning and afternoon, and honoring the masters, preceptors, and gurus with body and speech, one will obtain the three qualities and results, it is said:

original: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad nas //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs myur zad nas //
translated: How can afflictions be quickly exhausted

original: byang chub dam pa 'thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa 'thob 'gyur ba //
translated: and the highest enlightenment be attained?

original: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should be endowed with such effort.

original: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrims dang ldan par bya //
translated: One should be endowed with such effort.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin nan tan byas na tshe 'dir yang nyon mongs pa myur du zad par 'gyur la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin nan tan byas na tshe 'dir yang nyon mongs pa myur du zad par 'gyur la ;
translated: As explained above, if one practices earnestly, afflictions will quickly be exhausted in this life.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang byang chub rnam pa gsum las dam pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang byang chub rnam pa gsum las dam pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the future, one will attain the highest of the three kinds of enlightenment, unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: dge spyong gi k'a ri k'a lnga bcu pa mdo tsam du bshad pa /
analyzed: dge spyong gi k'a ri k'a lnga bcu pa mdo tsam du bshad pa /
translated: The Fifty Verses on the Virtues of the Monk

original: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon ka ma la sh'i las mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: Composed by Master Kamalaśīla is completed.
